description: Rich and rounded with a creamy texture, this wine is ripe with apricots and has a strongly mineral character. Full of fruit, the wine also has a texture that means it needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Among the most northerly of the run of Beaune premier crus, the wine is structured but the structure is cushioned by the ripe red-berry fruits to give a generous wine. Backed by tannins, the wine will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Perrières Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A firmly structured wine, solid with tannins and with structure. The wine is also full of fruit potential, ripe with red berries. It is dense wine that needs to age. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a structured wine, dark and firm as tannins meld with the ripe berry fruits. It has the weight to have great potential. The wine, with its concentration and dense tannins, will be ready to drink from 2025.
designation: Domaine Clos de la Chapelle Champs Pimont Premier Cru
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a ripe generous wine with soft tannins and already delicious red fruits. It lives up to the ideal of Volnay, rich and sumptuous, although with an attractive cut of acidity to balance. Drink this wine from 2022.
designation: Domaine Clos de la Chapelle En Carelle Premier Cru
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle En Carelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is a cool wine, with acidity and citrus fruits well in evidence. It comes from one of the higher premier-cru vineyards, giving a crisp and textured wine even in this warm vintage. It needs time. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Goutte d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This crisp wine comes from one of upper vineyards of the village. It is packed with apples and citrus, plus a touch of toast. With lively acidity, this wine will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2015 La Grande Montagne Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This young, textured wine shows a mix of strong minerality and ripe white fruits. The Albert Bichot Chablis domaine has a fine parcel from this premier cru. Refreshing citrus and tight acidity contrast with the warmer vanilla and yellow fruits. Drink from 2021.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaillons Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wood-aged and structured wine is concentrated and dense. It comes from the Premier Cru vineyard just to the west of the village. With generous tannins and juicy ripe red fruits, the wine is broad and going to be rich. Drink from 2023.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2015 Les Platières Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Powerful wine, structured with apple skin tannins, layers of ripe, spicy toast and a taut, mineral character. There is something of the Meursault richness here, in the full white fruit flavors, but this is also a wine that needs to age.
title: Pierre Morey 2005 Les Tessons  (Meursault)

description: Grapefruit, toast and white peach aromas give this wine a great start. It is not powerful but is deliciously balanced with fresh green plum and pink grapefruit flavors rounded out with just the perfect amount of wood. Drink 2010.
title: Morey-Blanc 2005 Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: With its rich texture, this could almost be a Chardonnay. The acidity and the steely texture makes the difference. It gives the wine an open fruitiness—very citrus and sliced green apples. The wine is fresh and deliciously crisp. Drink now.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2014  Bourgogne Aligoté

description: This is a new wine from this negociant house that specializes in limited production wines. It is a smooth and rounded wine, ripe with apples and yellow fruits as well as being cut with acidity. The wine is refreshing and crisp at the end with a touch of minerality.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is produced from vines aged 62–88 years old. It has ripe red fruits and soft tannins creating a wine that is generous and ready to drink. It is a blend of grapes from the flat lands beyond the slopes in the Côte d'Or. The wine finishes with acidity as well as attractive fruitiness.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Fresh and bright, dominated by its citrus and almond flavors. It has a soft, creamy texture, with highlights of orange zest, green plums and a great burst of acidity.
title: Louis Jadot 2008  Mâcon-Lugny

description: Ripe wine, pushing its toast, pear and apricot flavors. Smooth, with an English walnut taste, and green herb acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2009  Mâcon-Villages

description: A light, softly sparkling wine, its apple flavors laced with citric acidity, There is a yeasty edge, some bitter almonds and a final zing. Not for aging.
title: Cave de Lugny NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a soft, flavorful wine full of creamy yellow fruit. Hints of wood aging and a delicate mineral texture add depth to the palate, but this wine will age quickly, so drink now–2020.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: On the bright and crisp side, this is a lively, fresh wine, mingling green fruits with toast and a more opulent richness.
title: Bret Brothers 2008 Climat la Côte Rôtie  (Saint-Véran)

description: Rich and soft, but finely textured, great ripe swathes of spiced apricot and pear juice. A fine, delicious wine.
title: Vins Auvigue 2008 Hors Classe  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a young wine with a lean texture and stalky fruit from a Chablis-based producer. It feels cool with its acidity and red-currant fruits. Drink now.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2014 Réserve Saint-Pierre  (Bourgogne)

description: For an Aligoté, this is a soft wine without that crisp acidity. It is smooth, lightly tangy and with an easy spicy character. It is ready to drink, fruity and bright.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2015  Bourgogne Aligoté

description: This pale-colored soft wine has attractive fruitiness. Red fruits and a touch of spice are linked with gentle tannins. The wine is already gaining maturity and should be drunk now.
title: Cave de Bissey 2014 Le Clos d'Augustin  (Bourgogne)

description: Bright and fruity with touches of wood, this is a complex wine with good acidity, a crisp texture and a strong mineral strain. It is rich and will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014 Hors Classe Les Ménétrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: There are dark tannins here, although they are embedded in the ripe black fruits. This wine is solid and firm, the acidity giving the essential freshness. The fruitiness and the plush texture are taking their time to show. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Perfumed and juicy, this is already an attractive wine. Fine tannins and plenty of red fruits give a fresh and structured character. With a firmer background, it will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A powerful wine, packed with solid tannins, giving rich fruit over the hard, youthful structure. Black tannins and complex bitter chocolate and acidity suggest this is a wine that still needs time to knit together. The final is big and generous.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Grands-Echezeaux

description: Luscious and seriously structured, this is a wine that offers the dense texture of a Gevrey Grand Cru vineyard. It has rich fruit, touched by chocolate and licorice, as well as ripe black fruits. For aging over 4–5 years and more.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Mazis-Chambertin

description: Foursquare, almost chunky, the tannins dominate black fruits, dark chocolate and spice flavors. There is considerable concentration here, along with initial high acidity. Straight from bottling, the fruit is subdued. The weight of the wine, though, confirms that this is going to be a powerhouse.
title: Louis Latour 2008  Echézeaux

description: Firm and solid, this is a wine marked by blackberries, solid and dense tannins. The concentration will bring all the elements together to give an important wine, while never losing the 2008 acidity.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2008 Les Porrets St.-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Soft and ripe, with a sprinkling of pepper and spice, this is a rich, gentle wine. The tannins are open, lying under the lively black and red berry fruits. It will age over the next few years, but is not for the long-term.
title: Domaine Parent 2007 Les Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A powerful wine, offering a dark, textured view of Clos de Vougeot. It is muscular, packed with ripe fruit and a layer of spice and wood. Black plums and prunes provide extra, delicious flavors.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Clos de Vougeot

description: Relatively light and fruity with tight tannins. The wine has fresh acidity that still dominates the texture. There is a delicious spicy element that edges around the tannic core. It seems firm, not yet ready to soften into middle age.
title: Louis Jadot 2004 Clos Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Full of fruit, this rich wine packs plums and cherries into a style that is sumptuous, with great ripeness. The tannins are soft, sweet and roll well into the rounded structure.
title: Domaine des Comtes Lafon 2007 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: As so often results from this vineyard, this is a lovely wine, the fruit ripe and showing considerable sweetness as well as richness. The structure is soft, open and elegant, surrounding the core of sweet tannins. Not for long-term aging, but worth waiting 4–5 years.
title: Albert Bichot 2008 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Firm red currant and raspberry fruits dominate this smooth wine. The tannins, which lie underneath, give this round Pinot Noir essential firmness. This needs to age for 2–3 years.
title: Vincent Sauvestre 2010 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is ripe, structured and fragrant, with a touch of wood. It shows fine concentration and crisp, fresh citrus on the finish.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2010  Saint-Romain

description: From a property that is just below the Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru vineyard, the 30-year-old vines give a round, easygoing wine. The tight texture is really lost in the fresh pear and apple flavors and general ripeness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Billaud-Simon 2013 Tête d'Or  (Chablis)

description: This soft, ripe perfumed wine has a fine, clean texture of apple skins. Orange zest and a citrus acidity come through strongly in this wine that is bright and fresh at the end. Drink now.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013  Petit Chablis

description: Tight, crisp and fruity, this is a refreshing and bright wine. Lively acidity cuts right through the lightly mineral texture. Full of fruit, fresh and lively, this should be drunk now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2013 Domaine Lenoir  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Ripe and juicy, this wine comes mainly from vines in the Mâcon region. Attractive yellow fruit flavors are filled out with spice and almond, accented by refreshing acidity. Drink now.
title: Château de Pizay 2014  Bourgogne

description: Soft and creamy, this wine has a line of acidity that gives it great lift. Lime and ripe apples go with green plums to give both freshness and a tangy character. It's a wine to age a few months; drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Perraud 2013  Saint-Véran

description: Rich, deliciously fruity and ripe, this combines warmth with a more mineral undertow that cuts through the palate, creating a wine that is refreshing and mouth-filling. It would be worth aging for two years or more.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Domaine Long-Depaquit  (Chablis)

description: This is an attractively structured wine, with ripe strawberry and smoky wood flavors. The fruit continues through to the soft finish, which is laced with acidity and a firm tannic core.
title: André Guichot 2010 La Maladière Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Savory, juicy, refreshing and textured, this has a crisp green-fruit feel, and is full of bright fruit flavors. The finish continues to express the lively, tight character of the wine.
title: Bernard Defaix 2010  Chablis

description: A fruity wine from the lesser known Fixin appellation, this has strawberry fruit, soft tannins and a warm, rich texture. The acidity brings out a bright side to this approachable offering.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2009 Cuvée Signature La Mazière  (Fixin)

description: Exhibiting the roundness of the vintage, this is rich and soft. With notes of almond, yeast and yellow fruit, this is already maturing into a bold, open wine. Ready to drink.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2009 En Vesvau  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Soft, full and very rounded, this has yellow fruit flavors that are ripe and open, with its acidity emerging slowly. The finish is more focused and fresh.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2010  Mercurey

description: This is a ripe, full and fruity wine that is typical Savigny with its warm red fruits and gentle tannins. It's a rounded, already attractive wine that's full of strawberry and bilberry flavors. It can be drunk now– 2019.
title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Patrick Javillier  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is an elegant, smooth wine that draws out the freshness of the vintage as much as the fruitiness. It has ripe, soft tannins, juicy red-fruit flavors and an intriguing smokiness. With acidity holding the wine in check, it should age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2011 Montrevenots Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Already harmonious, this is a potentially opulent wine with a dry core surrounded by ripe red cherry and berry fruit. At the end, the spice adds a fuller note.
title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2011 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Firm in tannins, but bright with cherry fruits, this has lovely youthful acidity. Firmer tannins promise good aging over the next 4–5 years.
title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2011 La Colombière  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A structured wine, packed with red fruits and delightful acidity. There is a core of dark tannin and a solid structure as well as the bright freshness at the end. Because it has this structure, it's worth aging for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine des Croix 2011  Beaune

description: This wine has great strawberry flavors with soft tannins and sweet fruits. It's fragrant, delicate, and very pure in style, with just a hint of structure and likely to age over the medium term.
title: François Bertheau 2011  Chambolle-Musigny

description: A rich Pouilly Fuissé, concentrating on ripe tropical fruits and a rounded structure. The wine has weight, richness and a good density. With all these complex characters, it's a wine that needs to age over at least three years.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Clos Reyssié  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This rich and structured wine is packed with both ripe black fruits and concentrated tannins. It is a big wine, a fine representation of this appellation with its dense flavors and aging potential. The wine should be ready from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This ripe, wood-aged wine is generous and smooth. Spice and toastiness are balanced by the apricot and citrus fruits. One gives richness, the other crispness. It is a wine with a future. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Reversées Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This crisp wine is packed with delicious fruit and balanced acidity. It shows some of the richness of the vintage, but goes more in a tangy, mineral direction. With lively acidity, it is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: The wine has a good structure with sophisticated tannins and perfumed acidity. Black cherry and spice from the wood are balanced by the freshness of the acidity and the rounded aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Domaine Latour  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: With its spice and wood flavors, this wine is rich and deliciously concentrated. It has a bold yellow fruit and spice character that is warm and rounded. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: A rounded, ripe wine, this is packed with yellow fruits and touched with melon softness. It has toast as well as a mineral texture that give strong backing to the ripe fruitiness. This is likely to develop quickly, drink from 2019.
title: Jaffelin 2015 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This wine is full of acidity, with a crisp edge that's a delicious part of the riper fruit. The wood-aging spiciness is well judged to give a balanced wine that is generous and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2015 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Rich and structured, this firm wine has concentration from dense white and yellow fruits plus richness from the wood aging. This intense wine is still developing, so drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Ripe tannins and rich red-plum fruits give this wine a generous rounded character. Bringing out the generosity of this vintage, the wine is a balance between the broad fruits and acidity. In the background, the tannins give the wine extra weight. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The lightest touch of wood gives this wine a full, rich character. Weight and density are balanced by the intense acidity. Melon, apricots and citrus are all blended in this ripe wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Meursault

description: This perfumed wine comes from the home vineyard of the producer. With soft tannins and juicy red-berry fruit, the wine is straightforward, delicious and very much in the style of the vintage. It has a crisp end of acidity that gives it just the right lift. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: While Marsannay is mainly planted with Pinot Noir, there are small vineyards of Chardonnay, like this six-acre parcel. It has produced a fruity, ripe wine with a touch of minerality, along with wood and crisp acidity. Light, fruity and ready to drink soon.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011 Le Clos  (Marsannay)

description: A very buttery wine, it is soft, smooth and creamy in texture. Contrasting citrus flavors add a crisp touch. The acidity winds through the ripe fruit to give a bright edge.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2012  Saint-Véran

description: Lively, bright and very textured, it discloses fresh apple and pear flavors along with a more nuanced, honey character. The wine is developing well, giving great acidity while also promising fruitiness. Drink from 2015.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2012 L'Entreroches  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A structured, cool wine that is poised and elegant, it has a lightly creamy texture cut by apple and pear flavors. Definitely mineral, it is textured with fruit skins and flavored with the oak aging. It needs to be aged, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Réserve Personelle  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This attractive village wine has ripe fruits as well as a more steely texture. Wood flavors give smoothness that rounds out the wine and enhances the yellow fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2011  Puligny-Montrachet

description: While the wine is structured, it does also have plenty of ripe, juicy fruitiness that is already delicious. It's an open wine, rounded and rich in fruit flavor. The tannins are likely to smooth out soon, so drink from 2016.
title: Antonin Rodet 2011 Château de Mercey  (Santenay)

description: Bright and fruity, it's full of fresh acidity and has a strongly mineral texture. Green fruits, apples and pears partner with a strong citrus element. Wait until 2015.
title: Bret Brothers 2012 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Structured, mineral and tense, this is a classic Pouilly Fuissé. It has lemon and crisp sliced white fruits, very linear in character with a bright, tight texture. The wine is young and could age until 2016.
title: Jaffelin 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is an attractive and fruity, creamy wine. Flavors of ripe apples and pear juice are boosted by the nutty suggestion of bottle age and by a tight, crisp acidity at the end.
title: Jaffelin NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: The 50-50 blend of Chardonnay and Aligoté gives a tangy, zesty lemon-flavored wine. It has a textured character, crisp and full of the freshest acidity. It could benefit from a few months in bottle, so when you buy, wait a little.
title: Cave de Bissey NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Earthy aromas and a soft red fruit ripeness are dominated by wood and smoky spice. They give an unbalanced feel to the wine, not allowing much room for the potential of the fruitiness and acidity.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012 Epineuil  (Bourgogne)

description: Jadot's take on Burgundy Chardonnay is fruity and creamy. Juicy, intense acidity comes from the crisp apple and white peach fruits. A touch of wood aging softens the fruit and broadens the character of the wine. Drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Bourgogne

description: This 100% Pinot Noir rosé, produced in the northern Burgundy village of Saint-Bris, is packed with fruit. It shows a light touch of red cherry fruit and plenty of bright acidity. Along with the citrus aftertaste, this is a refreshing apéritif wine.
title: Robert Goulley 2016  Bourgogne

description: Produced from old vines in the Aegerter Domaine, this wine is dominated by red fruits and spice from wood aging. It is fruity, perfumed and likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Light and crisp, this wine has citrus and green-plum flavors. It is still developing, with plenty of acidity as well a perfumed character. Drink this attractive wine from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Petit Vallons  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This blend of Gamay and Pinot Noir, mainly from Beaujolais, is fruity with soft cherry flavors. Its attractive fruitiness and balanced acidity are immediately accessible and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Léon  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This wine is very soft and only lightly fruity. Some spice and touches of acidity give a crisp edge to the otherwise dull wine.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Mercurey)

description: This rounded, creamy wine is attractive, with rich apricots and balanced zesty acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Verchères 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: While this is almost ready to drink, with its fruity pear and apple flavors, beneath the surface, the wine is much more serious. It has a rich feel to it, touched by toast and a hint of honey, it has a firm wood aging character, a firm structure and considerable potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is the softest of the three single vineyard wines from Château de Fuissé. It has a warm, rich character, generous and full in the mouth. Yellow fruits are partnered with citrus acidity and an attractive layer of wood. The wine ends with the freshness of the vintage.
title: Château Fuissé 2011 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Named after the church which is next to the Brocard winery, this crisp fruity wine is lively with acidity, lemon and apple fruits and a light tangy texture. The wine becomes more ripe as it opens up showing peach and apricot flavors at the end. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Produced from vineyards in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this wine benefits from the ripe vintage of 2015. It has open red fruit and soft tannins that are both lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, this is ready to enjoy now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A blend of Gamay and Pinot Noir, this wine has qualities from both grapes. It has the bright cherry flavors of the Gamay and the rich, red-berry fruits of the Pinot Noir. They are finely integrated into this soft ripe wine that is ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Cuvée Terroir  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: The wine is soft and creamy. Made from fruit grown in the Mâcon region, it is ripe and with a good balance between citrus and melon flavors. The acidity and the attractive fruitiness have produced a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2015  Bourgogne

description: The Sacy is a rare variety found only in a corner of the Yonne Valley west of Chablis and in the small Loire appellation of Saint-Pourçain where it is known as Tressallier. This is a spicy wine with plenty of acidity and a crisp texture. It is fruity with green plum and a brilliant, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Gueguen 2015 Cuvée Confidentielle  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a fresh, fruity and apple-crisp wine that is light, buoyant with acidity and shot with citrus. It is lightly mineral, textured and with attractive crispness at the end. The Devillard family bottles this wine on behalf the estate's owners. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: While it does have the structure of a Pommard, this is also a ripe, rounded wine. Its sweet red fruits surround the firm tannins offering richness. A wine that will offer sold pleasure in 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Moillard 2009 Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A beautifully perfumed wine that shows some of the structure of a Gevrey but combines this with dark rich fruits and sweet tannins. There is a smoky flavor that balances the ripe red fruits and final acidity.
title: Domaine Thierry Mortet 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: A fresh wine with red cherry fruits giving a bright character, the tannins soft and with attractive acidity. It is lightly textured and should be ready to drink in 1–2 years.
title: Domaine Moillard 2009  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: Vines in the hills west of Nuits Saint-Georges are the source for this crisp red-currant-flavored wine. It has a juicy character, bright with red fruits. The wine will be ready from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Belle Canaille  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: Soft and fruity, this young wine is full of red fruits and attractive acidity. It has a core of tannins that will soften over the next few months. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This bright, fruity wine has attractive acidity plus crisp sliced apple and green plum fruitiness. It is open, soft and ready to drink.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: A deliciously rich wine, this is full of ripe fruit and rich wood and spice flavors. It is generous, layering peach and pear fruitiness cut with acidity. A tangy edge gives the wine an attractive bite. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Garenne  (Mâcon-Azé)

description: A bright wine, this offers attractive fruit and a crisp texture.The tangy, zesty edge is refreshing, giving the wine a delicious lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2015  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is crisp and refreshingly fruity. A lively texture gives brightness, and a light touch of acidity finishes the wine on a citrus note. Drink now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Spiced-apple aromas lead to a soft, perfumed wine that has a crisp, fruity edge. The apple and green-plum flavors give attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2015 La Cour des Bois  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is an open delicious wine, full of red-cherry and red-currant fruit with a touch of minerality to add texture. Some wood aging has smoothed out the crisp fruit and added vanilla to the mix. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: One in a range of wines under the Xavier Flouret brand, this wine is made by Domaine Hamelin in Chablis. It is deliciously refreshing, with just the right edge of crispness to give it a lift. At the same time, its ripe, creamy texture blends with spiced-apple fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
title: Xavier Flouret 2015 Marly  (Chablis)

description: This soft, ripe wine has good apricot and peach flavors alongside the crisper citrus acidity. It is spicy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2015 Vignes Blances  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine is juicy with intense acidity. Its red-currant flavor is consistent with this acidity. Tannins are firm and will soften. The juicy aftertaste gives the wine crispness.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This fruity wine is full of bright acidity. Crisp and clean, it shows yellow fruits and a shot of citrus. The aftertaste is lively and bright. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2016 Clos de la Bressande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Bright and fruity, this delicious wine is crisp, clean and refreshing. With yellow fruits followed by zesty acidity, it's both open and textured. Drink now.
title: Domaine Touzot 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the vineyards behind the Côtes de Nuits, this wine is warm, smooth and ripe. It offers yellow fruits as well as rich apple and enough acidity to give a crisp edge. It's attractive and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A touch of wood aging gives this wine richness, aided by the ripe fruit of the vintage. The wine is full with citrus, crisp apple and ripe pear. With its nervy texture and acidity, it needs to age a bit more. Drink from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: Very opulent, very rich, this is a complex, structured wine packed with fruit and brooding tannins. It is already rich, and will develop into a beautifully intense, concentrated and generous wine.
title: Domaine Dujac 2009 Clos de la Roche  (Clos de la Roche)

description: A sumptuous wine, rich in bright red fruits, with a structure and depth of flavor to match. The wine is gorgeously ripe, opening its heart quickly. Acidity, bitter chocolate and dark cherries go with the tannic core to promise long aging.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Musigny  (Musigny)

description: A structured wine, with great density of fruit, richness of  texture and at the same time acidity. Its black fruit and red berry flavors are pure and very linear while also giving the wine a full-bodied character.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Echézeaux  (Echézeaux)

description: The grandest of all white Burgundy vineyards, Montrachet has produced a powerful, great wine, with impressive ripe, dense fruit. There is still elegance, a sense of proportion, but the opulence of the Chardonnay here is impossible to resist.
title: Louis Latour 2009  Montrachet

description: A powerful, classic Chambertin, intensely structured and tannic. The sweet black fruit is potentially enormous, still finding its place among the tannins. Spice, with a mineral streak, gives the wine added complexity. Very dense in texture, this will age 10 years and many more.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Chambertin  (Chambertin)

description: A very rich wine, showing all the opulence of 2009. Black plums, damsons and wood flavors are already combined and integrated. The acidity in all this richness and power seems low, leaving the tannins to support aging.
title: Domaine Dujac 2009 Clos de Saint-Denis  (Clos Saint-Denis)

description: This wine is structured, with a strongly tannic character that's both fruity and tangy. A deliciously refreshing, zesty character gives lightness and lively acidity. Minerality cuts through to give a strong texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Sophie Cinier 2013 Collection  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Intense fruit and acidity give this wine a brightly refreshing character. It's about lemon and lime flavors with slices of red apple to bring out more sweetness. The aftertaste has a mineral edge that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013  Saint-Véran

description: Named after the almost gold appearance of the Chardonnay vines at harvest time, this is a soft wine, with hints of the mineral tang that embodies Pouilly Fuissé. It has pear and white peach fruit flavors, soft and ready to drink.
title: Labouré-Roi 2010 Vallon d'Or  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Coming from the more northerly parts of Burgundy, this is cool Chardonnay, with steel and minerality. It is firmly textured, its apple and quince flavors coming with a more citrus element.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2010  Bourgogne

description: A wine that reveals a textured side of Meursault. It has weight, ripe apricot and pineapple fruit with a refreshing touch of acidity. But the chalky, mineral character equally defines the wine. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Louis Jadot 2009 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This unusual blend, occasionally found in Alsace, gives a wine that is full and perfumed. It offers almond and spice flavors along with a tight texture. The wine, with its warm acidity, is ready to drink.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Saveurs de Lyre

description: This soft wine has gentle ripe white fruits and lemon-juice flavors. It ends fresh and crisp, with a touch of creaminess to add richness. Drink now.
title: Verget 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is round and ripe. It offers spice and acidity along with warm apple flavors, with a light touch of minerality at the end. Drink now.
title: Vins Auvigue 2014  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Ripe and smooth, this rich wine has enough fruitiness and acidity to give a crisper edge, although it is more about a warm, spicy character. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This is a bright, spicy wine full of citrus flavors, with attractive toast and acidity. It's lively, with a tangy backbone that gives a really crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Olivier Merlin 2014  Saint-Véran

description: Smooth and generous, this wine is soft and missing any bite. It is round and unfocused, but ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Le Clos Devouluet Durand-les-Verchès  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This open, fruity wine has a soft side. Apples and pears are prominent along with a touch of spice. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers
title: Pascal Rollet 2014 Domaine de la Chapelle Les Perriers  (Saint-Véran)

description: A finely balanced wine, bringing together the new wood flavors with structured tropical fruits. Plangent acidity is the binding agent, giving an excitingly refreshing wine with a bright finish.
title: Pierre André 2008 Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Although it is better known for its reds, Santenay does produce white wine. This soft, generous, yellow fruit-flavored wine has fine acidity, layers of toast, a golden glow offering drinking pleasure now.
title: Château de la Crée 2008 Beaurepaire  (Santenay)

description: Slow to show its quality, with a little aeration this becomes a superripe wine, its wood element dominated by the intense tropical fruits. There is some balancing restraint in the citrus character, along with the acidity. Enjoy now.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2009 Vieilles Vignes  (Meursault)

description: This is a hard-edged wine, a typical trait of young Pommard. It has a firm, dry and tannic character, and the ripe, generous fruit sits underneath. Wait for at least five years for this wine to be ready.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2010 Clos Blanc Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Full bodied and ripe, this Chardonnay is packed with yellow fruit and pear flavors, and it shows the steely, minerally character typical of Chablis. It has a youthful brightness on the finish, and it will fill out over the next few months.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011 Vieilles Vignes Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Better known for its red wines, Ladoix's whites are a rarity. This wine is made from fruit sourced from vines that are close to the Corton hill. It is steely, minerally and crisp, with a wood-influenced character. With its structure, this needs at least three years of aging.
title: Louis Jadot 2010 Le Clou d'Orge  (Ladoix)

description: This is a ripe wine, with flavors of apple, pear, caramel and a touch of mineral that is subordinate to the fruit. It is lightly toasty, and the acidity is crisp.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With a proportion of premier cru grapes in the blend, this wine has weight and structure as well as the ripe red-fruit flavors that are typical of Santenay. It's richly textured and full in the mouth. The finish is fruity and soft.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Santenay

description: Aromatic and ripe, this Chardonnay has creamy pear and apricot flavors, plus touches of wood and a warm, rich mouthfeel. It has a soft character, a hint of acidity and lemony freshness.
designation: Château de Rully Saint Jacques Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2011 Château de Rully Saint Jacques Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: Bright and fruity, this is a wine to be enjoyed now. It's crisp acidity, but concentrated with creamed-apple flavors and broadened by a touch of wood.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Prestige  (Bourgogne)

description: Just next door to the Corton Grand Cru vines, this vineyard can produce wines of equal quality. This wine certainly has something of the richness and structure, giving it concentration and longevity. Ripe red fruits are cut by dark tannins and equal acidity, allowing the wine to mature slowly and well. Drink from 2020.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Les Petites Lolières Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This wine comes from a vineyard that is wholly owned by Chanson. It is juicy, ripe while having a great, straight line of acidity. The red-berry fruits are still developing and coming through the firm, smoky dark tannins. The wine, with its spicy aftertaste, will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013 Clos des Fèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This rich wine is dense with dark tannins and concentrated structure. The vineyard, with cool winds from the valley behind, gives wines that demand aging with their tannins and fragrant fruit. The aftertaste is full of promise. Drink after 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This is a rich, smoky and structured wine. Black fruit and dark tannins form a dense texture with touches of licorice, spice and dark concentration. The acidity hints at the vintage giving a touch of freshness and lift. Drink this powerful wine from 2024
designation: Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This wine is perfumed with cherries and red berries. Its structure, which is certainly there, is almost secondary to this brilliant fruit. Balanced with a mineral dryness, the wine is certainly going to age into a ripe, pure-fruited wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A flagship of the Faiveley range, this is a structured wine with great acidity and beautiful perfumes. The wine is dense, already balanced with the red fruits shining through the tannins. It will develop slowly and will not be ready to drink before 2023.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos des Cortons Faiveley  (Corton)

description: A soft, yet also mineral-textured wine. Its lemon and grapefruit flavors are crisp, reflecting the taut structure of the vintage. A fresh wine, with a crisp finish, ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2010  Mâcon-Villages

description: Butter and toast flavors give this wine extra richness and some weight. At the same time, the textured citrus and grapefruit flavors combine with the wine's minerality to give a more lively aftertaste.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2010  Chablis

description: Full of yellow fruits, ripe apples and soft acidity, this is a rich wine with hints of spice and also attractive, perfumed acidity. It has a tangy, zesty character that is attractive and refreshing. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Collotte 2014  Marsannay

description: From a single vineyard just behind the line of Grand Cru vineyards, this is superior Chablis, wood aging bringing an attractive toasty character. It has green plum fruits to give balancing freshness. Ready to drink.
title: Romain Bouchard 2008 Le Grand Bois  (Chablis)

description: A delightful, light, strawberry wine. It has a bright, bubbly character and acidity that gives extra life to this classic apéritif wine. There is just a hint of softness from the fruit to finish.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Rosé Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Jessiaume is based in Santenay and the wine shows the attraction of this village at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune. It reveals soft fruit, warmed by a jammy layer of red berries and ripe acidity.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2008  Santenay

description: Ripe and creamy, this wine is full of rich apricot, peach and mango flavors. The wood aging shows through in the form of exotic vanilla. Brisk with acidity, the palate is light and crisp, finishing with refreshing minerality. It's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2011 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Crisp with brisk acidity, yet bright with citrus and yellow fruit, this wine shows structure as well as warmth. It's a textured wine that can age over the medium term. Drink now–2018.
designation: Cuvée Signature Les Macherelles Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature Les Macherelles Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Celebrating the founding in 1875 of Antonin Rodet, this ripe, perfumed wine has red fruits that are opulent, gloriously drinkable already. It's ripe, softly textured, layered with delicate acidity.
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Héritage Rodet  (Mercurey)

description: Soft and rich, a wine that shows the warmth of the vintage in this southern Burgundy appellation. It's full of yellow fruits with just a hint of pineapple along with a good line in acidity. A sense of minerality and texture appears at the end.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2010  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Tight acidity with a strong minerality, apple and apricot flavors just touched by vanilla. This is fruity, while also textured and structured. Worth aging, so drink from 2015.
title: Damien et Romain Bouchard 2011 Broc de Biques  (Chablis)

description: The largest appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise produces here a foursquare, solid wine. It has red fruits, although the structure is what is dominant at this stage. There is a dry, smoky, meaty flavor that marches with the final acidity.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2011 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)

description: Still young with attractive fresh fruits, this wine needs to age. With its bright acidity and white fruits, it's just beginning to hint at the mineral structure behind. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2013 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is rounded, rich, missing some acidity but with the compensation of ripe yellow fruits layered with pineapple and spice from wood. With all its sweetness, it is not for aging.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2009 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: This is full of fruit and weighty tannins. Coming from one of the finest vineyards in Burgundy, it is going to have great power and an opulent nature. This wine also has elegance, its black fruits controlled and with a mineral edge. That doesn't take away the power, it enhances the stylishness of this grand wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011  Chambertin

description: Initially, this is a richly ripe wine with tropical fruit flavors. It also has an immense sense of structure that supports the fruit impressively. It's dense, concentrated, exuding power and solidity, while always keeping a sense of elegance. Drink from 2018.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: This is powerful and rich, allowing just a note of freshness to creep into the firm structure. Dark tannins, black fruits and smoky wood flavors combine harmoniously, lending a sense of great power and long-term aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Le Corton  (Corton)

description: This fresh, fruity wine is full of red cherry and berry flavors. A light touch of tannin holds the fruit and acidity together. It's a fine, simple Burgundy, ready to be drunk now.
title: Louis Max 2013 Beaucharme  (Bourgogne)

description: Blending Pinot Noir and Gamay, this wine comes from a new Burgundy-wide appellation that can include fruit from Beaujolais. It's a style of wine that needs to be drunk young and fruity, with black cherry flavors and refreshing acidity. Drink this lively wine now.
title: Louis Max 2014  Coteaux Bourguignons

description: Pleasant, soft wine, easy to drink, its fruits round and somewhat dilute. It doesn't resonate, but is certainly fresh and crisp.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2007  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

description: Lightweight wine that seems somewhat dilute with flavors of green plums, bright acidity and a very soft texture.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008  Petit Chablis

description: This fresh, fruity wine also has a core of smoky tannins. It is both structured and offers plenty of bright red fruits. The wine is crisp, ripe with a dry core. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a delicious, red-fruit wine. Its tannic structure lies well behind the generous fruitiness. With a dense texture and good acidity, the wine will be full and rich. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2014 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: From one of the most familiar of the Meursault Premier Crus, this wine is crisp and mineral in character. It has tight acidity with apple and green-plum fruit that is laced by a light amount of wood aging. The wine is still young and will be better from 2018.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2014 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Crisp, tight and mineral, this classic wine has citrus and apple fruits filled out with creamed pear. The zingy texture is still young and vibrant. With intense acidity at the end, the wine could still develop, so drink from early 2017.
title: Château Vitallis 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From vines aged between 40 and 80 years, this is a lightly wood-aged wine, with yellow fruits that go with the spicy toast. Full, ripe, and nicely cut with acidity, it has a creamy, smooth texture. Drink now.
title: Château Vitallis 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: There is a fine touch of spice in this wine. Bright and tangy, it is also full with white fruits, ripe acidity and a warm while zesty character. Still young and zesty, the wine will soften over the next few months into something more rounded. Drink from 2017.
title: Christophe Cordier 2014 En Faux  (Saint-Véran)

description: This two-acre premier cru situated north of Beaune city gives smooth and rich wines. This bottling shows the acidity of the vintage while also having a full, round character, ripe with strawberries and crisp with acidity. The wine needs more time, so drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2014 En Genêt Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This wine has structure and tannins. With ripe apples and quince flavors, it is tight, tense while also full in the mouth. A strong background of acidity gives concentration and considerable freshness at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2013  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This is a smooth and rounded wine with ripe yellow fruits as well as a crisp, sliced apple character. It is fruity and warm with its ripe, full flavors. Drink this generous wine now.
title: Jacques Charlet 2013 La Crochette  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is soft and creamy with baked apple and pear flavors. A line of acidity gives freshness and a mineral edge, offering a texture that will allow the wine to age. Fruity and soft, it will be ready to drink from early 2016.
title: Louis Latour 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Tight and crisp initially, this wine opens up with spice, ripe flavors and a touch of minerality. Taut and textured, it needs to age; drink from 2017.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: A ripe, crisp, yellow- and white-fruit-flavored wine. It shows taut minerality, the flintiness you find in Chablis. The structure is dominant in what is still a young wine, but the fruit is all there. Worth aging for a year.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2005 Pur Chardonnay  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a light wine—fruity and with a soft texture. It has citrus and creamed pear flavors that are balanced with acidity. It's a wine to be drunk now while its fruitiness is still at its peak.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This is a crisp and fruity wine that has fine acidity and a tangy orange-zest texture. The wine is full of green plums and with a salty, bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Named after the parcel from which this wine originally came, it is delicate and soft. The apple and citrus fruit is light, cut easily with some acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2014 Collection Tiserny  (Bourgogne)

description: Petit Chablis comes from the plateau above the main Chablis vineyards. As here, it offers a light fruity style with only the lightest minerality and much more in the way of apple and citrus flavors. Drink the wine from early 2017.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2015 Blancs Cailloux  (Petit Chablis)

description: From a small appellation in the north of the Mâconnais, producing reds as well as whites, this is initially a mineral, citric wine, which broadens out with toast, fresh acidity and a good weight, with lychee and yellow fruits.
title: Henri de Villamont 2008  Mâcon-Mancey

description: Irancy produces lightweight Pinot Noir, emphasizing the freshest raspberry flavors, allied to soft, dry tannins. There is a smoky element here that is attractive. The finish, with its acidity, shows the crispness of this northern production area.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2006  Irancy

description: Tasting light, almost dilute, this is a pleasant wine with white fruit flavors and a light textured acidity. The flavors come slowly and the final acidity is only fleeting.
title: Mommessin 2007  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Its name a play on the Petit Chablis appellation (pas si petit means “not so little”), this wine has a ripe and fruity character. Crisp texture and lively, exuberant acidity carry its white fruit flavors into the finish. Drink now.
title: La Chablisienne 2015 Pas si Petit  (Petit Chablis)

description: For a Petit Chablis, this is serious and complex, with delicious ripe green and yellow fruits; there is a touch of caramel with toast just at the edge.
title: Domaine Vincent Dauvissat 2005  Petit Chablis

description: Without big oak or big fruit to make it ungainly, this is a real food-friendly Chardonnay. The delicate floral aromas and understated yet finely etched pear and almond flavors almost seem designed to show off that special weekend dish you just spent hours making.
title: Louis Latour 2000  Beaune

description: This is a rich, rounded and concentrated wine. Good structure comes both from the wood aging and from the acidity of the apple and apricot fruits. Developing slowly, it will become an impressive, ripe wine. Drink from 2018. The grapes come from the highest vineyard in Chassagne, just under the woods.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2012 En PImont  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A crisp, almost herbaceous wine, this is refreshing, like a breath of fresh air. It's lively, light and fruity, and it has green- and white-fruit flavors that combine well. Drink now.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Bourgogne

description: There is a touch of spice on this wine, along with flavors of crisp citrus and green apple. Fruity and bright, this is already drinkable, and it finishes with a tang of lemon zest.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2010  Bourgogne

description: This Chardonnay is minerally and dry, and it has taut acidity and structured quince fruit. The finish is crisp.
title: Jaffelin 2010  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Open and inviting, this wine lays out traditional Chardonnay aromas and flavors of peach and citrus accented by toasty oak in a powerful and easily understood wine. There's a certain lack of finesse that's more than made up for by rich and expressive flavors.
title: Louis Latour 2000  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: This wine sees only 10–15% new oak, which allows the gritty peach and tangerine fruit flavors to shine through, dressed up by hints of toasted hazelnuts. White peaches and a powdered talc texture give the impression of richness without excess weight. Finishes long, with notes of mineral and citrus.
title: Louis Latour 2000  Puligny-Montrachet

description: This simplest, freshest and lightest of Chablis styles has a refreshing lemon character, a light touch of melon and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011  Petit Chablis

description: A soft and gently fruity wine that has simple apple flavors and an attractive level of acidity. The wine, with its warm fruit, is ready to drink.
title: Trenel Fils 2012  Mâcon-Villages

description: A beautifully perfumed wine, this offers a line of fine tannins and brilliant aromatic fruitiness. Cherries and strawberries show strongly against a backdrop of tannins and structure. The aftertaste, still with a hint of dryness, is round with great fragrant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013 Les Cras Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Big, firm and dense, this is a powerful wine, with dark tannins that give a dry, concentrated character. The juicy plum and damson fruit flavors, along with the fresh aftertaste, will be a delicious balance as the wine develops. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013  Clos de Vougeot

description: Smoky aromas hint at a wine with a strong sense of structure and weight. It is concentrated, still full of tannins, dark tension and acidity. Rich strawberry fruits are just a hint at the moment, leaving a wine with power and longevity. Drink from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2012 Les Baudes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Lightly smoky, this is an attractive, simple and fruity Chablis. It has apple and pear flavors balanced with soft acidity. Smooth and round, it's a wine for medium-term aging, so drink now–2018.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012  Chablis

description: Red berry and cherry flavors mark this bright, juicy wine. Soft tannins and a firmer extract show on the midpalate, along with vivid acidity on the finish. Drink in six months.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Grande QV  (Bourgogne Gamay)

description: This is an earthy wine that shows a rustic character. Still youthful, its fruit is obscured behind a dry, tannic, burnt-toast character. There is a future for this wine, as it should integrate with age, so don't try to drink until 2016.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2012 La Brigadière Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: This is an attractively crisp, citrus-flavored wine. With lime and ripe apple fruits, the tangy texture bursts with freshness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vins Auvigue 2014  Saint-Véran

description: Some firm tannins lie at the back of this dry, solid wine. It has dark plum fruits, juicy acidity and a fresher aftertaste. It's balanced and needs a little aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012  Pommard

description: Fresh and juicy, this is a soft and rounded wine. It has gentle tannins, along with stylish acidity and red fruit flavors. Already, it is becoming drinkable, so don't expect the wine to age over the long term. Drink from 2016.
title: Manuel Olivier 2011  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Set at 1,000 feet, the vineyard of Les Mouchottes inevitably produces cool and crisp wines with tangible acidity and strong red currant fruitiness. It's attractive and light, with a bright, fragrant aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012 Les Mouchottes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: A light-hearted Crémant from northern Burgundy that has fresh apples and plenty of citrus. It's crisp and very fruity, lightly textured, the ideal apéritif-style sparkling wine. Drink now.
title: Paul Delane NV Brut Réserve  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Soft and creamy, this has a smooth texture with vanilla and baked apple flavors cut through with full acidity. It feels rich, full in the mouth, fresh and ripe at the same time. Drink from 2015.
title: Romain Bouchard 2012 Le Grand Bois  (Chablis)

description: There is a bitter edge to this wine. Spice and tight acidity give a nervy, taut character. At the same time, fresh apple and citrus flavors come through. Give this wine until 2016 to soften.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a warm and round wine from Irancy, southwest of Chablis. Red fruits are sustained by some wood aging that smoothes out the stalky texture and spice. It's a wine that could age another couple of years to soften it further.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012  Irancy

description: Bright and light, this offers yellow fruits that are cut with citrus to give a clean character as well as richness. Drink now for its crisp aftertaste and warm texture.
title: Domaine de Biéville 2013  Chablis

description: While it does have some of the typical Volnay plumpness, this is a light wine that offers sweet strawberry fruits and a strand of acidity. At the end, red currant acidity delivers an attractive fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2012  Volnay

description: From vines that are up to 70 years old, this is a single-parcel wine. It is rich, with some good concentration and a mineral edge. Ripe apricot and apple fruits are combined with a tight acidity that suggests the need to age. Drink from late 2015.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Rich and rounded, packed with yellow fruits and pineapple flavors, this is a warm, opulent wine, combining toast and fruit. True, there is some minerality, but this Meursault revels in its ripe fruit and generosity.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Domaine Leflaive 2009 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: At this stage, the wine is all dark structure and very firm. It will need time to develop its full potential as an intensely rich wine. Concentrated and firm, it is powered by tannins as well as sweet red fruits. So age for five years at least.
title: Louis Jadot 2009 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: The wine is dense with fine concentration and a solid dry tannin character at the back. It is full of black fruits and balanced acidity. Its richness reflects the quality of the vintage and its aging potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: rich, fruity wood-aged wine, this offers ripe white fruits and plenty of smoky toast flavors. Acidity and minerality give the wine its distinctive tangy texture. These elements result in a ripe wine that will age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Abbaye de Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a ripe wine, soft on the normal tannins of this appellation and big on the black-cherry and berry fruits. It does have a firm core, cushioned by the generous fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Pommard

description: A ripe and full wine, packed with fruit. It has a toasty character, spice and bright red-berry fruits that give the wine its crisp acidity and balance the riper smooth texture that is developing. Give this wine until 2022.
title: Denis Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: The name, Mineral, says everything you need to know about the texture of this wine. It is also rich, generous and ripe with apricot and melon flavors. This easygoing wine has a soft aftertaste that makes it drinkable now.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2016 Minéral  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: This typical, fruity wine from Gascony offers lemon and herbal flavors and a crisply tangy texture. It's a light, breezy wine, full of fruit and tight with acidity. Drink this refreshing wine now.
title: Domaine de Millet 2016  Coteaux Bourguignons

description: Mango aromas bring out the tropical character of this superripe wine. It is soft and creamy, maybe too much so, since it lacks a crisper edge. It is ready to drink.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine de la Batie  (Saint-Véran)

description: A blend with 85% Gamay, this wine comes from the Beaujolais region. It has delicious red-cherry fruit and attractive acidity. The wine with its layer of tannins is ready to drink— fruity and bright.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This ripe wine has rich white stone fruit and only light acidity. The warmth of the wine comes from the ripeness and the smooth texture that will allow it to age quickly. Drink now.
title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2016 Les Trois Terroirs

description: This is a ripe and sunny wine full of tropical fruit and ripe apple flavors. Smooth and open, it has just enough crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2016  Mâcon-Vinzelles

description: Bright, soft and attractively fruity, this is an easy, open wine. An edge of acidity and minerality give the wine a good, crisp texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2015 Rives de Longsault  (Saint-Véran)

description: With its small proportion of Aligoté in the blend, this crisp, fruity wine is lively with acidity. Citrus flavors are given an extra fillip by a zingy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This soft wine offers ripe yellow fruits and a gentle texture. Bright with acidity, it also has peach and melon roundness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Michel 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Soft and ripe, this is a broad wine. Its tannins are enveloped by the rich plum and damson fruit flavors. It combines the richness of the vintage with the softness of a Savigny in an already delicious whole.
title: Maurice Ecard 2009 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This fresh wine is all about fruit. Soft tannins and attractive strawberry flavors are lightly cut with acidity. Coming from vines between 50 and 60 years of age, it has some extra concentration. Drink this fragrant wine now.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Montée de Tonnerre is considered one of the richest premier crus in Chablis, and this wine lives up to that reputation. It's ripe and full of yellow fruit, while maintaining its acidity and tight texture. Still young, its intense fruit and crispness will allow it to age for many years. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Billaud-Simon 2014 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Young vines give this wine a bright, fruity character, while wood aging brings out complexity and ripe yellow and citrus fruits. It's juicy and lively, with just the right minerality and tight texture to allow it to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2014 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This premier cru, surrounded by grand cru vineyards, has produced a luscious, ripe wine. It's generous in both black fruit flavor and structure, showing great potential for aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Jadot 2014 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This wine comes from less than an acre in Mâcon's smallest appellation. The result is a tight wine with a steely edge. Strong citrus and crisp apple flavors are lifted by the nervy acidity and finished with a shot of lemon juice. Let this wine calm down and drink from 2017.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat La Colonge  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This tight wine has acidity with a crisp texture and hints of the fruit to come. A potential for richness comes from the ripe yellow fruits that are developing. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean Curial 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This wine offers an attractive mix of mango and kiwi fruit, with a light structure. A fresh, fruity tang makes it full while also refreshing. Drink now.
title: Jean-Marie Chaland 2014 En Thurissey  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Tight and structured, this wine has minerality as well as tangy lemon character. It has a crisp side, with citrus fruits and attractive acidity. The aftertaste is bright with freshness.
title: Louis Max 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Named after the Lyre style of vine training, this wine comes from the far north of Burgundy, close to Chablis. It is soft, smooth and creamy, with a light minerality and perfumed acidity. It is just right to drink now.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2014 Quintessence de Lyre

description: Fermented and aged in tank, the wine is nothing but simply attractive pure ripe fruit. It has density and concentration that come from the generous apple and yellow-fruit flavors. At the same time, the wine is cut by delicious acidity and minerality. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Bègue-Mathiot 2014 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a ripe, smoky and generous wine. It has spice and wood flavors that are balanced with the red berry and cherry fruits and the crisp acidity of the vintage. With its rich character, it will age gently over the next few years and be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Petits Crais  (Fixin)

description: With only 100 acres of Chardonnay, Auxey-Duresses, which is located behind Meursault, is a small player in white Burgundy production. Yet the village creates distinctive wines that are rich and taut. This 2010 is structured and firm, and it has a fruity, crisp apple-skin flavor. It could age well for 1–2 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Auxey-Duresses

description: In the past, there was much more red wine than white wine produced in Chassagne-Montrachet. This firm, tannic wine, with its austere fruit, shows a similarity to Pommard. This is a wine that needs to age for over several years in order for it to soften and become round, and for the red berry fruit to surface.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A fruity wine, this has exuberant red-berry flavors that suggest this wine can be consumed now. Gentle tannins balance the fine acidity and rich, warm texture.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Les Charmes  (Santenay)

description: This has a minerally, tense structure as well as green fruit and citrus flavors. As the texture is quite dominant, let this age for two years to allow  the opulent fruit to surface.
title: Domaine Luquet 2011 Bois Seguin  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A spicy, full, fat wine, with a good citrus touch, this is made lively by the green fruit flavors, the edge of honey and the rounding toast.
title: Louis Jadot 2006 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A rounded, toast-rich wine, with the full creaminess of malolactic acidity very evident. This richness works, giving a sensuous, opulent style, just kept in check by the acidity, but very ready to let all its ripeness rip.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 Les Cortons Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This wine is full of rich fruit. With apricots, mangos and a layer of caramel, this is a generous wine with enough acidity to sustain its richness. The aftertaste brings in spice, vanilla and a squeeze of lemon.
title: Domaine André Bonhomme 2013 Cuvée Spéciale  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This wine is fresh, crisply fruity and toasty without missing the apple and pear flavors that give juiciness behind the texture. It's ripe and is developing well. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Ferret 2013 Les Perrières Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: One-quarter of the wine is aged in wood that leaves the merest touch of toast on the palate. The wine is ripe, hinting at yellow fruits along with an abundance of acidity. The end is crisp and tight, and the wine needs further aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Laroche 2014 Réserve  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine offers tropical fruit against a background of intense acidity. That makes it fruity, ripe with a tight structure that gives delicious lift and freshness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Smooth and creamy, this is round, ripe and attractively cut with acidity. It has white fruit flavors, pears and red apples giving ripeness. A light touch of toastiness adds further interest. Drink now.
title: Domaine Perraud 2013  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: Woody, toasty aromas are dominant here giving a full-bodied, spicy character to the wine. It is rich, but with plenty of acidity to give it good freshness. Bright while toasty, it will age. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2013 Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Soft and ripe with an attractive kick of juicy acidity, this is a perfumed wine with yellow and white fruit flavors. It has all the freshness a ripe wine needs, showing a tangy, bitter orange and lime aftertaste.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2013 Hors Classe  (Saint-Véran)

description: This wine is toasty, with an attractive vanilla and honey character. It's full in the mouth, with rich yellow fruits and a generous texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Guillot-Broux 2013 Les Perrières  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: Round, smooth and rich, this full-bodied wine has ripe fruit and a balanced acidity. It is more about yellow fruits, less about citrus, conveying a generous character. It is likely to age quickly, so drink from late 2015.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2013 Clos sur la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has simple fruit with fresh acidity, touches of lemon and a crisp, tangy texture. Still young, it offers a flinty edge and a steely aftertaste, both of which will merge into the apple and grapefruit flavors over the next few months. Drink from 2016.
title: William Fèvre 2014  Chablis

description: There is enticing new wood here, a wine that shows richness to boost the ripe, creamy apple and pear fruits. It has a generous character, to contrast with its core of steely acidity. The finish is more earthy, suggesting the wine still needs time in the bottle.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2007 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Savigny-lès-Beaune often shows the softer side of Pinot Noir. This wine has juicy red-cherry and raspberry flavors that balance the gentle, dry tannins. The low-yielding old vines from which the fruit was sourced give this selection extra concentration. This will benefit from medium-term aging.
title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Located on a high slope in Marsannay, the Vaudenelles Vineyard creates structured wines. This selection has a beautiful perfumed character, and it offers delicious red-berry flavors and lively acids that are striated by minerality.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Vaudenelles  (Marsannay)

description: With its upfront, ripe apple and pear flavors, this wine is immediately attractive. Behind the fruitiness, there is a firm, structured character of minerality and a steely edge, which makes this a Chardonnay to age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2011 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a smooth and polished wine, with herb and new wood aromas. It has juicy red-berry flavors, and the tannins push forward. Structured, with intense acidity, this is ready to age for at least 5–6 years.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: An old-vine wine, this is powerful, concentrated and impressively dense for a Marsannay. It is full of red plum and berry flavors, plus firm tannins that suggest this could age for several years.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2010 L'Ancestrale  (Marsannay)

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a beautiful, ripe and floral wine. It does have structure although the main focus is on the rich, juicy fruit. Berries and red plums push through the rounded tannins. It will age magnificently, with great richness.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Latricières-Chambertin

description: Big, juicy and smoky, this powerful wine comes from vines in the center of the vineyard. Black fruits and firm tannins dominate the richness of the wine with its dark structure and concentration. A touch of chocolate and licorice partners with the generous fruits. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: This wine comes from a vineyard surrounded by Grand Crus. It delivers a huge, smoky palate that is firm with tannins and dense with structure and fruit. The wine is rich, still shot through with the freshness of the vintage. Black fruits are balanced by the dry core of the wine. It will age well, and should not be drunk before 2022.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Aux Combottes Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Ripe and generous, this floral wine is dense with fruit as much as tannins. It is full of blackberry and plum flavors, ripe while also cut with acidity. The spice that comes from the wood aging shows well, adding a further element. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This wine is already well balanced. Ripe strawberries and red cherries are shot through with the acidity of the vintage. The tannins are present, complementing the already attractive fruits. The aftertaste shows the considerable potential with its tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Steely and tight, this is a mineral-driven wine. With its vibrant acidity and tense texture, it is a classic Chardonnay that will fill out slowly and evolve favorably with time. Beneath the tension and forward acidity is a rich wine, though it needs time to show it. Drink from 2020.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a rich wine from several parcels of vines in the Clos de Vougeot. It has great intensity, powered both by tannins and by the dark black fruits. Serious and concentrated, the wine will age magnificently. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: One-quarter of the Clos des Maréchaudes is classified Grand Cru, as the soil and the slope change. This shows in the power of the wine with its smoky tannins and dark character. Black fruits and a dense texture signify a wine with power and longevity. Drink from 2022.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes  (Corton)

description: With crushed strawberry and caramel flavors, this is relatively light wine, though elegant and pierced with acidity. Milk chocolate and soft tannins complete an attractive ensemble.
title: Camille Giroud 2008 Aux Cras  (Beaune)

description: Still very closed up, this austere wine has distinct aging potential, with its taut character, apple skin texture and hints of wood. It will need 3–4 years to show its best.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2009 Les Chaumes  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The relatively unknown Pezerolles Vineyard is at the far northern end of Pommard, touching Beaune above Les Epenots. It produces wine that seems softer than many Pommards, with rich fruit, the tannins firm but definitely playing second fiddle. It is the smoky plum fruit with just a dash of acidity that makes this immensely pleasing.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Les Pezerolles Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: With its sweet wood, dense fruit and jammy character, this is a rich wine. It has some solid tannins, but they are almost lost in the welter of soft strawberry, nutmeg and juicy red berries. Typically with 2005, this is a wine whose opulence appeals now, but those tannins do suggest some good aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Light in color, this rejoices in its perfumed character as much as its fruit. There is a heady smoky aroma, while the palate shows a leaner character. The fruit flavors of red berries are given an extra dimension by the smoky wood and the meaty edge.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2006 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The instant appeal of seductive Pinot Noir is here, with its ripe fruits that are poised between sweetness and a pure line of acidity. The fruit is juicy, but always fresh, with wild strawberry flavors and just some spice from wood.
designation: Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Exhibiting all the ripeness and richness of an Aloxe-Corton, this wine revels in delicious raspberry fruits, topped with red currant acidity. The wine rolls around the mouth, with a velvet texture on top of some firm tannins. There is a complex sweet and sour aftertaste, as the ripe fruit combines with fresh acidity.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: Soft, sensuous, this is a wine that appeals straight away to the senses. The red fruits float over a soft texture of sweet tannins, leaving a juicy, succulent texture. While it is not a powerful wine, it offers all the delicious characters of Pinot Noir.
