description: Solid and tannic, this is a full-bodied wine with potential. Ripe fruits are dense and juicy.  With both structure and fruit, this wine will develop well. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Alain Jeanniard 2011 En Combe Roy  (Fixin)

description: Showing some wood-aging aromas, this is a rich, tropical fruit-flavored wine balanced by acidity that goes with its peach and mango flavors. Ready to drink, it will be even better in 2015.
title: Domaine André Bonhomme 2012 Cuvée Spéciale  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Fruity and jammy, this ripe wine has structure and acidity, along with a good depth of flavor. It will certainly age and shouldn't be drunk before 2017.
title: Domaine Chandon de Briailles 2011  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: While there is a strongly wooded aroma, the yellow fruits shine through on the palate. Attractively rounded and soft, the wine has bright acidity, a good citrus touch and a feeling of lightness. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: With spice and dark coffee flavors, this wine shows some wood aging. It also has considerable acidity and the brightest strawberry fruit. Lively and fragrant at the end, it can be drunk now.
title: Domaine Dominique Gruhier 2011 Côte de Grisey Cuvée Juliette  (Bourgogne Epineuil)

description: Full of red fruits, it also has a strong structure and firm tannins. For now, the wine is textured and dense. It needs to age and broaden out to give a softer feeling. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine du Prieuré 2011 Moutier Amet  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Fresh and fruity, it offers a touch of citrus as well as acidity with pear and red apple flavors. The lightest hint of wood rounds the wine out. Drink now.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Les Villeranges  (Rully)

description: Warm, ripe and rounded, this is a soft and attractive wine. It has touches of wood as well as some firm tannins that are embedded in the soft texture. It's a wine that will develop quickly and well. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Roger Belland 2011  Santenay

description: A perfumed wine, it's very fresh and bright with strawberry flavors as well as a delicate touch of tannin. A delicious wine to drink now.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011  Bourgogne

description: Full and softly fruity, it has a rich feel, heightened by ripe apricot flavors. It's generous, but needs to develop to give greater definition. Drink from 2015.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2012  Saint-Véran

description: This wine comes from the Les Pougets parcel, in the heart of the Corton-Charlemagne vineyard. It is an exceptional wine that's concentrated and dense, with ripe fruit packed into a impressively structured parcel. Yellow plums and cherries, taut pink grapefruit and fine wood aging all add complexity and longevity. Drink from 2018.
title: Patrick Javillier 2011  Corton-Charlemagne

description: From half an acre of vines within the Blanchot Grand Cru, this is a smooth, rounded wine. It has weight from intensely ripe fruits, along with structure. Beautifully sun-exposed vineyards add a warmth to the wine, but there's also a mineral texture, nervy acidity and tart apple-skin and green-plum flavors. While concentrated, it's still a young wine, so drink from 2017.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Blanchot Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe, with a fine texture, this full wine still young, developing its fruit element while maintaining texture and minerality. Drink this crisply fruity wine from 2017.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Clos de Montrachet  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This crisp, green-fruit-flavored wine has refreshing acidity along with a tangy, citrus texture that is immediately attractive. A mineral edge gives this wine extra bite. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2014  Chablis

description: This wine is fresh with citrus and apple flavors, rich but showing good mineral texture. With its attractive juicy white-fruit aftertaste, the wine is full and ready to drink.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2014 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From organically grown grapes, this is a ripe, full wine. Excellent acidity binds the apple and grapefruit flavors. With a crisp texture allied to the ripe fruitiness, it is already balanced and very refreshing.
title: Maurice Martin 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: This tight, mineral wine is still waiting to show its fruity side. Hints of apples, pears and apricots are taking their time to unfold. With the toast and fruit potential, wait until 2017 to drink this wine.
title: Marcel Couturier 2014 La Cour des Bois  (Saint-Véran)

description: Tight and zesty, this is a crisp, citrus-flavored wine, full of fruit that is still developing. Give this attractive wine until 2017 and it will be delicious.
title: Vins Auvigue 2014 Chênes  (Saint-Véran)

description: Vines planted between 900 and 1,200 feet above sea level give this cool interpretation of Pinot Noir. The wine is crisp, lightly structured with some tannins and with a delicate cherry and red-berry fruitiness. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Very fresh and fruity, this wine from the north end of the Côte de Nuits has tight acidity and plenty of raspberry fruit, fragrant and perfumed. It should be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013  Fixin

description: The wine is too rich, losing sight of the fruit. It is so soft, lightly spicy and feels heavy.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This south-facing vineyard has produced a well-balanced wine. The tannins are gentle, enveloped by the juicy red-fruit flavor and the mineral acidity. It is ripe, full of fruit with a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 Les Crêts Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This spicy wine is ripe, fresh and richly fruity. Plenty of toast contrasts with the yellow fruit and grapefruit. This full-bodied wine is ripe, generous and ready to drink.
title: Mommessin 2014 Deux Terroirs Grande Exception  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Here's true “old vine” wine—from vines 75 years old on average—and it is ripe and toasty, with flavors of almonds, spice and baked bread. Fresh, crisp apples and green plums are lifted by a citrus aftertaste. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is textured, with a firm backdrop to the ripe white fruits. Acidity cuts through everything, giving a fragrant character. Drink this developing wine from 2018.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Ripe and creamy, this is an attractive wine that has forward apple, lemon and green-plum flavors. It's a lightly textured, vanilla-touched wine that can be drunk now.
title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2012 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: From a small village in the Côte Chalonnaise that specializes in Aligoté, this is a bright wine with delicious acidity and refreshing lightness. It's made to be drunk young and is ready now.
title: Louis Jadot 2014

description: Strong wood aromas and flavors dominate the wine at this young stage. Good fruit and a steely texture lie behind the toast. As those yellow fruits develop, it will become a delicious, while always structured wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château des Rontets 2012 Clos Varambon  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fully fruity right up front, this rounded wine has a crisp element that cuts through the richness. Peach and pear flavors contrast with orange zest and lively final acidity.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a warm wine with a rounded feel, making it soft and full of red fruits. It features strawberry sweetness as well as a tighter, more tannic character. It could well age, so wait until 2016.
title: David Moreau 2011  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: Warm and ripe, it offers bitter cherry fruits, sweet berries and a layer of firm tannins. It's already balanced and delicious with weight and structure. At the end, it is all bright fruitiness.
title: Domaine Chantal Lescure 2011 Les Mombies  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: The wine is named after a raspberry plantation, and that's what it tastes like. Small wild fruit, with their extra taste of ripe flesh, are in the glass along with delicious acidity. The tannins and the wood are all at the service of the fruit.
title: Faiveley 2005 La Framboisière  (Mercurey)

description: Rich and dense, revealing ripe fruit, touches of wood and firm flavors, and a delicious juicy interior which bursts through. It revels in this fruit, all red berries and fresh acidity. To finish, there is some toasty wood.
title: Morey-Blanc 2005 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This powerful wine features wood and the ripest fruit. It also has the solid structure of a Nuits Saint-Georges, creating a wine that is dark and impressively concentrated. It offers richness while preserving the fresh fruitiness of the vintage. Drink from 2017.
title: Benjamin Leroux 2011 Aux Thorey Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Ripe and rich, this full-bodied wine retains minerality as well as attractive acidity. Crisp lemon flavor is rounded out with peach and apple skin fruits. The wood, already integrated, gives richness and smoothness. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: In this rich, dense wine, firm tannins have already been smoothed by 50% new wood. It is solid, dark and tannic, a powerful wine that is ripe now and will reveal great fruitiness as it ages. From vines close to Volnay, it has hints of the voluptuousness of that village. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Chantal Lescure 2011 Les Bertins Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a soft wine on the surface, but under that generosity lies a firm core that gives the promise of aging. This powerful wine comes from stony soil which explains the tannic structure while the richness comes from ripe berry fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011 Les Teurons Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The wine has the right weight and power. It comes from a blend of different parcels, bringing out the complexity of the vineyards. Black fruits are soft and generous, supported by tannins as well as licorice and wood flavors. At the end, fresher red fruits show.
title: Louis Latour 2011  Clos de Vougeot

description: From the famous Chablis Grand Cru, this wine lives up to the vineyard's reputation. Steely in character, packed with a firm structure and tightly textured, it shows a citrus side that will be refreshing and attractive as the wine ages. But it does need time, so wait to enjoy until 2017.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a blend from ten different parcels of the Grèves vineyard. It's beautifully smooth, hiding its structure behind generous red fruits as well as a fresh, crisp texture. It's complex, warm, very perfumed and elegant. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Chanson owns four acres, a quarter of this premier cru. This 2011 is smooth, rich and very elegant. Fruitiness is striated by a mineral, tight texture that gives a touch of steeliness. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: With three acres out of 36 in this Grand Cru, Faiveley is one of the larger proprietors. The wine is firm and structured with solid tannins, while black fruits give acidity and freshness to this massive wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: From the village of Blagny, considered part of Meursault, this full, rounded wine has a generous character, full of ripe fruit. It is given a crisper side by good acidity, and shows both freshness and weight at the end.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Château de Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault-Blagny)

description: Rich and sweetly fruity, this wine wields intense power. Red fruits are initially opulent and pleasurable, but then the wine begins to show solid structure and concentration. The final texture, with its tannins and fruit in harmony, is impressive. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Cuvée Héritiers Latour  (Chambertin)

description: Perfume partners with great acidity in this wine. The two work in harmony, resulting in a wine that has a soft texture, rich, jammy berry fruits and a backbone of tannins that will allow for aging. Drink from 2017.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From a selection of parcels, this is a ripe and fruity wine. Vines aged on average 55 years have produced a ripe concentrated wine with opulent yellow fruits that are balanced by citrus acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Tourterelles 2015 Les Epinets  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Structure goes with red berry fruits in this light, crisp wine. It has a tendency to a tight texture and lean tannins. Ready to drink.
title: Domaines Devillard 2009 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Firm and tannic, this is a dense wine. Its weight and richness promise a good future. It is juicy, full of red-cherry flavors and with plenty of perfumed acidity. The wine will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Aux Clous Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Red-berry fruits dominate this already delicious wine. Allied with the acidity and the toasty wood aging, it is balanced while, of course, still young. It has potential, rich with tannins and with fine fruits. The wine is structured, needing time. Drink from 2025.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2015 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This crisp, fruity wine is packed with acidity as well as citrus flavors. It has a cool feel, beautifully fresh and with a strong mineral element. Drink this structured, textured wine from 2019.
title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2015 Sous Frétille Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. With acidity as well as a light toast character, it is already balanced, bringing yellow and melon fruit flavors into the mineral texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Buisson Battault 2015 Genevrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Very toasty aromas mark this wine. While the toast is present on the palate, it also offers plenty of fruit flavors, conveying apricot and white peach along with a citrus edge that brings out the freshness. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Buisson Battault 2015 Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Big, bold and rounded, this is a rich wine from a single vineyard. Red-plum fruits go with a plush texture that masks the firm tannins and dry core. The acidity and structure both promise long-term aging. The wine is still young, needing time. Drink this from 2022.
designation: Château de Chamirey Champs Martin Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Structured, ripe and with great fruit, this is a bold warm wine. It has plenty of rich berry fruits, ripe tannins and layers of spice and toast. With its concentration, this is going to be a rich wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is tight, with acidity that cuts through the red fruits and perfumed raspberry flavors. It is light and bright, with minimal tannin and just a hint of structure.
title: Louis Latour 2012  Rully

description: With some maturity, this is a rich, full-bodied wine. Its crisp fruitiness has been tempered with a more toasty, yeasty character that adds complexity. The wine has good depth, with spice and a steely minerality coming together with the fruit. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2012 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Smooth and rich, a wine that seems soft rather than focused. Hints of wood add to the attraction, while pear and lychee flavors give further ripeness. It probably needs several months, or a year, to come together.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2007 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A big wine, with structure and fruit. The mild tannins are a counterpoint to the harmonious red berries, acidity and dense texture. Boasts a delicious, sensuous finale. For medium-term aging.
title: Manuel Olivier 2007 Les Damaudes  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Firm and tannic, a wine that, at this stage, is putting structure before fruit. That will change over 4–5 years as the dry tannins soften into the ripe plum and cranberry juice fruits underneath. While not weighty, this is a delicious, well-crafted wine.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 Les Grands Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: There is good weight here. Its richness and fruits offer light red plum textures, a dry tannic character as well as some good power. Complexity and sweetness both promote a concentrated wine.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes
title: Albert Bichot 2007 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes  (Corton)

description: A broad wine, its ripe flavors fashioned with yellow fruits, toast, vanilla and an opulent texture. This is rich, open and packed with full-in-the-mouth flavors. Ready to drink.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru
title: Antonin Rodet 2007 Château de Rully Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Does the vineyard name mean “foggy” as its etymology suggests? The wine certainly has a cool character for normally generous Volnay. But it is finely structured, the delicate tannins offering a balance to the more forward black fruits. There is a fine fresh, dry aftertaste.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2007 Brouillards Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A rounded wine, all comfortable fruits and texture. There is a nice bite of lime juice acidity to sharpen up the gentle character, as well as some toast to add spice. An attractive, already mature wine.
designation: Chartron et Trébuchet Cuvée La Chaume
title: Maison Jean-Baptiste Béjot 2007 Chartron et Trébuchet Cuvée La Chaume  (Rully)

description: Full bodied, rich and ripe, this wine has a minerally texture and is loaded with tropical fruit, citrus and apricot flavors. It's a serious selection that needs some aging. This is one of a series of single-vineyard wines from the Comte de Ternay estate.
designation: Château de Rully La Bressande Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Rully La Bressande Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: This wine is perfumed, with delicious notes of plum and spice that are balanced by light tannins and fine, elegant acids. A touch of mineral marks the finish.
title: David Moreau 2010 Clos Rousseau Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Rich, elegant and classic, this wine is made from fruit sourced from old vines—some as much as 70 years old. It has a tannic structure, but the dominant elements are the dense red- and black-plum flavors, which are supported by the wine's acids. Age it for 5–6 years.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay)

description: This is a structured, fruity wine that has ripe strawberry and red plum flavors. Its tannins are condensed at the core, and the finish is marked by refreshing acidity. The vineyard is wholly owned by Faiveley.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010 Clos de L'Ecu Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Made from fruit that was sourced from a 2.4-acre plot on the steep slopes of Vergisson, this is an intense, ripe, wood-aged wine. The acidity is allied to the spice and yellow fruit flavors. A concentrated wine of great purity, this is worth aging for several years.
title: Domaine Ferret 2010 Tête de Cru Les Perrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Showing the structure of Gevrey-Chambertin and the ripe fruit of the 2009 vintage, this bottling is immediately opulent and seductive. With its red plum flavor and balanced tannins and acids, this is a solid wine to drink now.
title: Jaffelin 2009  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This is a tight, currently closed wine, but it has the potential to exude intense fruit and balancing acidity. It has weight and a taut, minerally texture, and the finish is fresh and lively. It will age over the medium term.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Grande Montagne Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine has equal amounts of ripe berry fruit and structure. There is a smoky character, wood and spice notes, balanced acidity and a leather-like touch to the texture. It is slowly developing, and it has the potential to be rich. Age this for 6–8 years.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: From vineyards owned by the Gagey family, this wine is ripe, easy to drink and full of fruit. Its strawberry and red cherry flavors are lifted by acidity and grounded in balancing tannins. It is made to be drunk young and will be ready from late 2017.
title: Louis Jadot 2014 Le Chapitre  (Bourgogne)

description: Ripe and soft, this is a fruity wine with refreshing lemon and apple flavors. Its rich texture is balanced by good acidity—unsurprising since the grapes grow near the white wine vineyards of Meursault and Puligny-Montrachet.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Bourgogne

description: This is a smooth wine with gentle tannins and red berry fruit. It has juicy acidity and a slight toastiness from oak. With spice and acidity, it will be an attractive wine to drink from 2018.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Beaune

description: Very young, this firm, structured wine has dense tannins and a dry core. All of this will open up to bring in the red fruits waiting behind this formidable facade. It needs to age, so drink from 2019.
title: Louis Chevallier 2014 Les Vaucrains Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine is still young, tight and on the crisp acid side. That doesn't mean it won't soften and fill out, although it will probably stay ultrafresh and packed with red-currant flavors for some time. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2013 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Not quite as big as the Bâtard, Latour's Corton-Charlie is the house's flagship (the company owns 10 hectares of the grand cru) and most ageable wine. The 2000 boasts aromas of gunflint, pear, smoked meat and buttered toast. White peaches emerge on the palate, but the primary flavors are of minerals and spice. Finishes with tons of citrus and an almost tannic feel. Give it two or three years to begin to soften.
title: Louis Latour 2000  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Not for the fainthearted, this is a huge, mouthfilling wine bursting with yellow plum, hazelnut and peach aromas, and accented by smoke, butter and toast. Yet for all its size, it manages to marry that power with a sense of mineral elegance. Drink now–2010.
title: Louis Latour 2000  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: Light in color while full of fruit, this is a ripe and jammy wine. A good core of tannins are surrounded by ripe cherry and strawberry-flavored fruits. There is a good future for this dense wine, so drink from 2017.
title: Louis Max 2013 Vignes du Domaine  (Mercurey)

description: This wine is ripe, with a warm, yellow fruit character. It is bright and poised, elegant and sophisticated. Acidity shoots through the richness, bringing a strong citrus element. Sunny in character, it will still age; drink from late 2016.
title: Albert Bichot 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Rich fruit is boosted by the wood aging. Together they give a ripe wine full of acidity and juicy yellow fruits at the same time. It's a delicious wine, smooth while lined with acidity. The wood flavors sustain it, and it should be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is textured and tight with delicious, refreshing acidity that is softened by a round vanilla edge. It is still young, still developing its balance and rich, honeyed fruit character. Drink this rich and stylish wine from 2017.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With noticeable wood flavors, this sophisticated wine is smooth, rich and creamy. It has enough fruit to sustain all this toast, giving a wine that has a fresh line that runs right through it, passing apples and fresh apricots on the way. Drink from 2016.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine Beranger  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Wood and spice, as well as ripe fruit, come together in this generous wine. It does have a tight texture that will soften as it ages. What is so attractive at the moment are the beautiful acidity and crisp apple favors. It's a wine with good aging potential, so drink from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A fresh, lemon-scented wine, with white flower aromas and soft, crisp lime flavors. The wine has some softness as well as an attractive zesty finish. Screwcap.
title: Cave de Lugny 2010 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Earthy and rustic, this intensely tannic wine has a dry character. The fruit is all there, hiding behind this rough exterior. Allow the wine time to soften out and drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2012  Mercurey

description: This wine is ripe and structured, dense with both acidity and minerality. It is rich with yellow and tropical fruits but always cut with lively acidity, making it opulent while fresh. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This is a blend from several Grand Crus on the Corton hill. It is rich and spicy, with great black fruits and solid tannins. A powerful wine, it's shot through with acidity and black-plum fruits throughout the structure. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Château Corton Grancey  (Corton)

description: Powerful and complex, this dark wine comes from vines at the heart of appellation, rich and dense. It offers the potential of great fruit, rich acidity and considerable structure, and will develop giving richness and long aging. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Cuvée Héritiers Latour  (Chambertin)

description: Wood aged for 12 months, this dense and structured wine comes from a small parcel of vines in the Clos de Vougeot. It is perfumed, ripe with a solid series of tannins as well as red-berry fruits. The acidity is typical of the vintage, and, along with the tannins, will allow this powerful wine to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: Selected from parcels across the estate, this wine aims to reflect the totality of the appellation. It succeeds with its combination of minerality and ripe fruit. Oak, almond and citrus fruits are still right up front, showing that this is a young wine that will age well. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Fuissé 2014 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The immense walled vineyard of the Clos de Vougeot gives so many styles of wine from its 80 growers. This version is already relatively soft with as much generous fruit as tannins. Some high-toast oak flavor needs to integrate, while showing great density and concentration. With power behind it, the wine will age seriously. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Santenay 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: From three different parcels in this large Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is dense and concentrated. Powerful tannins will develop into rich fruits with great intensity. This wine, with its weight, needs time. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: Intense and concentrated, this offers ripe yellow fruits, rich apples and a tight mineral texture. It has power, reinforced by subtle wood aging. A flagship for this producer, the wine will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Corton-Charlemagne

description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine, this is rich while shot through with fresh acidity. A dusty smoky structure awaits behind the fruit. It will become a well-balanced wine, packed with fruit and supple tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This monopole vineyard came into the Bouchard family in 1791, 60 years after the maison was founded. This wine is smoky and full of fruit and sweet tannins. With its balanced tannins and rich fruits, it is developing well. The dense structure behind the fruit promises good aging. Drink from 2020.
designation: Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The seven-acre walled vineyard surrounds the winery and château. Old vines and a sheltered situation give this wine its richness. Enhanced by the wood aging, this wine is ripe with apricots and spiced pears cut with a mineral texture. It is still young and will be much better from 2019.
title: Château de Fuissé 2014 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: One of the most familiar of the Premier Cru vineyards in Puligny, it is according to legend named after goblins and other nighttime creatures. This wine is mineral, tight and crisp. Underneath, bright citrus and richer apricots are waiting to come out. The wine is young and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Bright and fruity, this is an apple and crisp green-fruit-flavored wine. There is a hint of the maturity to come, giving a light toastiness while the fruit remains crisp and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Réserve Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A refreshing, crisp wine from the owners of Château de Fuissé, this has delicious acidity along with lemon and yeast flavors. A tangy, mineral character brings out the elegant texture of the fruit. It is ready to drink.
title: Vincent NV Vincent Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine is ripe and fruity, with a soft texture. Made in the northern Burgundy region of Saint-Bris, it conveys an attractive cool feel, emphasizing apples, lemon and a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Paul Delane Brut Réserve  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is firmly structured, and it shows the earthy fruit character of Savigny. The red plum flavor is cut with acidity. It's worth aging for 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Champy 2010 Aux Forches  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a big, fat Chardonnay—at least in Burgundy terms. It has a ripe yellow-fruit flavor, a rich texture and soft acidity. Subtle wood influence gives further roundness to this almost pebble-smooth wine. It's delicious now, and it's likely to develop quickly.
title: Antonin Rodet 2011  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This is a rich, rounded wine with pure red berry aromas. The initially soft tannins has a dryness that creeps up as the fruit increases in its richness. Layers of wood spice support the fruit rather than dominating.
title: Domaine de la Vougeraie 2005  Pommard

description: This rich, rounded wine shows ripe yellow fruits, pineapple flavors and a texture that just hints at minerality. All this rich fruit is so generously balanced with acidity and a juicy, fruity and fresh aftertaste. At the same time, the wine has weight, depth of flavor and a background structure that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2013 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine is rich, with great fruitiness and a good sense of structure. It has weight, with plenty of full yellow and fresh pear flavors cut by intense acidity. Well balanced, rich and dense, it will age although it can be drunk from the end of 2015.
title: Pascal Rollet 2013 Aux Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: An elegant wine, this is a blend of vines from both the cool and the warm side of the vineyard. It is soft with ripe mango as well as sliced apple freshness. The texture is already well integrated, both tight and mineral on one side and rich on the other. Drink from 2018.
title: William Fèvre 2013 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Produced from old vines, this is a beautiful wine. It has great structure, minerality and concentration along with a full-bodied richness that is developing well. Combined with the ripe yellow fruits, they give an opulent wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Fuissé 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a full-bodied, dense wine. A hint of austerity in the mineral texture gives the wine a steely core. Around this center, ripe fruit fills out the wine and gives apricots and generous fruitiness as well as a crisp, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Floral and aromatic, this is a ripe wine with delicious, intense acidity as well as a touch of honey. Rich peach and pear come through strongly. It's a refreshing, juicy wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Les Vaucoupins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A soft and light Pinot Noir with attractive strawberry acidity and cherry fruit flavors. An earthier backdrop balances the hint of tannin.
title: Jaboulet-Vercherre 2010  Bourgogne

description: This single-vineyard wine is a showcase of ripeness—fruity and smooth with great plum and wild strawberry flavors. It's intensely structured and dense on the palate, however, making it a wine for aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Chardannes  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: A blend that includes Aligoté along with the traditional Champagne grapes, this is lively and bright. Fresh apples and a soft aftertaste make for an easy to drink wine that is lit with final acidity.
title: Cave de Bissey NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This wine reflects the ripeness of the vintage while still retaining crisp minerality. Creamed apples are balanced with a tangy texture and soft acidity. The wine finishes with a crisp aftertaste that gives a great lift. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2015  Chablis

description: This is an attractive red-fruit flavored wine with fine acidity as well as juicy berries and cherry. Its soft tannins are just right to sustain the delicious fruitiness. Dink this wine from 2017.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Ferté  (Givry)

description: Showing the ripe 2015 vintage, this is a soft rounded wine. It has attractive acidity to lift the ripe yellow fruit and add a shot of citrus. The wine needs another few months to settle in, so wait until summer 2017.
title: Etienne Boileau 2015  Chablis

description: Toasty wine, maybe over-toasty, giving a buttery malolactic feel. Its acidity and its freshness are both enveloped in a more opulent embrace.
designation: Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Premier Cru
title: Pascal Bouchard 2008 Les Vieilles Vignes Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A mouthwateringly fresh wine, its acidity giving a classic steely, mineral texture. The citrus fruit is fresh, while it also has a rounded character. Toast from wood aging adds another softer aspect.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2008 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Firmly tannic, solid and chunky wine. The ripe strawberry flavors are balanced by firm tannins and a dark edge of plum skins. Should be aged for another year.
title: Manuel Olivier 2008 Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Red cherries and jelly fruits highlight a wine that is ripe and soft. A hint of acidity puts the sweetness into attractive relief.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006  Bourgogne

description: A strangely spicy aroma is followed on the palate by very dry tannins, which dominate the red fruits. The wine has some potential, but has obviously come from grapes that are on the tart side. The finish has high acidity.
title: Pierre Olivier 2005  Côtes de Nuits Villages

description: A wine that seems to take the softness of Chambolle-Musigny too far. It has sweetness and flavors of raspberry juice, leaving no room for structure or acidity. Drink now, because this wine is too open to last.
title: Maison Champy 2006 Les Bussières  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: A textured wine, it's still very crisp, tight and closed up, only just hinting at a more fruity side. Waiting a few years will reveal the delicious citrus, peach and vanilla flavors that will show how generous and rich this wine really is. Don't touch before 2017.
title: Alex Gambal 2011  Puligny-Montrachet

description: The light, stony soil of Les Lavières produces structured, tight and firm wines, unlike many of the softer wines from Savigny. With new wood and licorice flavors, it is darkly textured and firm. The red fruits are still developing, showing the rich potential of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: From slopes above the village of Gevrey-Chambertin, this densely tannic wine has a powerful structure that brings out the wood and adds licorice flavors to the bitter cherry fruits. At the end, the year's signature freshness shows more strongly.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011 Jeunes Rois  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: From vines averaging 50 years of age, this is powerful, ripe and concentrated. It has dark black fruits, red berries that give acidity, and a richly fruity structure. It punches well above its village appellation. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This textured wine shows wood flavors from its 30% new wood. To balance it has great ripe fruits and a tight texture of acidity. The wine is still nervy, closed up with minerality. It needs time, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chantal Lescure 2011 Les Chouacheux Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Produced from old vines, this textured, solid wine has a tight and firmly tannic character. Underneath, red cherry fruits are already releasing a fragrant side and the potential of bright fruitiness. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chantal Lescure 2011 Les Vaumuriens  (Pommard)

description: From vines just to the north of Nuits Saint-Georges, this firm and structured wine features ripe fruits, red berries and bitter cherry flavors. Both dark in texture and perfumed, it's powerful and does need some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Aux Chaignots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The 60% new wood aging is showing strongly in this structured wine. Rich and rounded, it offers hints of spice, red cherry fruits and a firmly, tannic edge. The aftertaste brings out a jammy richness. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Les Porets Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The great fruit produces a delicious wine that is also structured with a strong steely element. It is full of yellow fruits, layers of wood and juicy acidity. The aftertaste is as bright as a button.
title: Trenel Fils 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: While this wine demonstrates the telltale cool element of the appellation, it also offers ripe fruit, pear and peach flavors lightly layered with wood. The wine is crisp at the end, with a mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Ripe and structured, it has the weight and broad feel of a Chassagne-Montrachet. Firmly textured and concentrated, it also shows soft fruitiness. The power will keep it aging well, so drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A steely wine, it's tight with acidity and apple fruit flavors. It has a brighter, crisper side, but the wine is still nervy and textured. Acidity at the end means it can age. Drink from 2016.
title: Manuel Seguin 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The grapes to make this rich, ripe wine were sourced from vines that were planted in the 1980s. The vineyard, which is located next to Bonnes Mares, yields wines that have an open, generous style, plus elements of structure that lend aging potential. Ready to drink in two years, but it should age well for many more.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Les Véroilles  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: With its firm tannins and structure, this is a wine that's made in the traditional Nuits-St.-Georges style. But it's also packed with ripe red fruit, and it has a jammy character and an open feel. There is no doubt that this is a wine to age for at least five years.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Tropical fruit aromas lead to a peach- and apricot-flavored palate. It shows old-vine concentration, spice from having aged in wood and a generous, velvet-like texture that is balanced by a fine shot of lemony acidity. Age this for 4–5 years.
title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Meursault)

description: With its firmness and juicy red-fruit flavor, this wine is delicious to drink now, but it will also age for at least six years. This bottling demonstrates the structure and generosity of one of Beaune's most famous premier crus.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2010 Beaune Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Bright and fruity, this Chardonnay has citrus and peach flavors, with notes of almond, vanilla and spice that reflect the wood aging and make this a wine that's crisp and rich. It has a strong texture, and it needs 4–5 years for its complexities to fully evolve.
title: Maison Champy 2010 Les Chênevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Close to the white grand crus of Chassagne-Montrachet, this wine is structured and weighty, and it offers juicy apricot and pear flavors. A citrus element cuts through the wood influence and the steely texture, which brings freshness to the ripe, rich mouthfeel.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Vide Bourse Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This wine has a tight structure that's laced with wood. The complex fruit is still settling into the structure, promising richness. Age this for at least five years.
designation: Château de Rully La Pucelle Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Rully La Pucelle Cuvée Comte R. de Ternay Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: Rich while also structured, it has a mineral texture that gives fine acidity and a tight feel, all balanced by ripe apricot fruits. The wine should round out by 2015 to give a ripe, full-bodied feel.
title: Domaine Perraud 2012  Saint-Véran

description: Big and smoky, it discloses fruit as well as solid tannins. The wine has power and density, with black fruits that show sweetness. It will be delicious but the structure does need to soften first. Drink from 2017.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Ripe and fruity, it shows both good acidity and attractive tannins. It has weight, red cherry flavors and a structure that supports the fruitiness. It's delicious but needs more time. Drink from  2017.
title: Henri de Villamont 2011 Le Village  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: At this stage, this wine is closed and packed with acidity. But just wait for a few years and the ripe wood and yellow fruits will emerge. It's a full-bodied, rich wine that needs to round out. Drink from 2016.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2011 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Rich as well as structured, it's ripe and already delicious. Berry and cherry fruits are nicely surrounded by both acidity and tannins. Full in the mouth, it's going to be an estimable wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Pierre André 2011  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Ripe, smooth and creamy, this wine has a rich texture to it. Tropical fruits, featuring ¬flavors of mango and pineapple, give it an exotic feel, although it is firmly held in place by acidity.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2009  Saint-Véran

description: Full, ripe and spicy, this has flavors of meat and wild strawberry. It is dense, with bright acidity and enough tannin for structure.
title: Domaines Devillard 2009 Le Renard  (Givry)

description: The name of the wine says a lot about its structure. It definitely has a mineral tang to it although the ripe yellow fruits do give it a soft cushion. The acidity however makes it crisp, refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2015 Minéral  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: The wine has tannins and a dry core that is fleshed out with red-berry fruits. At three-years-old it is already maturing with a rustic edge as well as spice and berry fruits. This is ready to drink.
designation: Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2013 Clos de Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Montagny is at the southern end of the Côte Chalonnaise before it merges into Mâcon. That gives this wine its warmth and ripe apple and peach fruits. It is crisp and fresh at the same time with great juicy acidity. The wine has a spicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2014 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: For a wine from this appellation, this is surprisingly soft. It has black fruits and tannins that are already softening. Spice and berry fruits are lifted by acidity. This fruity wine will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: While on the light side, this is an attractive, fruity wine. It has a creamy, soft feel to it with fresh pear flavors, as well as a touch of vanilla from the gentle wood aging. It's ready to drink now, but will be better in a year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Soft and warm, this wine originates from the northern end of the Côte de Nuits. It has wild-raspberry and dark cherry flavors balanced with elegant acidity. It's wine that will age quickly, so drink from 2014.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature La Mazière  (Fixin)

description: Delicately perfumed with bright red-fruit aromas, this is a light, fruity, forward wine that is ready to drink now. Acidity cuts through the palate and soft tannins linger on the finish.
title: Louis Chavy 2011  Bourgogne

description: An unusual Nuits-St.-Georges. Normally the wines are dark, dry and tannic. But this is fruity, light, fresh. With its vibrant red fruits, it seems very out of character, if pleasing.
title: Henri de Villamont 2005  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: A fruity, apple-driven wine, this has a creamy texture. It is soft, lightly spicy and with delicious acidity. The wine is fruity, fragrant and refreshing. Drink now, reveling in the fruit.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Crisp, bright and packed full of acidity and citrus fruits, this wine is fragrant and very fresh. The sunny character is cut by a delicious and refreshing aftertaste that has hints of almonds and apricots.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2013 Le Chai des Platanes  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Tangy, fruity and cut through with smoky wood flavors, this is a well-textured wine. It has weight and good flavor depth, bringing the acidity and apple flavors right up through the wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de Pierreclos 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is lean, with a severe character that gives tightness to the fruit. It's very mineral in character, full of acidity and just hinting at spice. Drink this nervy wine from 2016.
title: Clos des Rocs 2013 Les Pierrottes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Smooth and perfumed, this has a delicious, ripe black-fruit character. It is full of wood, spice and smoky tannins that demand aging. The wine is dense and layered with acidity as well as beautiful fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Dominique Gruhier 2013 Cuvée Juliette  (Bourgogne Epineuil)

description: This wine has the proper power and structure of Gevrey, with firm tannins under the ripe red berry and cherry fruits. There is great juicy acidity as well as a firmer structure that will let the wine age. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: From one of the rare Chardonnay vineyards in Nuits-St-Georges comes this delicious, fruity, perfumed wine. Apples, quince and hints of yellow fruits are all present, along with a tighter texture and balanced acidity. Keep for a few years and drink from 2016.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The vineyard of the medieval Château de Mercey has produced a fully structured, fully fruity wine in 2010. It has ripe berry fruits, layers of acidity and a firm core of tannins. It should age over the next 3–4 years.
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Mercey  (Mercurey)

description: This is showing a mature, browning color. The palate echoes that it is just beginning to dry out, although for the next year or two it will still be a delicious, mature wine. The tannins are dark, with some sweetness as well as final acidity.
title: Domaine Henri Rebourseau 2000 Charmes Chambertin  (Charmes-Chambertin)

description: This Poruzots offers a restrained version of Meursault, very structured, its texture severe and tight. Apple skin and green plum fruits go with the dry toast character. Age for a year for more ripe flavors to emerge.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2008 Clos des Poruzots  (Meursault)

description: Typical Pommard, with its initially severe tannins. The wine then shows its potential for rich fruit, in its round plum flavors, the tannins offering support. It is a concentrated, chunky wine, the final acidity adding freshness.
designation: Clos de la Commarine Premier Cru
title: Pierre André 2009 Clos de la Commarine Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Full and buttery, as befits a Meursault, the wine also has a fine-textured acidity, spice and toast. It is rich, although with a crisp citrus edge that balances out the ripe melon and honey flavor. Ready to drink, but could age for a few years.
title: Labouré-Roi 2008 Les Chevaliers  (Meursault)

description: Rich, intense red-fruited wine, soft and voluptuous. The tannins are folded into the ripe fruits, giving a very approachable feel. The acidity is prominent at this stage but should soften in a year or two, and the wine is certainly worth aging.
title: Pierre André 2009 En Chevret  (Volnay)

description: A selection from different parcels in the Château de Fuissé vineyard, this is a rich wine, initially soft, then showing a more textured character. It has weight, concentration, the wood adding another dimension to an already complex wine.
title: Château de Fuissé 2009 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Perfumed and fruity, this is a gentle, lightly structured wine. It has red fruits, soft tannins and plenty of bright acidity. It's not a wine for long aging and can be drunk now–2018.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2011 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a smooth and soft wine with attractive white-fruit aromas and bold acidity. It's finely textured with juicy, fresh apple and pear flavors. It is ready to drink now, but will age over the medium term.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2011  Mercurey

description: Rich and full-bodied, the flavors of quince and pear are balanced by great acidity. It is a big, powerful wine that, with its tight fruit and steely background, promises long aging. The tropical fruits also need several years to show strongly. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011  Bâtard-Montrachet

description: A wine from a tiny premier cru that is literally situated at a crossroads. It displays the smoothness and richness that come with wood aging, as well as concentrated tannins to support the generous fruit. Black plums and strawberries give a dense wine that will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2011 Aux Echanges Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: From vines just below the line of Grand Cru vineyards, this is a big and powerful expression of Pinot Noir. It is dense with firm tannins that are embedded in the ripe black fruits. It's a complex wine, serious while still fruity, and needing to age. Drink from  2018.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2011 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: At this stage, this wine is closed, tight and mineral in character. As befits a great Perrières, it will be a serious, structured wine, textured and full of nervy, steely feeling, softening later into mature spice and toast. Drink from 2016.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Perrières Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This iconic wine is rich and perfumed. It's powerful and concentrated, with layers of wood contrasted by explosive, ripe fruits. Ripe red-fruit flavors are brightened by ample acidity, resulting in a sumptuous wine that also has enough tannins to age. Drink from 2018.
designation: Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Rich and rounded, the wine has classic power. Wood flavors show strongly at this stage in its development, but it is full, ripe, full of yellow fruits, pineapple and apple skins. The wine has great weight, but offers a fresh, straight and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2011  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Soft and creamy, this wine has an attractive burst of freshness with apple and citrus flavors. Lightly textured and fruity, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Bourgogne

description: This wine is initially tight and austere. The red-cherry fruit will develop slowly and with bright acidity to sustain it. Drouhin vineyards are biodynamic; this blend comes from its own and partner vineyards. Drink from 2018.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Still young, this crisp wine is at the beginning of its development. Time will bring out the ripe apple fruit and the touches of spice that are just hints now. Drink from 2017.
title: Tramier et Fils 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This wine is surprisingly soft for a Pommard. Juicy red fruits have been spiced by the wood aging. It is light, gently crisp and ready to drink.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Clos Blanc Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Bright red berry and cherry fruits are well up front in this wine that has crisp acidity as well as a more rounded background that will develop well. Juicy and fruity, the wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Laleure-Piot 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Tangy and juicy, this is a bright, still tight wine. A strong mineral character dominates the texture and suggests the wine needs time to allow the crisp citrus and acidity to come through. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Garenne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: In the same family since 1835, this estate in Pouilly-Fuissé also makes wines in other surrounding appellations. This wine, with its soft and full white fruit, gentle structure and just enough acidity, is developing fast and will be ready from late 2016.
title: Château Vitallis 2015 En Paradis  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: This bright, lemony wine is lightly mineral as well as fruity. A crisp apple character gains even more tightness from a shot of lime juice. The wine is ready to drink, light and refreshing with a buttery aftertaste.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2014 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: This ripe wine has good acidity that thrusts through the rich yellow fruits. It is ready to drink, with its tangy acidity and warm apricot and peach flavors.
title: Doudet Naudin 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This well-proportioned wine has ripe fruits along with generous texture and acidity. A touch of wood gives extra weight. It's ready to drink, but will be even better by the end of 2014.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2012 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: This open, generous wine is already completely in its stride. Ripe yellow fruits are given freshness by flavors of orange zest and citrus. The wood aging shows, but gently, rounding out the fruits and adding a note of spice. It's a full wine, ready to drink in 2015.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Although this wine has a strong toasty character, it offers enough fruit, acidity and ripe tropical flavors to make it work. Attractive acidity gives a delicious, fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2011 Champ Gain Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Rounded, rich and warm, it has excellent acidity along with touches of wood and very pure citrus flavors. Peach fruits give a riper feel. Drink now, but better to wait until 2015.
title: Benjamin Leroux 2011  Auxey-Duresses

description: This ripe, concentrated wine has rounded tannins plus a structure that gives weight as well as richness. It comes from vines close to Morey Saint-Denis. The richness promises good aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011 Les Fuées Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Vines from high up in the vineyard produce this cool, fresh wine. It has bright acidity along with intense grapefruit and lemon fruits. The wine is tangy with a strong texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Château Gris Les Terrasses  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This soft, rounded wine has attractive ripe white-stone-fruit flavor. It also has a rich, spicy side, with light hints of wood that give it a mellow character. The wine is developing well and will be ready from 2017.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine Adélie Les Champs-Michaux  (Mercurey)

description: With attractive wood flavors, this is a wine with spice, toast and citrus flavors. Orange and yellow fruits come through the lime acidity and zesty texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: This wine is smoky, ripe and packed with tannins. The fruit gives the wine weight although it is not yet fully developed. There is a toasty background to this rich wine with its juicy red-berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Champ Perdrix  (Marsannay)

description: This wine is ripe with yellow fruits and rich pears. It has a rounded character, with a creamy texture shot through with acidity. The aftertaste has touches of grapefruit and a minerality that gives good texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014 Clos de Mazeray  (Meursault)

description: This is a crisp, floral wine with apple and pear aromas that are unabashedly forward. It has lively acidity and a texture that's crisp, fresh and intensely minerally. Just a touch of creamy vanilla helps to fill the wine out. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2011 Clos Philippe-le-Hardi  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: This finely balanced, juicy wine is full of red-fruit aromas and brisk acidity. Juicy and bright with strawberry flavors and refreshing acidity, it's a value wine with great potential. Drink from 2015.
title: Derey Frères 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Fixin)

description: Sourced from vines that are just outside the Meursault appellation, this is a light, bright wine flavored with citrus and apple. Floral aromas are followed by touches of spice, balanced acidity and a juicy finish. Drink now–2020
title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Cuvée des Forgets  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a soft, rounded wine, with ripe fruit that seems unfocused. The fruit and the acidity are reticent, not giving the wine much shape. A simple, ripe wine, it can be drunk now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: This soft wine is full of citrus and spice flavors. A lightly zesty edge brings out the acidity. Fruity and easy to drink, it is ready now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: Bright and fruity, this wine is light, crisp and shot through with acidity. Lively and tangy, it's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Perraud 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: While this wine is full, it has an indistinct character. A soft texture and only light fruitiness leave a dull impression.
title: Gerald Talmard 2016  Mâcon-Chardonnay

description: A soft, dilute wine, this is gently fruity. Acidity gives a lift at the end. Drink now.
title: Pierre-Yves et Olivier Fichet 2016 La Crepillionne  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This broad wine is soft, indistinct and suffers from overripe fruit. It needs a shot of acidity to give it life and interest.
title: Mommessin 2015 Grandes Mises  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft red fruits dominate this only lightly structured wine. It is more about juicy Pinot Noir, fruity with raspberry and red-currant flavors. Dryness at the core of the wine adds shape. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Bourgogne

description: Though the vineyard sits at 1,100 feet, hints of tropical fruits give this wine a ripe feel. Pineapple and mango mingle with crisper citrus flavors, yielding a wine that is both fresh and ripe. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Round and smooth, this rich wine has the right acidity for the ripe pear, green plum and thrust of citrus. A backbone of minerality gives structure, while a spicy nutmeg note complements the subtle nutty character. Drink now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Vinified in new 500-liter oak barrels, this wine is fresh, fruity and crisp. It has attractive acidity, a strong streak of minerality and lively lemon fruit. With a taut, nervy edge, the wine has a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This soft wine features attractive citrus and creamed-apple flavors. It is round, full, lightly spicy and presents an easy, immediately drinkable character.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This cool, mineral-textured wine has crisp fruit. It is refreshing while still tight, with a firm structure. It likely will remain nervy, taut and dominated by citrus. Drink from 2017.
title: Camille Paquet 2014 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: In the same family since 1835, this estate in Pouilly-Fuissé also makes wines in other surrounding appellations. This wine, with its soft and full white fruit, gentle structure and just enough acidity, is developing fast and will be ready from late 2016.
title: Château Vitallis 2015 En Paradis  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: This bright, lemony wine is lightly mineral as well as fruity. A crisp apple character gains even more tightness from a shot of lime juice. The wine is ready to drink, light and refreshing with a buttery aftertaste.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2014 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: There is a toasty aroma in this wine that comes from a premier cru next door to Chassagne-Montrachet. This toastiness continues into a spicy, toasty note. A good sense of fruitiness gives the wine a ripe and rich character that will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2017.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2012 Pitangerets Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: A structured wine, packed with red fruits and delightful acidity. There is a core of dark tannin and a solid structure as well as the bright freshness at the end. Because it has this structure, it's worth aging for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine des Croix 2011  Beaune

description: A lightly perfumed wine, this is soft with warm strawberry flavors. The acidity and texture play a supporting role in this ripe, light-bodied wine.
title: Manuel Olivier 2010  Bourgogne

description: Based in Nuits-Saint-Georges, Manuel Olivier has made a specialty of the wines from the Hautes Côtes in the hills behind the city. This is a light and fruity wine with freshness and some firm, dry tannins, although it's ready to drink now.
title: Manuel Olivier 2010  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: A light, perfumed wine with soft tannins and bitter cherry fruits. There is an earthy edge here, and while the wine has brisk acidity, there's an easy texture. It's ready to drink.
title: Mommessin 2011 Le Clé Saint-Pierre  (Bourgogne)

description: Soft and ripe, this has flavors of almond, pink grapefruit and attractive, crisp acidity. With its warm character that's embellished with toast, it is ready to drink now.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2010  Mâcon-Villages

description: Tannins and a red berry flavor combine in this soft wine. It has the structure of the vintage, with a firm core; the fruit and acidity developing slowly. Keep for 2–3 years.
title: Louis Max 2010 Clos la Marche  (Mercurey)

description: Light, fruity and rounded, this wood-aged wine has white fruit, spice and apricot flavors. It could age a year, but it is delicious now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2010 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a soft, ripe wine, with juicy acidity to keep it fresh. Flavors of lemon, tangy spice and baked apples are balanced by the taut texture of this still-young wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Santenay 2013 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: Creamy wood aromas are prominent in this ripe, yellow-fruit-flavored wine. A rich, textured character hints at minerality while bringing out fresh fruit and acidity. It is ready to drink, although some of the bursting acidity will calm down by late 2016.
title: Château de Santenay 2013  Mercurey

description: A light approach to Chablis, this brings out crisp fruitiness, attractive acidity, apple flavors and a touch of steeliness. With its creamy, ripe aftertaste, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2014  Chablis

description: Fresh with apple and citrus, this is a perfumed, immediately attractive wine. It has bright acidity, a lightly mineral texture and a tangy, zesty aftertaste. It's young and will age although it is delicious now.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2013 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Soft, open, green and rich, with hints of wood and flavors of pear. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2006  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: So soft, the wine is gently fruity, a hint of its chalk soil through a mineral edge. Fresh and tasting of lime and apple fruits, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2010  Chablis

description: A ripe and rounded wine, with friendly apricot and lemon flavors, richly toasty, leaving great acidity and bright fruits at the end.
title: Louis Chevallier 2009  Mâcon-Villages

description: Toasty ripe fruit, very yeasty in character, with flavors of biscuit and bread crust. The fruit is less obvious, but this is a wine with some serious intent, better with food than as an apéritif.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2005 Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: There is rich fruit behind the severe opening tannins, giving a sumptuous although firmly structured wine. The raspberry and crushed strawberry flavors are developing well, ready to balance with the tannins after another year.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Beaune Grèves  (Beaune)

description: This powerful wine reveals its style and breeding from the start. It has weight and concentration allied to great tangy fruit flavors. The nervy edge is very evident, with wood, structure from green apple skins and aging potential.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Preuses  (Chablis)

description: For a Volnay, this is a very structured wine. It has huge richness laced with firm tannins and dark fruits. It is the firmness that dominates, suggesting some extra extraction, although the acidity does push right through to the finish.
title: Domaine de la Pousse d'Or 2009 En Caillerets Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: With some concentration and ripe green fruits, this complex wine has a mineral structure, tangy acidity as well as a bright, crisp aftertaste. It's going to develop into a serious wine over the next two years. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2013 Les Grandes Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Produced from young vines, this is a soft and fruity wine. Wood aging has added richness to the yellow fruits and balancing apple acidity. It's perfumed, opening out with ripe apricot and white peach flavors at the end. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2012 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: This is a ripe, jammy wine with red plum and sweet strawberry fruits that are cut by both the acidity and the toasty tannins. Although ripe, the wine offers attractive juicy freshness. The aftertaste brings out more of the tannins.
title: Domaine Bart 2014 La Montagne  (Marsannay)

description: Intensely perfumed, this wine has soft tannins and a smooth, red-fruit-dominated texture. From a 3.5-acre premier-cru vineyard, it is ripe while light in character, suggesting it will age smoothly and quickly. The wine is almost ready now, although it will be best from 2018.
title: Domaine Ninot 2013 Marissou Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: With attractive wood flavors, this is a wine with spice, toast and citrus flavors. Orange and yellow fruits come through the lime acidity and zesty texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: This wine is smoky, ripe and packed with tannins. The fruit gives the wine weight although it is not yet fully developed. There is a toasty background to this rich wine with its juicy red-berry fruits and acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Champ Perdrix  (Marsannay)

description: This wine is so light, it is almost insubstantial. Hints of white fruit float across the surface, backed up by acidity and a gentle, fresh character. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Michel-Andreotti 2013 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: There's a fine texture to this simple, fruity wine. It has fresh acidity and a creamy character. A yeasty element doesn't quite fit with the rest of the wine and leaves a bitter taste.
title: Veuve Ambal NV Egalité  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Soft and fruity, this is a gentle, creamy wine. Almond and quince flavors are spread generously over the ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2013 Buissonier  (Montagny)

description: This is a basic Chablis, soft and fruity. Apples and pear skin flavors have a burst of acidity, a light mineral texture and a juicy aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Chablis

description: Showing acidity and a structured, dry character, this is a lean wine. Its tannins are dominant, along with vivid red currants and and an austere texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Chassagne-Montrachet 2011  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Light and bright, this fruity wine has a more bitter element that gives a sharper character that will hopefully round out. At the back, plenty of acidity leaves a crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Saumaize-Michelin 2013  Mâcon-Villages

description: This simple wine has some attractive citrus fruit. It is light, bright with plenty of acidity to keep it all fresh. It should be drunk now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2013 Domaine des Chènevières  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This is soft and fruity, with attractive acidity that cuts into the smooth texture. It does have a nutty, bitter character that shows through, giving a hard edge to the otherwise fruity wine.
title: Cave des Vignerons de Mancey 2013 Domaine des Vercheres  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Very refreshing, this is a lightly textured wine with juicy acidity and lemon fruits. It is bright and soft, cut by lively acidity that makes it delicious for the summer.
title: Maison Matisco 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: This wine is tight and crisp, with an earthy character. Touches of honey and ripe apricots fill out the back palate and give a richer feel to the aftertaste.
title: Doudet Naudin 2013  Mâcon

description: This wine is soft, indistinct at this stage. It needs to develop more of the fruitiness that is behind the bland exterior. The aftertaste has good freshness.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2013 La Chardonneraie  (Saint-Véran)

description: This is a soft and ripe wine with acidity plus yellow and pineapple fruit flavors. A gentle texture gives freshness and a tang of lemon zest. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2013 Chameroy  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This tight wine lacks fruit. Touches of apple and citrus are lost in the austere texture. No artificial yeasts were used during vinification in stainless steel and large oak barrels.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2014  Macon-Bussières

description: Warm and round, this has a generous character, while missing some of the attractive crispness of the vintage. It is ready to drink now, soft and fruity.
title: Château La Greffière 2014  Saint-Véran

description: Round and fruity, this offers gentle acidity and ripe melon fruit. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Bland and soft, this has light and gently tangy fruit with apple and lime flavors. The aftertaste is fresh. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: This wine is tight and tannic, firm and missing fruit. It seems to have been heavily extracted, giving a bitter character to the wine. It could soften, although that is difficult to imagine.
title: Christophe Pertuzot 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: This beautifully perfumed wine offers an appealing combination of red berry fruits, fragrant acidity and a firmer, dry background. The wine is already deliciously juicy and fruity, although its dry tannins and concentration promise further aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a rich, generous and rounded wine. The opulent feel is balanced by a strongly mineral texture. Old vines give concentration while also allowing for great freshness. It needs to age further. Drink from 2017.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Meursault)

description: While the wine does have richness, it's the mineral and citrus side that is coming through at this stage. The balance with the wood aging is so right that you feel the toast rather than tasting it. As it matures, the wine will deepen in intensity and power, certainly over the next 5–10 years.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Domaine Leflaive 2007 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Pure strawberry and red cherry fruits with a twist of acidity make this a wine that is already delicious. Just under the surface is a firm wood-and-tannin character and a dense, if juicy, structure. Age for 4–5 years.
title: Louis Jadot 2009 Beaune Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Big, tannic and fruity, giving an intense structure of black plums laced with sweet raspberries. It exudes richness and power, generous while also firm.
title: Domaine Dujac 2009 Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This wine is initially austere, but then shows rich, ripe fruit and a solid structure. The wine's strong tannic character suggests considerable aging potential, while it already shows a deliciously gentle side.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Champs-Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From young vines in Chambertin, this is big and generous, showing the richness of the year as well as its depth of fruit. Firm tannins help to give the wine shape.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This structured wine also has already delicious red fruit flavors. The core of tannins is surrounded by this cushion of ripe fruits, layered with acidity and altogether enticing now. Drink now, although the wine will certainly age.
title: Manuel Olivier 2012  Pommard

description: The crispness of Aligoté is well expressed in this fruity, citrus and sliced apple flavored wine. It is bright, with a mineral texture along with some weight from aging on the lees until bottling. It's very ready to drink although it will soften and round out from 2015.
title: Manuel Olivier 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne Aligoté)

description: Full-bodied and ripe, this offers fruitiness that has been filled out with wood aging. It's a good expression of Chardonnay from southern Burgundy, with ripe yellow fruits and citrus and a juicy-toasty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vincent 2012 JJ Bourgogne Blanc  (Bourgogne)

description: With just that extra bottle age, the wine shows ripe quince and apricot flavors, with a suggestion of artichoke and a rounded texture. Soft and open, this is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Garnier Fils 2008 Grains Dorés  (Chablis)

description: Attractively ripe, this has a dense texture that's full of red fruits and soft tannins. With its richness, it is delicious and ready to drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2009 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne)

description: Soft and rounded, this is a warm, ripe wine. With its yellow fruits and light texture, it's fruity, already open for drinking. Crisp lemon gives an appealing edge to the bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2013  Chablis

description: From the Mâcon appellation that is dominated by the formidable rock of Solutré, this is a ripe, full-bodied wine. It offers juicy acidity, fresh sliced apple flavors and a touch of spice. The wine is ready, although it will be better from late 2016.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2014  Mâcon Solutré

description: At the southern end of Nuits Saint-Georges, this vineyard produces a ripe and full style of wine. This wine has those characters along with the tannins and the acidity of the vintage to produced a juicy wine that will age well. The aftertaste keeps that crunchy, crisp character. Drink it from 2019.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Les Porêts Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Produced from 65-year-old vines, this is a rich and perfumed wine from the estate of Nicolas Potel. It is structured, balancing the red fruits and acidity with a solid framework of tannins. Spice from the wood aging shows lightly, while the wine finishes with crisp red-currant acidity.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: While this domaine is based in Chaintré it also has vines in Pouilly-Fuissé. This wine comes from a 2.4-acre vineyard on the clay and chalk soil that marks this appellation. It is rich, full in the mouth with a mineral texture and lively acidity. It is still young and will be better from late 2017.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2014 Les Robées  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Smoky aromas and wood flavors are still dominant in this wine even after five years. It does have some concentration and red-berry fruits, although the structure and the tannins are still firm. The wine should age further to allow the fruit to mature and shine. Drink from 2019.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Collection  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: In the prestigious village of Vosne-Romanée, there is little room for anything but Grand and Premier Cru vineyards.
