description: One of Faiveley's monopoles (wholly owned vineyards), Clos des Cortons makes powerful wines. That's the case in 2005. This wine towers up, a strong edifice of tannins and big, black fruits. It has all the right elements coming into place, along with weight and some elegance.
title: Faiveley 2005 Clos des Cortons  (Corton)

description: A big, burly wine, powerful, concentrated and packed with fruit, the tannins a potential aging advantage underneath all this delicious fruit. Solid, but charming at the same time.
title: Domaine Moillard 2005  Clos de Vougeot

description: A beautiful rounded wine, full of juicy fruit, but sustained by a strong tannic structure. This dryness suggests good aging potential, as does the ripeness of the fruit and the acidity. Keep for at least 6 years.
title: Pierre Morey 2005 Grands Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: A round, full-bodied wine that goes for the generous, opulent fruity aspect of red Burgundy with its big, blowsy red fruits, just kept in check by tannins. The acidity is lively and fresh, keeping pace with the intense vibrant fruits. Screwcap.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2005  Chambertin

description: An impressive wine, fueled by black plum juice flavors. The acidity is just right, balancing the richness of the fruit. The wine revels in the serious side of Echezeaux, packed with dark, tight tannins over the fruit. It needs at least five years, maybe 10.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2005  Echézeaux

description: The Côtes d'Auxerre, west of Chablis, is the last outpost of Chardonnay in Burgundy. That results in this cool style of wine, light and fruity with apple and green-plum fruitiness. There is a zest to the wine, a lightly mineral texture and attractive final acidity. Drink now.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2015  Bourgogne Côtes d’Auxerre

description: This is a soft, gently fruity wine. It comes from a single vineyard creating a wine that has rounded yellow and pear fruits and balanced acidity. It is a smooth wine, made to be drink young.
title: Cave de Lugny 2015 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Apart from being part of a sparkling wine blend, Aligoté is found in the Côte Chalonnaise where it produces ripe full wines. They have a delicious crisp green fruit and floral character. It is a wine to drink young and fruity, so drink now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne Aligoté)

description: This is a light, crisp and fruity wine. Full of ripe green plums and crisp acidity, it is a wine that is all fruit. A light touch of minerality gives texture and complements the refreshing, floral aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: Concentrated and powerful, this wine is rich and full in the mouth, with wonderful ripe fruits over the great tannins. It is solid, dark and dense, full of smoky flavors and a rich strawberry flavor. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Clos Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This Beaune bottling has a dense structure that broods through its tannic outer skin. Perfumed red fruits will shortly burst out to give an opulent, rich wine with both great acidity and layers of spice that finish with freshness. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Clos des Ursules Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Severe and austere at this stage, this solid, dark wine has all the weight of a wine from Gevrey, concentrated and densely tannic. It's firm, packed with dark plum fruit and perfumed acidity. It's foursquare, demanding long aging. Drink from 2021
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this structured wine is complex and still very closed up, with dense tannins and dark fruit. Powerful with dark plum flavors, it is firmly textured and needs plenty of time for aging. Drink from 2020
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Charmes-Chambertin

description: This wine has power and firm tannins. Intensely fresh, it offers acidity and red-currant flavors that burst out of the dark, dry core. It's complex, with a touch of spice from wood aging that gives an elegant, delicious aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Toasty aromas are not enough to smother the intense, rich and concentrated fruitiness of this powerful wine. Structured and with a firm backbone, it is slow in developing. its brooding dark character still very obvious. However, the fruit is all there, waiting to release the burst of red-berry flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013  Clos de Vougeot

description: Aux Echanges is one of the smallest Premier Crus in Chambolle on the northern end close to Morey Saint-Denis, an area that gives a firm character to the wine. The structure is all there with some solid tannins although the wine also has superripe red fruits that are delicious and jammy. Full in the mouth, it is still young, so drink from 2019.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 Aux Échanges Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: The first things to notice are the tannins with a strongly dry core. This wine is dark, dense and concentrated, still allowing red fruits and acidity to give freshness. It is a big, juicy wine with a great future. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Procès Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The wine has barnyard aromas that need to blow off. It has firm dry tannins and dense red fruits that, again, need to integrate. It has a good future, though, as a wine that will be solid, rich and dense. Drink from 2024.
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Les Grands Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Structured and dense with tannins, this is a big wine with a big future. Its black fruits, acidity and solid texture all point to its weight and richness. It is going to be a rich fruity wine. But wait until 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: The Suremain family winery in the main street of Mercurey has cellars going back to the 17th century. This wood-aged wine will have been kept here, where it has developed into a structured and firm wine, full of dry tannins as well as ripe red-berry fruits. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2015 Les Crêts Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Produced from 100-year-old vines, this wine has been aged for nearly three years and has lost its intense fruitiness. Wood and spice flavors are present along with a perfumed intensity and toastiness. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2014 Aux Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has the weight that is typical of this appellation. It is full bodied, ripe with melon and yellow fruits. Contrasting with that, a crisper edge brings out minerality and a nervy texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Macherelles Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a structured, full-bodied wine that has solid tannins and concentrated fruitiness. It is packed with red-berry flavors, ripe tannins and spice from the wood aging. The wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Showing a dry character from the wood aging, this spicy wine also has fruit weight. While it is still young, its ripe berry flavors laced with black cherries are right up front. It does have the rounded character of a Beaune and this will develop more strongly. Drink from 2021.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Clos de l'Ermitage  (Beaune)

description: Produced from vines close to the chateau of Santenay, this is a tight, mineral wine. It has intense crisp acidity, tangy citrus and excellent potential. The fruit is asking for time to fill out, so drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 La Comme Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Soft and aromatic, the wine is fruity with open tannins and plenty of acidity. It is smooth and developing quickly, showing its red-currant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2015 Aux Clous Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The wine is structured and with bold red fruits. It also has a firm texture, layers of tannins and a solid texture. Acidity shines through at the end. These elements promise a serious wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Ecussaux Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: Ripe, fruity while also rich, this is a soft wine that's developing quickly. It has some smokiness, gentle tannins and a juicy texture. Drink this already easy wine from 2015.
title: Henri de Villamont 2011 Les Champs Claude  (Santenay)

description: Broad and rich, it has already developed to give ripe yellow and green fruits that have fully integrated into the fresher, mineral structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Jacques Charlet 2011 Les Vieux Murs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A strong wood element dominates this wine. It's all toasty and juicy from wood aging rather than fruit. It does have the weight to suggest some fruit for the future, but the wood, with its bite and tang, will always be a strong presence.
title: Vincent 2012 Marie Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fresh and fruity, it shows crispness as well as white fruits, orange zest and a lively lemon aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine André Bonhomme 2012 Les Pierres Blanches  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Attractive red fruits dominate this light and fruity wine. Good acidity and bright flavors are smoothed by wood, while the aftertaste brings back the fruit. Drink now.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011  Bourgogne

description: Some oak aging shows in the smoothness of the wine, which has good concentration as well as young fruitiness. It is tangy with a mineral texture and richness that come from the lees aging in barrel. The wine should mature a little longer, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal Bouchard 2014 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This is a rounded, ripe and full-bodied wine, with spice and light toastiness that give richness. Apple and green-plum flavors are enhanced by the creamy texture and touches of apricots. It is young and drinkable now, although will likely be much better from the end of 2016.
title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is ripe with a texture that remains tangy while also showing rich yellow and white fruits. A rustic edge adds interest rather than detracting from the quality. With its acidity and zesty citrus character, the aftertaste leaves a fresh, crisp feeling. Drink now.
title: Château de Santenay 2012  Mercurey

description: The wine has a stalky character, with bitter cherry fruits and light, lean acidity. Very textured, its tannins give a dry feeling to the finish. Drink from 2014.
title: Roche de Bellene 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: An attractively fruity wine, it has apple flavors cut with lime juice. Bright, crisp and laced with acidity, it could age but is already delicious to drink.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2012 Clos Philippe-le-Hardi  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: Light and fruity, it's fresh and crisp with citrus and toast flavors. Already balanced and with good final acidity, it can be drunk easily now.
title: Chartron et Trébuchet 2012 Bourgogne  (Bourgogne)

description: Still very young, this wine is potentially crisp while also ripe. Citrus and yellow fruits present a fruit salad of flavors that are balanced by a more steely character. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Cave de Lugny 2013 La Côte Blanche  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: The line of premier cru vineyards runs to the west of the town of Givry, with Servoisine touching the town's last houses. The wine is ripe and juicy, hiding its tannins in the heart of generous rich red fruits. It is likely to be a wine that will develop quickly and should be ready from 2019.
designation: Domaine de la Ferté Servoisine Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté Servoisine Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: This ripe, spicy wine offers apple, pear and apricot flavors, giving ripeness and warm juicy acidity. The wine is smooth and rounded, with a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This The wine from a monopole vineyard shows the intense acidity of the vintage yet also bursts with red berry fruit, underlined with firm tannins. Drink now, or better yet, from 2018.
designation: Clos les Grands Voyens Premier Cru
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2014 Clos les Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Produced at Château Ravatys for négociant Florent Descombe, this wine is rich and creamy. Wood aging has given it light toastiness and fine, ripe white fruit flavor. Already sophisticated wine, it will age further and be better from 2018.
title: Florent Descombe 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: At the northern end of the Ladoix appellation, this small Premier Cru has produced a red-fruited wine shot through with acidity and spicy flavors. It is juicy, showing red cherries, raspberries bolstered with a layer of tannins. The wine is ready to drink, although it will age at least until 2023.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2013 La Micaude Premier Cru  (Ladoix)

description: Unusually, this premier cru vineyard produces both red and white wines, both of which are made by this domaine. The wine is soft, rounded and with a ripe creamy character. It has plenty of crisp apple and rich pear flavors along with enough acidity to keep it bright and tangy. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Les Bousselots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Four parcels in the Clos du Roi Premier Cru go into this wine. It is structured and firm—a wine for aging. It has a strongly mineral character, concentrated tannins as well as black-cherry fruit and freshening acidity. Drink the wine from 2018.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Old vines from the vineyard next to the winery produce a luscious full wine. With its pear, peach and ripe apple flavors, these 70-year-old vines show their richness and concentration. It is opulent, structured and packed with juicy acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Vieilles Vignes de Sainte-Claire  (Chablis)

description: Ten months of wood aging has given this wine richness and fine spiciness. It is rich while still textured with minerality and tight citrus flavors. With its juicy acidity, the wine will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Clos des Hâtes  (Santenay)

description: A blend of 30% Pinot Noir and 70% Gamay, this is a fruity wine with the softest tannins and red cherry flavor. Made to drink young, it's somewhat spoiled by a banana-like edge that comes from its vinification.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2015  Coteaux Bourguignons

description: Toasty and ripe, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine full of yellow fruits lifted by crisp apple and lime juice. Rich while also fresh, it's a warm wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Valanges 2014 Paquet Mathieu  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This open, soft wine brings out some of the ripe fruit flavors of the vintage. It has attractive melon and apricot fruit along with a tight streak of mineral acidity. It's ready to drink now, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine Perraud 2015 L'Oeuvre de Perraud  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Red fruit and wood are both prominent in this wine. A juicy red-currant character shows through the high-toast flavor. Attractive and fruity, it is likely to develop quickly. Drink this soft wine from 2018.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This crisp, tangy wine is packed with citrus flavors. Brightly textured with a mineral edge, it is fruity, hinting at spice along with a floral, fresh character.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Chenevières  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is still young and developing. It is beginning to show its richer lemon and apple flavors, but it still needs more time. Wait until 2017.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2014  Saint-Véran

description: From outlying vineyards in the Côte d'Or, the heartland of Burgundy, this wood-aged wine is full of red currants and attractive, easy acidity. With a touch of spice and a juicy aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Bourgogne

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine offers crisp apples and pear-juice flavors. It has a strongly tangy element that is refreshing and delicious now.
title: Louis Max 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From the area known as Pierres Dorées because of the gold-colored stone used in buildings, this wine is soft and fruity. It carries a touch of tannin along with red-cherry crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: Always one of the most impressive of the Grand Crus, Les Clos reveals itself slowly. This dense, wood aged wine is still firm, very mineral in texture, chewy and dense, Age this wine and don't drink before 2018.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe, complex, wood-aged wine. It has weight in its structure and mineral texture. Along with this, there is rich fruitiness, yellow fruits laced with lime. Concentrated and dense, this is a powerful wine, showing great potential for the future. Keep for at least four years.
title: Château Fuissé 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is rich and ripe, with just a touch of wood influence. It has a tropical fruit and lime flavor, with lemon zest acidity. It is full, very structured and mineral, adding the complexity of ripe fruit. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Taut, and closed, this is very structured. The green fruits, mineral structure and flinty character offer a severe, complex wine. Layered with a caramel note, this is set to age over many years. Screwcap.
designation: Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru
title: Domaine Laroche 2010 Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Big and rounded, this will eventually develop into a ripe, complex wine. Spice and toast notes merge with the yellow fruits and structured nervosity.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010 La Romanée Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a floral wine that combines structure, firm acidity and intensely ripe fruit. Flavors of green fruit, citrus, toast and some smoke give complexity to this concentrated, full-bodied effort.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010 Les Combettes Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This blend of premier crus and some village Côte de Beaune shows generous red-cherry fruit and a touch of acidity. Its depth of richness and complexity highlight its fine origins.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2010  Côte de Beaune

description: A beautifully perfumed wine from one of Volnay's top vineyards, this delights with its aromatic red fruits, ripe tannins and balancing acids. It is still settling down and will certainly round out over the next years when its more sumptuous side will come forward.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2010 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is a taut wine, touched by yeast and warmed by ripe yellow fruit. Flavors of melon and spice from the new wood give it an open feel. It's ripe, already rounded and full bodied.
title: Louis Latour 2010 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a structured wine with rich, concentrated fruits. It has a strong mineral content along with a tense texture. Tropical fruit flavors come through on the rich, opulent finish.
title: Louis Latour 2010 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Honey and wood aromas lead to a rich, generally rounded wine. Having aged in wood, the white fruits are full, soft and ripe. It's not all immediate pleasure; the wine has a more complex undertow of structure, sweet malolactic character and complex acidity on the finish.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2010 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Steely, minerally and very textured, this has concentratio and taut layer of acidity to go with the lime fruit. Powered by its structure, it will age for 3–4 years.
title: Romain Bouchard 2010 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is firm, showing a ripe plum-skin flavor and a severe line of tannin. There's some bitterness along with a good depth of fruit flavor, structure and acidity, all of which suggest aging potential.
title: Louis Max 2009 Clos des Chênes  (Volnay)

description: A rounded, wood-aged wine, this is full of ripe red-berry and spice flavors, with a core of warm, smoky tannins. It is structured and should age over several years.
designation: Domaine de la Créa Les Grands Picotins
title: Louis Max 2010 Domaine de la Créa Les Grands Picotins  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The premier cru is right in the heart of the appellation, close to the village. This wine, with its intense fruits and strongly textured character, is still trying out its structure and density. The potential is there with apricot and apple fruits waiting to come thorough the tight structure. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Produced from old vines, this is a beautiful wine. It has great structure, minerality and concentration along with a full-bodied richness that is developing well. Combined with the ripe yellow fruits, they give an opulent wine that will age for several years. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Fuissé 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a full-bodied, dense wine. A hint of austerity in the mineral texture gives the wine a steely core. Around this center, ripe fruit fills out the wine and gives apricots and generous fruitiness as well as a crisp, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2013 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Floral and aromatic, this is a ripe wine with delicious, intense acidity as well as a touch of honey. Rich peach and pear come through strongly. It's a refreshing, juicy wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Les Vaucoupins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A ripe wine from vines close to Volnay, this is dense and very textured. It shows wood, although not too much, and a creamy character. Minerality gives a good sense of structure to this concentrated, balanced wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Henri de Villamont 2013 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: The southern part of the Montmains vineyard has produced a smooth, rounded wine that is full of honey and apricots, with a warm texture. It's a fruity wine, soft and demanding to be drunk now, with citric freshness at the end.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2013 Butteaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This rich wine is structured, with orange zest and apple skins given a boost of fragrant acidity. It's packed with yellow fruits and the freshest acidity. Drink this lightly tannic wine now, although it would be better to wait until 2017.
title: Les Héritiers du Comte Lafon 2013 Clos du Four  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: An intense, mineral-driven wine, tasting of the limestone soil as well as very ripe fruit. Great acidity keeps the richness in line, toast offering sweetness. The wine is full-bodied, the flavors going right through to the apple-skin-textured core.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2009 Clos Saint Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A taut, steely, very mineral wine, showing a tense, textured character. Fruit flavors run from grapefruit to peach, with a delicious tang of zest along the way. With its acidity and structure, this is a wine for long-term aging.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2009 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: A toasty, smoky wine, with freshening acidity, crisp green and white fruits and an attractive edge of toasty oak. The wine is lively, fresh, delicious, very poised and vibrant.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2007 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a ripe, wood-aged wine that shows the richer side of Meursault. It's generous with ripe yellow fruits, but balanced and complemented by crisp acidity and hints of toastiness. A fine wine with impeccable structure, it will age well, so drink from 2015.
designation: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Ripe, creamy wine with a good toast element. It is smooth, elegant, the flavors showing almonds, vanilla, baked apple and pear enlivened by fresh acidity. Attractive, ready to drink.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2008 Buissonnier Montagny  (Montagny)

description: A darkly tannic wine, showing a dry side of Pinot Noir but still offering some good berry fruits and raspberry sweetness. The acidity needs to soften, though.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2007  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: A fresh, lightweight Chardonnay, hinting at citrus and almonds. There is a taut, tannic edge to the yellow fruits, the acidity turning to a firm texture. Final acidity is fresh and crisp.
title: Cave de Lugny 2008 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This ripe, yellow-fruit-flavored wine has a smooth, rich texture. Full and flavorsome, it conveys a ripe, nutty character. The wine with its warm fruitiness is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015  Mâcon Solutré

description: Made from 65- to 80-year-old vines, this wine offers wood spice as well as apple and citrus fruit flavors. An underlying richness balances the acidity and crisp texture. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from 2017.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat Sous les Plantes  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Vines in deep red-iron soil on this tiny biodynamic family parcel (1.3 acres) are just coming into their own. This ripe wine balances rich yellow fruit with a tight shot of acidity and citrus. Fresh and crisp with touches of spice and butter., it is ready to drink.
designation: Domaine La Soufrandière Climat les Longeays
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Domaine La Soufrandière Climat les Longeays  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: This wine shows some maturity, with toast flavors coming through the creamy mousse. White stone fruit and streaks of citrus give a fresher end to this well-balanced wine.
title: Cave de Viré NV Bruto  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: The magnificently named vineyard, the seat of God, is set in the hills next to Saint-Aubin. This wine is crisp while also having a warm, rich backdrop of yellow fruit. The chalk soil gives the wine its tight minerality and texture. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Hautes Cotes de Beaune)

description: With big holdings in the appellation, the Château de Santenay produces a range of wines. This single-vineyard bottling is typically rich and rounded. It cushions the tannins with ripe fruit and gentle acidity. Developing well, the wine will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Le Bois de Lalier  (Mercurey)

description: Crisp apple flavors show strongly in this wine that offers good acidity and a tight, lively aftertaste. The brightness pushes the citrus character forward, leaving a lively, refreshing aftertaste.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is ripe and full, with a soft, creamy character that is warm and smooth. A light brushing of toast brings out spice. This attractive, rounded wine is ready to drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Spicy, fruity and attractive, this balanced wine has acidity, tight minerality, yellow fruits and a richer texture. Full bodied and generous, it will age well. Drink from 2017.
title: Christophe Cordier 2014 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A warm and fruity wine, it is softly textured, ripe peach and apricot flavors. The acidity gives just enough freshness to a wine that is ripe, rounded and ready to drink.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2012 Solaire  (Mâcon-Vinzelles)

description: Light colored wine with a touch of smokiness and soft, ripe fruits. It lacks definition, giving an open feeling without much structure. Wood aging gives a burnt character at the end.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2011  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Rich and creamy, rounded by toast and honey with some spiced fruits. The texture is more wood than fruit, needing time to evolve.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2008 Les Chailloux  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe, rounded wine, wood balancing with rich fruits. Flavors of honeyed toast go with ripe red apple juice and a soft aftertaste.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2008 Domaine Delaye les Clochettes  (Mâcon-Prissé)

description: Soft, green fruited wine, an attractive mix of crisp fruits and weighty texture. There is a good bite of pepper and apple skin that develops as the wine opens up.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2008 La Grande Bruyère  (Saint-Véran)

description: A soft, fruity wine, touched with vanilla and citrus. It is full, ripe, some tropical fruits and showing a final fresh acidity.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2008  Saint-Véran

description: Mouth-watering in its bright, pear juice freshness, this is a crisp and lemony wine, touched by cream with a tight texture layered by wood. The acidity is crisp, dominant.
title: Albert Bichot 2008  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Really toasty, honey and lemon style of Chardonnay, tight and crisp. There are plenty of green plum and grapefruit flavors. Deliciously crisp, while also ripe.
title: Bret Brothers 2008 Domaine la Soufrandière  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: While there is a somewhat meaty edge to this wine, it also has good rich texture. It probably needs time to bring out the full potential of its ripe yellow fruits.
title: Bret Brothers 2008 En Carementrant  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A wine that is full in the mouth, offering some wood flavors, also some tight acidity and a final, crisp edge.
title: Château de Fuissé 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine seems soapy and out of focus. It's soft while missing fruit. The acidity and freshness at the end are the best parts.
title: Pierre Cornu Camus 2011  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: This rather closed wine has layers of sulfur that have suppressed the fruit. It's cool, neutral and dull.
title: Joseph Burrier 2012 Château de Beauregard  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe tropical-fruit flavors give this wine a rich, rounded character. The attractive apricot and peach fruits are cut by citrus acidity to keep the freshness right up front. An opulent, full-bodied wine, it's ready to drink now.
title: Domaine le Virolys 2014  Viré-Clessé

description: From a selection of old vines in four parcels, the wine has rich fruits, concentrated blackberry flavors and fully integrated tannins. It is ripe, juicy with fine acidity and a good potential. Drink this fine and fruity wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The wine is from a tiny parcel (around an acre) of vines that are over 30-years-old. It is concentrated both with fine fruit and sweet acidity. Yellow fruits are cut with lime and green plums. A touch of vanilla gives the wine a full final aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2015 La Grande Bruyère  (Mâcon-Fuissé)

description: This lean, firmly tannic wine is more about structure than fruit. There is a burnt, chocolate- and bitter-coffee flavor that gives edge to the palate, while firm tannins enrobe black-cherry fruit. Drink from 2016.
designation: Cuvée Signature Les Charmots Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2011 Cuvée Signature Les Charmots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From the area known as Pierres Dorées because of the gold-colored stone used in buildings, this wine is soft and fruity. It carries a touch of tannin along with red-cherry crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: A simple, straightforward wine, this has an attractive mineral, tangy texture to go with the bright citrus fruit. Crisp and refreshing, it is ready to drink.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: From a Chablis producer, this rosé is cool, crisp and fresh. It has plenty of red fruits and a tight mineral texture. A smooth caramel flavor balanced by juicy acidity keeps the wine deliciously refreshing.
title: Domaine Céline et Frédéric Gueguen 2015  Bourgogne

description: This wine is light and fruity with citrus and red apples. It misses out on crispness, giving a more rounded character. It should be kept for a few months and drunk from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015  Mâcon-Charnay

description: This citrus-laden wine shows its fresh fruits right up front. It is bright, crisp and full of lime and lemon flavors. Spiciness adds extra interest. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2014 Terroirs  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Light and fruity, this is an easy, immediately accessible wine. Soft apple and creamed-pear flavors are balanced with acidity and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Mâcon-Villages

description: Ripe and full, this is an apricot-and melon-flavored wine. With this ripeness comes a soft texture that offers some warm acidity and a perfumed aftertaste. From 50+-year-old vines, the wine is attractive now and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine des Granges  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The fruit here is attractive, pears and white currants on top of pink grapefruit and orange zest. It shows its structure and its tense minerality only slowly, allowing the acidity to give it a lift and vibrancy. This is a wine that is still young, still smoothing out its hard edges.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Very concentrated and closed up, like a coil. The intense green fruit is followed by plum skins. Crispness, dry but fresh, comes alongside a powerful explosion of flavors.
title: Albert Bichot 2005 Domaine Long-Depaquit Vaudésirs Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Steeliness exemplified in wine. This is crisp and structured, complex with its green fruits, structured acidity and touch of caramel and kiwi. It's the acidity that shows at the moment; needs 4–5 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2005 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Generous in style, with great freshness. The flavors are rich, touched by caramel, ripe white currants and some spice. A fine, red apple skin structure comes through to finish.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2005 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is the second wine from the Château Grenouilles vineyard, very fresh, but at the same time weighty and concentrated, with wood, caramel and generous fruits. Age for 5 years.
designation: Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru
title: La Chablisienne 2005 Les Fiefs de Grenouilles Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A fruity wine, it has fresh citrus and pear flavors. It is very light with just hints of texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2012  Petit Chablis

description: The light color of this wine continues to the light palate, which just hints at strawberry fruits. Soft, finishing with fresh acidity, this lightweight wine should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Chêne 2011  Bourgogne

description: Full-on style of wine, packed with apricot and peach flavors, spiced up with cinnamon, layered with toast and finishing with delicious, open acidity. A wine that shows why St-Aubin is a village that is worth paying attention to.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 La Chatenière Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Lively, fresh and crisp, brightened with citrus flavors. White currant fruits burst out of the wine, leaving an aftertaste of crisp steeliness.
title: Louis Latour 2006 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Juicy and fruity, this has apple and lemon flavors that combine with a steely edge. It's refreshing and crisp, with a bright, lively character, and a tang on the finish.
title: La Chablisienne 2010 La Sereine  (Chablis)

description: Ripe and full bodied, this is a wine that reflects the softness of the vintage. Aged in wood, it has a rounded texture, with spice, apricot and pineapple flavors, finishing with a touch of acidity.
title: Michel Picard 2009 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Opulent and ripe, full bodied and rich, this has notes of toast and spice as well as apricot and pear flavors. With its balanced character, it can be consumed now, but it will also age for another year.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2010 Domaine Beranger  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A delicious, mineral structured wine, very pure. The acidity is a great layer going through the textured white fruits, the wood just there as a subtle support.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2007  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Soft in character and rounded, this is a full-bodied wine, feeling fat and gently textured. The yellow fruits are sweet, ripe, buoyed by wood and finishing with attractive acidity.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras
title: Collovray et Terrier 2008 Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras  (Saint-Véran)

description: Swathes of ripe fruit over a broad layer of wood, a generous, opulent character, ripe, the spice from wood giving a good, rich final character.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2008 Cray vers Vaux  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is such a perfumed wine with deceptively soft tannins and great fruit. The acidity is classic for the vintage, with raspberries and intense freshness at the end. It has a fine line of tannins and a life that will go far. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Lambrays 2014  Clos de Lambrays

description: This wine is dense, although you hardly notice the tannins for the weight of concentrated fruit. The tannins are there, though, a power to thrust this immense wine well into the future. It is well formed, firm while rich. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Chambertin)

description: This wine is rich, concentrated and ripe. With its opulent mix of yellow fruits, citrus and sliced apple—a real fruit salad—it is also balanced with spice and wood flavors. The fruit is rich and will develop well. Drink this from 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Bienvenues Bâtard-Montrachet

description: This massive wine is powered by dark, concentrated and smoky tannins that are masking the fruit. Dry and dense, it will take many years for the black fruits behind the facade to develop. Drink this intense wine from 2025.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Grands-Echezeaux)

description: Initially showing considerable wood flavors, this wine hints at its rich fruit through its weight and concentration. Spice, toast and beautifully ripe yellow fruits are slowly coming together and will harmonize with time to showcase a rich, opulent and impressive selection. Drink from 2022.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Corton Vergennes

description: This walled vineyard has produced a surprisingly tannic, if impressive, wine for a Savigny in this vintage. It has a dark and firm character, the red berry fruits just beginning to break through the firm and dry tannins. It needs 4–5 years' aging.
title: Pierre André 2009 Clos des Guettottes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A dry core pervades this full-bodied wine. Red fruits are masking its delicious ripe meat and sweet jam flavors. There is a distinct tannic element that holds this attractive wine together.
title: Château de la Crée 2007 En Foulot  (Santenay)

description: A firmly tannic wine, the ripe fruit surrounded by a dry shell. It is already showing the firm chunky character of Nuits-St-Georges, with its dark plum and bitter cherry fruits well into the complex mix of flavors. Age for at least three years.
title: Labouré-Roi 2009 Les Hauts Tours  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: White wines are rare in the Côte de Nuits and this wine is as structured as many reds. It does have strong toast flavors, a juicy citrus character and pear flavors. They go with an apple skin and spice aftertaste, laced with acidity. Drink until 2022.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2011 Les Monts de Boncourt  (Côtes de Nuits Villages)

description: Still firm and closed, this is a structured wine, solidly tannic with just hints of fruit. It has a dry feel to it, firm, the acidity and red fruits coming through the leathery, dark texture. The wine needs aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Evening Land 2011  Clos de Vougeot

description: L'Homme Mort is a northern extension of the Fourchaume Premier Cru vineyard, so called because this was where a local lord dispensed justice by death. It often produces cooler wines such as this. It is tight, with toasted bread hints and with a strongly tangy character. It does need to develop and shouldn't be drunk before 2018.
title: Domaine Chenevières 2014 L'Homme Mort Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From old vines, this rich and concentrated wine is dominated by ripe apple and pear flavors. They combine with the well-judged toastiness from wood aging to give a full, dense wine will age well. Drink from 2018.
designation: Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru
title: Domaine Laroche 2013 Les Vaillons Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Laroche sources grapes from outside the Chablis area to make this elegant, smooth, caramel- and peach-flavored wine. A touch of wood lends a note of spice and adds to the round texture. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2011  Bourgogne

description: Fruity and attractively wood aged, this is soft and round, with a bright edge of acidity that brings out the taut, refreshing finish.
title: Albert Bichot 2010  Bourgogne

description: This is light and fruity, but it could use some more concentration. It has an attractive apple flavor and a touch of citrus. For a grand cru, it is surprisingly ready to drink.
title: Domaine L. Chatelain 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A soft and rounded wine, full of ripe fruits that command all the attention. Red fruits dominate, just supported by tannins and a firm dryness. This is a rich wine that will age quickly, worth drinking in the next two years.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2010  Beaune

description: A chunky, solid wine, its tannins as important as its fruitiness. It shows black fruits, ripe bitter cherry flavors, along with dense tannins. Offering a powerful blast of Pinot Noir, and worth aging for three years.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2011  Pommard

description: Full, ripe wine, layered with fruits and a dry, more mineral core. The wine has good depth of flavor, strawberries, red currants and a citrus cut that keeps the wine fresh at the end.
title: Louis Bouillot NV Rosé Perle d'Aurore  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a lightly smoky wine from vineyards in the hills behind the Côte de Beaune. It is spicy with a touch of wood as well as red-cherry fruitiness. The wine needs to age a few months, so drink from late 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Les Belles Roches  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: This spicy, wood-laden wine has strong burnt-toast flavors that have suppressed the fruit. Hints of ripe fruits lie behind the spice and vanilla. Drink this from 2018, in case the wood integrates better.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Smoky and with strong wood flavors, this wine also has an attractive crisper edge that gives it a bright character. A lively wine, it's both rich and crisp. Drink now.
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Vieilles  (Viré-Clessé)

description: This soft, ripe wine has good apricot and peach flavors alongside the crisper citrus acidity. It is spicy, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château de Beauregard 2015 Vignes Blances  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine is juicy with intense acidity. Its red-currant flavor is consistent with this acidity. Tannins are firm and will soften. The juicy aftertaste gives the wine crispness.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This fruity wine is full of bright acidity. Crisp and clean, it shows yellow fruits and a shot of citrus. The aftertaste is lively and bright. Drink now.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2016 Clos de la Bressande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Bright and fruity, this delicious wine is crisp, clean and refreshing. With yellow fruits followed by zesty acidity, it's both open and textured. Drink now.
title: Domaine Touzot 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: From vines in the vineyards behind the Côtes de Nuits, this wine is warm, smooth and ripe. It offers yellow fruits as well as rich apple and enough acidity to give a crisp edge. It's attractive and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: With the concentration that comes from old vines, this is a rich wine intense with black-fruit flavors. It offers layers of wood and spice, with tannins and a dense texture that mean it is only just ready to drink. Rich and dark, it will be better from 2017.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine is ripe and packed with yellow-fruit flavors. It is smooth with a touch of butteriness. This is ready to drink, rich with bright acidity at the end.
title: Nadine et Maurice Guerrin 2014 La Côte Rôtie  (Saint-Véran)

description: Strongly mineral in character, this is a crisp, tight wine that is still young, bright with acidity and citrus flavors. The touches of wood are just right and give an extra dimension to this fruity wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Philippe Colin 2014  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: The chalk soil of the appellation is reflected well in this tangy, mineral wine that shows hints of the wood aging in large barrels, which rounds out the crisp fruits and gives a pinch of spice. The wine is still young and will be better from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Meursault

description: With the velvet texture typical of the appellation, this smooth wine offers a good balance between the red fruits and soft tannins. A smoky edge mingles with the berry-fruit acidity to give a wine ready to drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Named after the current generation's grandmother, this wine comes from family vines. It is crisp with the strong mineral character typical of the vintage. The acidity and citrus fruits are up front and ready to drink now.
title: Vincent 2014 Marie-Antoinette  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Full of spice, ripe toastiness and rich apple flavors, this structured wine has good potential. Lively acidity brings out the citrus and freshness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Vins Auvigue 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is ripe, full of red plums and soft tannins. It has a rich feel, soft and fruity. The tannins are velvety with juicy acidity and a generous feel. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Valmur is considered to produce a generous style of Grand Cru, and this wine lives up to that. It's warm and rounded while never losing touch with the crisper side of a great Chablis. The ripe white and yellow fruits are on the rich side, cut with citrus acidity and underlined by wood aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2012 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Wood and fruit balance in this rich and full wine. The yellow and citrus fruits give a good mix of ripeness and a fresher, more mineral character. The toast, just the right amount, gives the warmth and polish the wine needs. The result is a serious wine, still young, to be drunk from 2018.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2012 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Crisp and edgy, this is a ripe while crisp and cool wine. With bright acidity and tangy lemon zest, it's a still young and full of citrus fruits. The mineral, taut texture promises some good aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2012 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Inevitably, coming from a Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is still very young. It has the beginnings of ripe black plum fruits that will develop well. For the moment, the tannins and structure show most strongly. Give this concentrated wine until 2019.
title: Manuel Olivier 2012  Clos de Vougeot

description: Impressively rich and dense, with dark plum and sweet fruits signalling opulence. The wine has power and intensity although it never loses the acidity of the vintage.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2008 Clos Vougeot  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: Black cherry juice vies with a dense structure in this powerful wine. It has layers of tannins and sweetness. This is a firm, solid wine packed inside velvet. Age for 10 years and more.
title: Louis Latour 2009 Les Quatre Journaux  (Romanée-St.-Vivant)

description: A warm, rich wine, with cream and butter flavors lying over the more textured acidity. The wood is just noticeable, adding its smoky character to the yellow fruits and citrus.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2008 Les Folatières  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This wonderful, mineral wine boasts the ripe apricot and peach fruits of the year combined with a taut texture, well-integrated wood and a great waft of citrus to close.
title: Louis Latour 2009 Les Folatières  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Showing austerity via its tannins, this is a severe wine despite its red berry fruit. It has layers of wood and a dry core. Age for six years or more.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2008 Clos de Fèves  (Beaune)

description: Fruity and structured, this strongly wood-aged wine is packed with toast. That dominates the fresh apple and pear fruits that are underneath all this spice and toastiness. Rich and full bodied, the wine is still developing, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Ferret 2012 Cuvée Hors Classe Les Ménétrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This firm wine is solid with tannins while also having the fruitiness of the year. A dry element will allow the wine to age balanced, with bright juicy fruits shining through. It comes from one of the lesser-known premier cru vineyards in Beaune. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2013 Montée Rouge Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From the northernmost of the Premier Crus on the left bank of the Serein river, this wine benefits from the early-ripening vines. It is rich, rounded and soft with a creamy texture. It also offers tangy acidity and lime flavor. Still young, it needs time, so drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Pascal Bouchard 2014 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Just below the main street of Chassagne-Montrachet village, this vineyard has produced a beautiful wine. Apples and crisp citrus are allied with the lightest touch of wood to give a dancing, juicy wine with serious depths of flavor. Bright and young to drink now, it will age gently into a riper future. Drink now, but the wine will be much better from 2018.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2013 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Ripe, tropical-fruited wine, with apricot and peach and layers of toasty wood. The wine is fresh, finely balanced, finishing with a citrus hint.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2008 Les Cras  (Vougeot)

description: Rich in character, with big citrus, pineapple and pink grapefruit flavors. Even if it is rich, the wine also gives freshness as well as acidity to balance the full-bodied texture
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2009 Clos de Mazeray  (Meursault)

description: This is a very perfumed wine, full of red fruits and hedgerow berry flavors cut with some firm tannins. It has an aromatic character that is typical of Chambolle-Musigny, a soft, warm texture that is developing behind the tannins. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013  Chambolle-Musigny

description: There is some solid structure here, along with a tannic edge that marks out a wine for aging. This has plum skin and a dense texture that brings out a richness as well as the acidity that marks the vintage. It should be aged; drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2012  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: This wine is rich with the sort of firm tannins that will give great supporting structure to the ripe berry fruits. With a juicy character, the wine is fresh and balanced with the solid tannins. It likely will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Louis Max 2014 Domaine la Marche  (Mercurey)

description: A light, floating style, pierced with minerality and crisp green apple skin flavors. There is wood, but it is only just noticeable. With its structure and tense fruit, this is likely to age well: give it 5–8 years.
title: Labouré-Roi 2005 Château Labouré-Roi Premier Cru Poruzot  (Meursault)

description: Gentle and open, this is a ripe, apricot flavored wine. It has light acidity, its pleasure coming from the generous, full texture. It's ready to drink now.
title: Cave de Lugny 2011 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a warm, honey- and apple-flavored wine. It's fresh and full in the mouth with tight mineral acidity. It could well age a year or two, but is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Talmard 2011  Mâcon-Chardonnay

description: Ripe and fruity, this has a rich texture that comes both from the generous white fruits and from the cut of lemon acidity. A mineral-textured wine, it's crisp now and will likely round out to bring out the ripeness. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Puligny-Montrachet

description: With its crisp texture, this wine is bright and fruity, with good acidity and a complex background of spice, vanilla and yellow fruits. The wine is deliciously balanced and ready to drink.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Château la Vernalle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Produced at a Domaine that is run by the Arnoux family, the wine has both a rich side and a firm side. The rich side is expressed in the bold red fruits, while the firm side comes through in the tannins and structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink this dense wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Des Meix Porons 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The wine is structured, dense with tannins and smokiness from the wood aging. Its fruits, though in the background at this stage, offer fine black-cherry potential. Drink this concentrated wine from 2022.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: A smoky spicy wine that is full of berry fruits and with some toasty wood-aging flavors. With its tannic structure it will need to age, although already the bright berry fruits are generous and ripe. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Aromatic and rich, this rounded, ripe wine has hints of yellow fruits along with green plums, perfumed acidity and a hint of minerality. It's buttery at the end, with ripe, lively acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Still firm and with dry tannins, this is a structured wine, with red fruits and acidity behind the concentrated texture. It suggests the succulent ripe fruitiness that will develop as the wine ages. Drink this generous wine from 2021.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Chatelots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This is a smoky and ripe wine from Beaune's top premier cru. Structured, dusty tannins support the red fruits and acidity. The combination is already rich, but holds good potential as well. It will be best from 2020.
designation: Sur les Grèves Clos Sainte-Anne Premier Cru Monopole
title: Jaffelin 2014 Sur les Grèves Clos Sainte-Anne Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)

description: This wine is rich, firmly structured while also full of dense black fruits. It comes from one of the top premier-cru vineyards in the appellation, well situated halfway up the slope, facing east. The wine will develop slowly as the ripe fruit comes through the structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: From the highest point in the Meursault vineyards, this wine is crisp and cool. It has a tight, bright character that is driven by the steely, mineral texture. The grapefruit flavors go with the riper apple and pear roundness to give a wine that will take a little time to develop. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Château de Blagny Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: This wine has spice, juicy wood and good acidity that are well integrated. The rich, smooth fruit character contrasts with the more tangy wood acidity. Together, they bring a wine that has bite, with a mineral as well as toasty aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Verget 2014 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Every producer seems to own, or have access to, a small part of Clos de Vougeot even if quantities produced are tiny. This wine is still firm, packed with tannins although providing hints of the delicious red fruits to come. It is a structured while also generous wine, just needing time. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: This four-acre, east-facing slope has produced a rich, ripely maturing wine, with rounded red fruits layered with acidity. It's a generous wine, full in the mouth. The aftertaste continues the juicy, fruity theme, firmly sustained by the tannins.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This rich wine has spice and red fruits backed by a dry texture. The smoky wood is still right up front, giving the wine a firm character. Wait for the fruit to develop further and drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Produced from a small vineyard in Pouilly Fuissé, this rich wine is full of ripe, generous fruit. Spice and yellow-fruit flavors blend seamlessly with the soft texture and perfumed acidity. It is developing into a very fine wine, ready to drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015 Aux Chailloux  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine offers pure fruit flavors of crisp lemon, ripe apricots and apples, all nourished by carefully judged wood that gives a touch of toast. A strong mineral element gives the wine tight texture. As it develops, this will become a well-balanced wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Les Tillets  (Meursault)

description: Bought in 2006 by François Pinault, also owner of Bordeaux Château Latour, Domaine d'Eugenie (the former Domaine René Engel) is just starting out. Already the style, as in this wine, exhibits power, concentration and structure. But here, also, there is great, vibrant fruit, the red berry flavors rolling around the mouth.
title: Domaine d'Eugenie 2006  Clos de Vougeot

description: A firm and tannic wine initially, but then it opens out with such sweet, generous fruits and flavors of strawberries and pepper. The texture is dense, a vertical pile of ripe tannins and richness.
title: Domaine du Comte Liger-Belair 2006  Echézeaux

description: A big bruiser of a wine. It is easy to love the firm, complex structure allied with beautifully ripe, sweet fruit flavors. The wine is rich and powerful, but there are so many things going on here, from the intense tannins to the smoky black finish.
title: Maison Champy 2006  Echézeaux

description: An intensely perfumed wine, tight with tannins and red stone fruits. There is some hardness initially, then the wine opens out to give juicy, ripe red plums, dry tannins, spice and sweet acidity. The finish is full and dry. Age for several years.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2005 Les Petits Vougeot Premier Cru  (Vougeot)

description: The largest of the premier crus of Vosne-Romanée can make complete wines, as in this example. It has ripe fruit, touched with juiciness, but it is the enveloping firm and full structure that gives the wine its special character. It has a range of sweet fruit flavors, allied to dark tannins, suggesting aging potential.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Classic Pommard, a big, firm, tannic wine that is foursquare and dominating. It broods with its dense structure and concentration. The fruits are solid, with plum skins, red berries and bursts of acidity. All this adds up to a wine that needs to age. Aim for five years before drinking.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This wine is rich, sweet, extravagant and, finally, elegant. Its ripe fruit flavors, red plums, sweet strawberries and smoky acidity all work together. The wine shows considerable concentration, but never loses sight of freshness. Age for another five years at least.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Initially round, this develops a strong minerality, with a texture that is firm and dominating ripe fruit. There is definite austerity here. The wine is at present firm and tough, and needs several years to open up.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006  Chapelle-Chambertin

description: A structured, relatively cool Volnay, dominated more by ripe tannins than by fruit. The fruit that is there is fresh, layered with acidity, juicy in texture, with cranberry and black plum skin flavors. The finish suggests red berries with its firmness. The wine demands at least five years' aging.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Clos des Chênes Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A beautifully perfumed wine, all herbs and smokiness. The palate sings the same tune, a rich, sensuous one, laced with more somber notes of dark, dry tannins. At the end of the day, this is already a delicious wine, but one that will really improve over 5–10 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Corton is the largest grand cru in Burgundy (all of 240 acres) and its style can vary widely. Bouchard has gone for a relatively soft style, emphasizing fruits, raspberry, myrtle and black currants, topped with acidity. It is a light, delicious wine, but probably not for aging.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006  Corton

description: A dense, almost heavy wine, with smoky, licorice flavors that dominate the fruit. It is firm, big, solid, the sort of wine that demands attention with its concentration and powered structure. It may need time for aging, but already the power and weight are there.
title: Maison Champy 2006  Mazis-Chambertin

description: Spicy, smoky Lapsang Souchong tea aromas, pure acidity and juicy red plum flavors are all here in this big, but finely structured wine. The tannins are an essential part of the shape of the wine, but act as a support for its richness. The finish brings out the lively acidity of Pinot Noir. Age for five years.
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Echézeaux)

description: The richness of the fruit from Caillerets is so evident in this scrumptious wine. With its big, bold black fruits, it has sweetness, a soft, generous texture and evocative perfumes. It is so delicious and ready to drink now, that even the acidity that shows through has a hard time reminding us that this wine should age as well.
designation: Caillerets Premier Cru Ancienne Cuvée Carnot
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Caillerets Premier Cru Ancienne Cuvée Carnot  (Volnay)

description: This is a fruity wine with lively acidity and a brisk, zingy character. Freshness shoots through the wine, making it lively with hints of yellow fruits. The aftertaste is crisp and ripe.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2014 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Fresh and packed with red fruits, this wine comes from the Faiveley domaine. With raspberry flavors and plenty of acidity, the wine is forward and going to develop quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos des Myglands  (Mercurey)

description: Plenty of wood flavors give this wine a ripe, spicy and toasty character. It is rich and perfumed, with attractive hints of yellow fruits as well as the new wood. The wood does need to calm down before the wine is ready. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2014  Marsannay

description: Aged in wood for 15 months, this wine shows ripe flavors more from fruit than toast. Apricot and Williams pear flavors are richly integrated with the light spice and the lemon crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Rijckaert 2014 L'Epinet  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Even in a fruity year, Pommard lives up to its reputation for firm tannins. This wine will have delicious ripe black fruits, although not just yet. The structure and the dark tannins are up front, leaving tantalizing hints of the richness to come. Drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Pommard

description: From vines in the north of the Nuits Saint-Georges, close to Vosne-Romanée, this is a structured wine. It has ripe berry fruits and acidity that are still developing through the firm, dry tannins. The wine is still young and needs to age, so drink from 2019.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Full and ripe, this wine also has good acidity that gives a lively edge to the yellow-fruit flavors. Along with the peach and apricot fruits, it presents refreshing crispness. The aftertaste delivers a great lift of acidity.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2014  Mâcon-Davayé

description: This wine is smoky yet fresh and juicy. It has a light touch of red-currant fruits, a crisp texture and bright acidity. The tannins are gentle, leaving pride of place to the natural fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014  Mercurey

description: This delicious, refreshing wine is textured, tight and mineral, with fruity acidity. Tangy and crisp, it has a tight structure, touches of toast along with apple and citrus flavors. The wine is still young and very tight, so should not be drunk before 2017.
title: Domaine Gérard Duplessis 2013 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Although this wine is tight with tannins and wood aging, it shows the softer side of the appellation with its ripe red berry fruit. Needing more time in bottle to deliver the opulence of its fine Premier Cru vineyard, it will be best from 2022.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Rich, deliciously fruity and ripe, this combines warmth with a more mineral undertow that cuts through the palate, creating a wine that is refreshing and mouth-filling. It would be worth aging for two years or more.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Domaine Long-Depaquit  (Chablis)

description: This is an attractively structured wine, with ripe strawberry and smoky wood flavors. The fruit continues through to the soft finish, which is laced with acidity and a firm tannic core.
title: André Guichot 2010 La Maladière Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Savory, juicy, refreshing and textured, this has a crisp green-fruit feel, and is full of bright fruit flavors. The finish continues to express the lively, tight character of the wine.
title: Bernard Defaix 2010  Chablis

description: A heavily wood-aged wine, this wine has smoky, burnt-toast aromas. At the moment, ripe yellow-fruit flavors are submerged beneath this onslaught of wood, but it should integrate better, so give it until 2016.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2011 Mersault-Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Freshness is the hallmark of this attractively crisp, apple-flavored wine. The lightness of texture manages to retain some good green plum skin, apricot and lively acidity. The finish is pure, clean, slightly honeyed.
title: Domaine Pommier 2007  Petit Chablis

description: A firm, closed wine at this young stage, it has weight and a sense of rich fruit flavors. Coming from a limestone vineyard, it wears its minerality on its sleeve, a steely, structured wine, aged in wood, that needs several years to show its best. Give it five years or more.
title: Château Fuissé 2011 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Ripe and smooth, this is a light take on this Grand Cru. Red berry fruits are still smothered by the wood aging which brings in a strongly toasty element. The wine though has potential as it comes into balance, elegant and stylish. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Domaine des Perdrix  (Echézeaux)

description: A complex, full-bodied wine that is full of mature fruit flavors with a touch of toast to add to the attractive mix. With apple, quince and almonds well blended together, this is a finely balanced wine, that could age for a couple of years more.
title: Louis Bouillot 2007 Perle d'Or Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: With some richness, red fruits over wood and a full-bodied structure, this is a solid, dense wine. Acidity is present, while the ripe juicy fruits more than balance it. The tannins offer a firm structure and suggest aging.
title: Domaine de la Ferté 2008 Servoisine Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: This is a delicate wine, sweet strawberry and elegant structure combining over a soft texture. There is a hint of smokiness as an addition to the finely rounded aftertaste.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007 Les Feusselottes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: The wallled Clos des Ursulines is wholly owned by this producer. This perfumed wine is showing strong wood aromas as well as concentrated spice. Underneath, the generous juicy fruit has a fine balance between red plums and bright acidity. Drink from 2022.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines  (Pommard)

description: From one of the parcels that make up the larger Corton Grand Cru, this is a powerful wine with a proper sense of its dignity. It is stylish as well as rich—an elegant blending of ripe red fruits, tannins and acidity. The wine of course has great potential and will not be ready to drink until 2025.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Corton Vergennes

description: This is a powerful wine with concentration and dark tannins. It is rich, packed with black fruits and acidity. The wine has spice, a bold structure and a great future. The wine, from one of the vineyards within the Corton Grand Cru, is likely to be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Renardes  (Corton Les Renardes)

description: This firmly structured wine is packed with solid tannins as well as ripe juicy red fruits. It comes from the upper part of the Rugiens Premier Cru, one of the top sites in Pommard. Dense and needing to age, the wine will be ready from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Rugiens Hauts Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Rich and rounded with a creamy texture, this wine is ripe with apricots and has a strongly mineral character. Full of fruit, the wine also has a texture that means it needs to age. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Among the most northerly of the run of Beaune premier crus, the wine is structured but the structure is cushioned by the ripe red-berry fruits to give a generous wine. Backed by tannins, the wine will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Perrières Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A firmly structured wine, solid with tannins and with structure. The wine is also full of fruit potential, ripe with red berries. It is dense wine that needs to age. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Rich red fruits combine with good acidity, raspberry flavors and soft tannins. Ripe and juicy, it shows great fruitiness at the end.
title: Alex Gambal 2011 Cuvée des Deux Papis  (Bourgogne)

description: Ripe and jammy, it's full of red fruit jelly flavors. It has just enough tannic structure to support the fruit, giving balance with a dry core and fragrant acidity. It's rich, full in the mouth and needs time. Drink from 2017.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2011 Les Pimentiers  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a ripe and fruity wine, with soft tannins and rich raspberry fruits. Already accessible, it's very full in the mouth, wonderfully juicy and jammy, yet with some freshness at the end.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011  Monthélie

description: A fragrant wine, it offers truffle and red fruit aromas. The palate is ripe although it does have intense acidity, more bright red fruits than firmer structure. It feels almost ready to drink, fruity and fresh.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2011 Les Vaucrains Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Soft, jammy, forward wine, that exhibits sweet strawberries, a generous structure, and only light tannins. Drink now.
designation: Domaine Adélie Les Champs Martin Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine Adélie Les Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: From parcels of old vines, a smooth, wood- influenced wine. Flavors of ripe yellow fruits emerge from the vanilla toast character. It is rich, velvet textured, feeling opulent.
title: Roger Lassarat 2008 Cuvée Prestige  (Saint-Véran)

description: On the fresh side, with crisp bright, lively acidity. Green fruits run well alongside apricot juice and lively vivacity. Good and attractive.
title: Thibert Père et Fils 2008 Vignes Blanches  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Wood-fermented wine, giving a ripe and honeyed character over toast, pear juice and golden apple flavors. The final tastes is deliciously citrus, with a light mineral edge.
designation: Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras
title: Collovray et Terrier 2007 Domaine des Deux Roches Les Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Round, opulent wine, one that misses some freshness and acidity, a rarity for the year, but that compensates by a full, creamy texture.
title: Domaine de la Soufrandise 2008 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wood shows well here, ripe toast to go with the white fruits and richness. Good balance.
title: Domaine Sainte Barbe 2008 En Thurissey  (Viré-Clessé)

description: Ripe, full-bodied wine, the fresh white currant and pear fruits layered with wood. The wine is bright with good concentration. Screwcap.
title: Verget 2008 Clos Saint-Pierre  (Mâcon-Charnay)

description: With a good sense of structure, this bottling, formerly called Vieilles Vignes, comes from 55-year-old vines. It is textured, with some firm tannins as well as ripe plum flavors and acidity. The wine is still developing and will be better from 2016.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 Les Picotins  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Crisp and fresh, this is a tangy, lemon and orange zest flavored wine. Lively acidity bursts through the richer white fruits, green plums and quince spiciness. Both fresh and ripe, it's well balanced. Drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2013  Pouilly-Vinzelles

description: This is an attractive fruity wine, with a good touch of steely acidity as well as ripe yellow and white fruits. Sliced apples and fresh grapefruit give freshness. Crisp and clean, it is refreshingly ready to drink.
title: Louis Latour 2013 En Paradis  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: This is a superrich, smooth wine. The acidity is what keeps the ripe yellow-fruit flavors in order, and it has a lemon-like edge to the tropical mouthfeel. Age this for 3–4 years.
designation: Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Sous le Dos d'Ane Premier Cru  (Meursault-Blagny)

description: Les Fourneaux is one of the smallest premier crus. Rich and balanced, this wine is full of pear and apricot flavors. It combines a minerally edge with a generous structure and fruitiness. Delicious now, but keep it for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2011 Les Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Rich and full, this wine shows some sense of structure. It has considerable acidity and flavors of cherry and red currant. With the dry tannins coming through on the finish, it will need some years to soften.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Brouillards Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Rugiens,  which is named after its red soil, is located in the south of Pommard. Dense, structured and powerful, this is a brooding wine that has concentrated tannins and fruit that is offset by a tight line of acidity. This is a wine that demands aging.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Rugiens Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Domaine du Pavillon Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Fruity and rounded, this has attractive, citrus-like acidity that cuts through the caramel and apricot flavors. There is a delicious, forward orange-juice flavor that adds to the fresh feel of the wine. It's ready to drink, although it will also age.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Sentier du Clou Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This wine is concentrated and full in the mouth, and it bears a minerally texture and intense acidity. It's packed with flavors of sweet peach, lime, ripe Rocha pear and spice from the wood maturation. This promises to age for several years.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2010  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Only a small portion of this vineyard is planted with Chardonnay, and it has produced a minerally wine that's both crisp and ripe. The acidity is dominant at this stage, which lends the palate a juicy, peach- and citrus-like character. This wood-aged selection needs time.
designation: Clos de la Croix de Pierre
title: Louis Jadot 2010 Clos de la Croix de Pierre  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This is ripe and fruity with attractive red-fruit flavors and a touch of tannins to keep it all in place. The wine is soft with just a layer of tannin and plenty of red cherries at the end.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Marsannay
