title: Domaine Chenevières 2014 Bougros Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A warm, earthy, rustic style, richly fruity with peaches and sweet juiced fruits. There is good balance of wood, toast, nutmeg and sweet spice. The finale draws a fine line in elegance.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This is an austere wine for the ripe vintage. Tight with concentration, it will need time to fill out. Lemon fruit and a strong mineral texture come with fine acidity. The aftertaste promises a crisp, fruity future. Drink from 2019.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: Soft and creamy, this full, rich wine brings together delicious yellow and white fruits with citrus acidity and a tight, nervy texture. It has an attractive perfumed character balanced with a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Trenel Fils 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This ripe, still very young wine has a tangy, mineral texture that cuts into the white fruit flavors. Acidity, creamy texture and flavors of melon and apricots all give this wine the potential to be deliciously fruity. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2014  Mâcon-Villages

description: Deliciously rich and fruity, this is a wine that shows that Clos de Vougeot is a great vineyard. It has all the ripeness, the big, generous fruit, supported by wood. The berry flavors are intense, pierced through with acidity, and the denseness of the wine promises good aging.
title: Albert Bichot 2005 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: Big, juicy fruit, bolstered by tannins, gives this wine weight and impressive structure. There is a dry core surrounded by ripe plums, herbs and fresh spices , resulting in soft, juicy freshness. But those tannins promise aging potential.
title: Domaine Moillard 2005 Beaux-Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Initially earthy aromas give way to red fruits. The wine follows the same pattern, the barnyard flavors opening out with the ripe red plum and strawberry fruits. There is a delicious richness here, balanced with acidity and firm tannins.
title: Pierre Morey 2005 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This wine is generous, rounded and soft. Rich red fruits dominate, exploding in the mouth with red cherry and raspberry flavors. It is a soft wine, perfumed with delicious, forward fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Chambolle-Musigny

description: With a wine from every cru in Chablis, La Chablisienne is able to bring out the character of each. This cool Côte de Léchet is typical in its tight, mineral character, revealing its edgy nature. It's a wine with some aging potential, so give it 2–3 years and more.
title: La Chablisienne 2008 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Soft tannins and a rounded texture make this wine almost drinkable now. The smooth structure only slowly shows tannins and acidity. A fresh, raspberry fruit character will allow the wine to develop. Drink now, although better from 2017.
title: Henri de Villamont 2012 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is still tight and crisp. It has plenty of acidity as well as a strongly mineral texture. Taut and tense, the wine needs to develop to bring out the perfumed fruit of the vintage. Drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: Towards the southern end of Chassagne, Morgeot is a large premier cru that once belonged to an abbey. This wine is full of fruit, spiced with the wood aging and with a strongly mineral texture. It has the potential to be rich, round and smooth. Wait until 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This is a ripe and fruity wine. Soft, generous tannins are embedded in the developing red-fruit flavors. With spice, hints of the wood aging and a rich texture, the wine will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Echézeaux

description: This is a warm, creamy wine with layers of toast and yellow fruits. It has a ripe feel and a generous texture, with a mineral backbone keeps the wine in shape. Drink now.
title: Pascal Rollet 2014 Aux Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Bold brush strokes characterize this wine, the fruit a complex mélange of red berries, acidity and weight. The wine has good density, offering a strawberry jam character to go with the fresh edge. Tannins are enveloped in the fruits, promising medium-term aging.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: One of Bouchard's signature wines, this is beautifully textured, a series of bright fruits, strawberries and sweet acidity. There are tannins, but this is lighter than in some vintages, a wine for short-term aging.
designation: Beaune Grèves Premier Cru Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Beaune Grèves Premier Cru Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus  (Beaune)

description: Very pure lemon and toast flavors dominate this wine. It has crispness, intense freshness and lively acidity. There is also a sense of richness that is slowly developing and that will broaden the wine over the next several months.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Gouttes d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A ripe, open style of wine, giving white fruits, even some peach flavors, with toast and sweetness. There is weight, and a dense texture as well, the acidity lifting the finish.
designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2007 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Vaucopins Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A wine that starts with ripe citrus flavors, then moves easily into soft richness as the spicy wood and sweet peach flavors come through strongly. The wood is dominant, but not excessive. Full, ripe and still young.
title: Pierre Morey 2007  Meursault

description: Good ripe and rich wine that shows some of the opulence of Meursault. It has a good balance between toast and broad yellow and white fruit flavors. With acidity an extra component, the wine is attractively complete.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2007 Clos des Poruzots Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: An already complete wine, the tannins well integrated into the firm black fruits and acidity. It is foursquare but also has a richness that comes from wood as well as lively final freshness.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2007 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A solid structure and layers of dense fruit characterize this wine. Rich acidity, red cherry flavor and a dry, dark tannic core are surrounded by juicy red berry fruits and the freshest finish.
title: Camille Giroud 2008 Charmes Chambertin  (Charmes-Chambertin)

description: An enticing mix of toast and white fruit aromas follows through to rich apricot and ripe pear flavors, spiced with the creamy toast. The wood does need to calm down for the wine to be at its best.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2008 Les Chenevottes  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: An intense and concentrated wine, with dense black fruits balanced by acidity. There is ripeness here, with a firm, ageworthy structure as well as delicious juicy Pinot Noir character.
title: Louis Latour 2009 Château Corton Grancey  (Corton)

description: Taut and edgy, very steely in character, with almost an austere character in its youth. Its fruits are definitely on the citrus side of the spectrum, crisp yet rich as well. The acidity shoots right through the wine.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Blanchots  (Chablis)

description: A beautifully proportioned wine, from its rich yet mineral texture to its full grapefruit and gooseberry flavors. It gradually shows toast as well as wonderful acidity. For aging over 4–6 years.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is deliciously hedonistic in the best traditions of Volnay, opulent and powered with flavors of blackberry jelly, dry tannins and perfumed violets. This is a big, ripe, solid wine whose perfumes give an enticing exotic aftertaste.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2004 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A firm and tannic wine, this has dry spices, dark fruits and concentration. Great depth of flavor gives a serious wine that also has a fruit-driven profile. Concentrated dark tannins push this wine to a great height and impressive length. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Grands-Echezeaux

description: Packed with tannins and boasting an enormous structure, this wine is opulent while very firm. At the same time, smoky acidity shoots through all this density. From a great terroir, this wine shows minerality and its great structure well. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Chapelle-Chambertin

description: This wine is perfumed with gorgeous fruit that contrasts with the strict minerality. The tannins under the fruit are severe, solid, dark and promising enormous potential. Concentrated even while it celebrates great fruit, it is going to last for many years. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2013  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: This wine is very young, still with layers of wood. It is going to be a structured, dense and packed with a strong mineral texture. To contrast, generous red plum fruits and intense acidity are ready to convey a deep, rich character. Drink this impressive wine from 2019
title: Domaine Jean Grivot 2013  Echézeaux

description: This offers a firm, dense structure, with dark tannins and big, ripe, opulent fruits. At the same time the elegance that is the hallmark of the domaine is equally present with stylish red fruits and a velvet texture. The wine needs to age to be at its peak, although it is beautiful now. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jean Grivot 2013  Clos de Vougeot

description: Big and bold with great strawberry and red cherry flavors, this wine has all the elements of dense fruit, intense acidity and rich tannins. The structure is dark and full of potential. With acidity at the end to give a lift of freshness, this is a wine for the long-term. Drink from 2020.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012 Petit Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: The vineyards of the 13th century abbey of La Ferté produces some of the best Givry. This wine has great structure with firm tannins, and also rich, juicy fruitiness that offers delicious acidity and a more solid base for aging. Drink from 2016.
designation: Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Clos du Cellier aux Moines Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: Ripe and creamy in apple and pear fruitiness, this is cut by just the right amount of acidity. It's balanced, with fruit and and bright steeliness working well together. Drink from 2016.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The wine is tight and closed, hiding its natural fruitiness. For the moment, what is showing is acidity and a strongly mineral texture. This complex wine needs aging to fill out the structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2012 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Totally fresh, this is crisp and packed with citrus. A complex, tight texture brings out nervy acidity, a strongly mineral character and a firm structure. Age this youthful wine and drink from 2018.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2013 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With fruit drawn from all over Burgundy, this is a light, bright and refreshing wine. It has light acidity, spice and apple flavors and a bright, tight aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2013 Colette  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This is a light, fruity wine with lemon and apricot flavors and a citrus tang that gives a lift. It's attractive, fresh and with a ripe, warm aftertaste.
title: Vignerons de Mancey 2014  Mâcon

description: This ripe, pineapple- and peach-flavored wine has a soft texture, hints of vanilla and light acidity. It is rounded, full in the mouth and with a light textured aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Trenel Fils 2014 Homage to Heritage  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is ripe, packed with tropical fruit and rich acidity. A hint of vanilla has rounded the wine out, giving a full body to the delicious fruitiness. Opulent and generous, it is kept in order by final, aromatic acidity. Drink from 2016.
title: Terroirs et Talents 2013 Cuvée Claude Brosse  (Saint-Véran)

description: This wine is ripe, with good balance between acidity and the rich yellow fruits. It has a lightly tangy character, although it is more about delicious juiciness and a warm, generous character that is lightly sustained by toast. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The mineral texture that marks out a fine Meursault is very present here. Yellow fruits balance with this perfumed and intense wine. Still young and crisp, the acidity gives a tight, nervy edge. The wine obviously needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Meursault

description: Dense and structured via dark, dry tannins, this is a big wine, showing power but not great subtlety. If you want solid Burgundy, this is the wine.
title: Domaine de l'Arlot 2005 Les Petits Plets  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This light, fresh wine, with its concentration on raspberry flavors, has lifted acidity and an edge of bitterness. The tannins are there, but relatively subdued, so it's likely to age quickly.
title: Louis Latour 2005  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: A toasty, oaky wine, with smoky aromas and flavors that mask the white fruit flavors and acidity. Hopefully all this high toast will burn off. Hold for 2–3 years.
title: Faiveley 2005 Clos Rochette  (Mercurey)

description: Crisp, green and steely, this is classic Chablis, all about pure green fruits and minerality, only lightly layered with wood. It is vibrant and fresh, with the acidity adding a mouthwatering lightness.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2006 Mont-de-Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Light, fresh, soft and already very drinkable. The initial taste is dominated by citrus, and then it rounds out, adding toast, green fruits and a definite sophistication for a simple white Burgundy.
title: Pierre Morey 2005  Bourgogne

description: Soft with a yeasty character, this wine has not gotten its act together. It has some bitterness, walnut and spice flavors although nothing hangs together.
title: Domaine Ferret 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This wine is perfumed, soft and with a light character. An oddly floral character doesn't jell with the fruitiness that is behind it.
title: Domaine Carrette 2013 Les Crays  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is a wine with harshness, sharp walnut and bitter orange flavors. It gives off a hard feeling that probably won't soften much.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2013 Plants Carré  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Yeasty in character, this wine seems to have missed out both on fruit and texture.
title: Doudet Naudin 2013  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: This open and generous wine is attractive and ready to drink. White peach and pear flavors give it great fruitiness without losing sight of acidity. It's fruity, softly textured and just right now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2012  Mâcon-Lugny

description: A forward, fruity wine, full of apple and creamed pear flavors. The acidity is light, bright and attractive giving a wine that is fresh and ready to drink.
title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: Rounded wine, softly fruity. Its attractiveness comes from ripe white fruits, soft structure and a generous feel. It's not for aging and can be drunk now.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2011 Buissonnier  (Montagny)

description: A fruity wine, just touched by some wood aging with attractive strawberry fruit flavors and acidity. It's not a wine for aging, its light minerality enhancing the fruitiness.
title: Domaines Devillard 2011 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: While certainly ripe and fruity, this wine is also structured—its generosity tempered by intense acidity, crisp apple-skin notes and a mineral texture. The result is a full wine that needs a little time to soften. Drink from 2014.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: Fresh and fruity, this wine has a crisp, mineral character that gives an intense texture. It is balanced, ripe while still taut and crisp. The background to this is riper yellow fruits and a full, generous aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2013 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Caramel aromas lead to a wine that is rich and full bodied. It has weight and concentration, along with fresh acidity that cuts through at the end. A good sense of minerality gives this wine extra texture. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2013 Domaine de Fussiacus  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Sourced from parcels of vines planted in the 1950s, 1960s and 1970s, this a fine, concentrated wine. It has rich structure, great maturity and complexity. Lime acidity mingles with rich white-fruit flavors, balancingdelicacy with intensity. Drink from 2016.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Fourchaume Premier Cru Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: A blend of two parcels of vines in Meursault, this is an impressive wine that's equal in quality to a Premier Cru. Full and ripe, the palate boasts flavors of apples, peaches and green plums, but maintains an elegant character throughout. Age this fine wine and drink from 2016.
title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Cuvée Tête de Murger  (Meursault)

description: This is an impressively powerful, concentrated wine. It shows its wood aging now, but those notes should integrate soon into all the ripe apricot and greengage flavors. Richly textured, this is a wine that needs aging, so don't drink before 2016.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Morgeots Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: One of the most familiar of Puligny's Premier Crus has produced a ripe, yet very structured wine. It has intense minerality and a nervy, tight texture balanced with acidity, crisp apple and attractive wood spice. Everything is in harmony on this complex wine, promising a smooth aging . Drink from 2016.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Perrières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a ripe wine, packing tannins as well as black fruits into a rich package. Black cherries and black plums are paired with a core of dry tannins. The acidity comes right through to give the wine its potential. The wine comes from a very stony vineyard and this shows in its tight mineral aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
designation: Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The wine is rich and full in the mouth with ripe fruit from the deep clay soil of this premier cru. It is beautifully concentrated and ripe. The fruit is so crisp and juicy that this yellow and white-fruit flavored wine could be drunk now. That would be a shame, because it will be even better from 2018.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Butteaux Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A tight, crisp wine from vineyards that face across the river to the town of Chablis. The wine has delicious yellow fruits, intense acidity and an opulent character. The vines of the vineyard face east giving warmth while keeping a strong mineral texture. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2015 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: It is rare to find mature red Burgundy being sold directly from the producer's cellar. This 2008 from an above-average vintage is certainly showing signs of rich maturity. It has developed the undergrowth aromas and spice flavors of ready-to-drink Pinot Noir. It has also retained plenty of acidity. It is a lightly tannic wine that is ready to drink.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2008 Les Moutottes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: There is plenty of the power and structure of a Vosne-Romanée in this single parcel wine. It has density and concentration over a rich full black-fruit character. There are still signs of the wood aging and some high toast flavors that need to integrate, so wait until 2020.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Les Quartiers de Nuits  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: The parcel called La Mission in the heart of the Mercurey vineyards is wholly owned by the Devillard family, so they call it a monopoly. It is a wine that effortlessly balances tangerine and lemon flavors with ripe spiced peaches and a tight mineral texture. The wine is still young, still developing, so wait until 2018.
designation: Château de Chamirey La Mission Monopole
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey La Mission Monopole  (Mercurey)

description: Spice, especially nutmeg, is a distinctive character in this soft, ripe wine. It lacks some definition, but is attractively round. Fruit flavors tend toward white pears, edged with toast, while the texture is fat, full.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Mouches Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Mouches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Citrus and orange zest flavors and bright acids characterize this wine. It's a refreshing selection, and it has a tight texture and pear juice flavor. Age it for 1–2 years.
title: Domaine Champy 2010 Les Combottes  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: A single-vineyard wine, this is firmly structured and full of perfumed fruit. New wood aging gives the red berry fruit a smoky, toasty character. It's a rich, concentrated selection to age for five years or more.
title: Domaine des Varoilles 2010 Clos du Meix des Ouches  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Santenay, which is located toward the south of the Côte de Beaune, is known for its wines that are accessible and early maturing. This ripe selection bursts with flavors of yellow fruit and citrus, touched by wood influence. Drink it over the next year, or age it for 3–4.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Rich and smooth, this wood-aged wine shows great weight and concentration. A touch of minerality provides a counterbalance to the ripe lemon and apricot flavors. It needs a couple of years to fully reveal its structured side.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2011 Quintessence  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Soft and ripe, this wine has juicy pineapple and pear flavors. And with its tension between richness and steeliness, this could certainly age.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: Located on a high slope in Marsannay, the Vaudenelles Vineyard creates structured wines. This selection has a beautiful perfumed character, and it offers delicious red-berry flavors and lively acids that are striated by minerality.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Vaudenelles  (Marsannay)

description: With its upfront, ripe apple and pear flavors, this wine is immediately attractive. Behind the fruitiness, there is a firm, structured character of minerality and a steely edge, which makes this a Chardonnay to age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2011 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a smooth and polished wine, with herb and new wood aromas. It has juicy red-berry flavors, and the tannins push forward. Structured, with intense acidity, this is ready to age for at least 5–6 years.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2010 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: An old-vine wine, this is powerful, concentrated and impressively dense for a Marsannay. It is full of red plum and berry flavors, plus firm tannins that suggest this could age for several years.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2010 L'Ancestrale  (Marsannay)

description: The most taut and steely of the wines made by Guillaume Vrignaud from Fourchaume fruit, this offers a tight, minerally texture, lively acidity and an apple- and grapefruit-like crispness. With its structure, this has the potential to age for 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2011 Les Champréaux Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Tannins and a red berry flavor combine in this soft wine. It has the structure of the vintage, with a firm core; the fruit and acidity developing slowly. Keep for 2–3 years.
title: Louis Max 2010 Clos la Marche  (Mercurey)

description: A selection of wines from 30 different parcels, this rich, smooth, open wine wears its toast well, the caramel and vanilla flavors melding easily with apricots, melon and finishing with acidity. The aftertaste continues this marriage of flavors.
title: Château de Fuissé 2006 Tête de Cru  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Crisp and fresh, with a steely character, the fruit is fresh and forward, with citrus and spice flavors. The weight is here, giving density to this vibrant, delicious wine.
title: Remoissenet Père et Fils 2006 Morgeot Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: While there are plenty of toast, butter and ginger spice flavors here, this wine also shows the tight, more mineral side of Chassagne-Montrachet. It comes from the acidity and the dry edge of red apple skins. This powerful wine needs 2–3 years for the wood to calm down.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2006 Les Macherelles Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: A mineral, tight wine with underlying wood and quince flavors. It certainly has richness, but at this stage the lightness and structure are more prominent. To finish, there is acidity and spice.
designation: Clos de l'Arlot Blanc Premier Cru
title: Domaine de l'Arlot 2006 Clos de l'Arlot Blanc Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Warm, rich, with a southern Chardonnay ripeness, this shows high toast, but also ripe tropical fruit. The acidity is light, with a creamy texture, and added spice and richness. It's a harmonious style that needs 3–4 years.
title: Château de Fuissé 2006 Le Clos  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Fat and full-bodied as befits a Meursault, but tempered with green acidity, the rich fruit of this wine is laced with wood, the fullness a shield for the crisp white fruits and steeliness.
title: Louis Latour 2006 Goutte d'Or Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: One of Bouchard's signature wines, this is a selection of fruit from different Beaune vineyards in the company's domaine. It is big, ripe and soft, balancing these elements with rounded cantaloupe fruit and spice. The toast is a major factor at present, and the wine would benefit from 2 years aging.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Beaune du Château Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Old vines lend a fine structure and density to this wine. It's not for longterm aging, with its ripe red plum fruit and generous texture, but is delicious now. Drink from early 2018.
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: Reflecting the warm 2015 vintage, this is smooth and creamy. It has great fruitiness, recalling yellow fruit cut with a strong citrus streak. It's a wine to drink young, from late 2017.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2015 Croix-Jarrier  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: This is yeasty, bearing crisp flavors of pear and green apple, with a taut lemon-zest texture and a firm edge of minerality. It needs at least three years in bottle.
title: Bailly-Lapierre 2009 Egarade Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is deliciously fragrant, with harmonious fruit and acidity. It has a full, rich character that offers currant and citrus flavors.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: A fragrant apple-skin aroma sets the scene for this wine that is warm and ripe. A touch of nutmeg adds an extra dimension to its yellow fruits. It's rich while still remaining true to its minerally, terroir-based origins. Age for two years.
title: Bernard Defaix 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: This shows Savigny's softness and approachability, along with tannins and acids. It is firmly concentrated, creating a wine that feels complete, juicy and rich.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009 Dominode Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a firm wine with great fruit density, with a round, generous and velvety texture. It has a touch of wood that needs to integrate with the flavor of red plum skin. The dark tannins create a wine that will age for several years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Volnay

description: This is a tightly textured wine that has plenty of green stone fruit as well as a bitter almond edge. It is taut, and the fruit has not completely surfaced yet. Age for three years.
title: Château de Maligny 2010 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With its ripe strawberry-jam flavor, this demonstrates classic Pinot Noir juiciness. It has dry tannins as well, yielding a ripe, concentrated wine that needs five years of aging.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2009 Les Brunettes et Planchots  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: With the typical intense acidity of 2010, this is a taut, fruit- and mineral-driven Chablis. Its fruitiness is balanced by judicious toast and vanilla flavors. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Damien et Romain Bouchard 2010 Vaillon Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Clos des Myglands is a vineyard wholly owned by Faiveley. In 2010, it has produced a richly structured wine, full of ripe plum and sweet acidity that dominates the firm tannins. The finish is juicy, balanced by a jammy character.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010 Clos des Myglands Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Made from grapes sourced from Domaines Devillard's 12 acres of premier cru Mercurey vineyards, this rich, weighty wine has ripe red fruits that are layered with new wood and tannins. A structured effort that's meant to age for five years and more.
designation: Château de Chamirey Les Cinq Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Château de Chamirey Les Cinq Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This is rich, full-bodied Chardonnay, rounded out with peaches and spiced apricots. The wood is evident here, giving an extra softness as well as bringing out rich honey. A wine that opens beautifully in the mouth, ready to drink but also ageworthy.
title: La Chablisienne 2006 Montée de Tonnerre Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A wine that brings out all the minerality of Puligny. That makes it taut and structured but at the same time the fruit element plays a vital part. With citrus and apple skin, layered with fresh green plums, this is both complex and deliciously fruity. The vanilla flavors from wood aging round out the wine.
title: Maison Champy 2006 Les Chalumeaux Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: An initially wood-laden wine that only slowly reveals the rich fruit character. There is wood certainly, but the spice integrates well with the green fruits and the intense minerality. The great steely backbone on this wine indicates it will age.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2006 Valmur Grand Cru  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: A great cocktail of fruit flavors propel this wine out of the glass. It is ripe and crisp at the same time, the fruits running from peach to grapefruit and back again. There is plenty of acidity, crisp green apple structure, but at the end it is all about richness, a mouthful of delicious Chardonnay.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2006 Les Folatières Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is one of the most popular Chablis premier crus, and this soft wine shows why. It hints at minerality, but the main flavors are a great burst of apple and citrus. It has just the right vivid green character, the vanilla from the wood a very subtle afterthought.
title: William Fèvre 2006 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This wine is solid, concentrated and tannic, and it has a dark chocolate flavor from having aged in wood. It's likely to develop into a chunky wine over the next few years.
title: Jaffelin 2009  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: This is a lightweight Chambolle that's dominated by red fruit and acidity. There is a bitter edge that comes from the wood and the firm structure of the vintage. However, with its attractive, juicy finish, it is already soft enough to drink.
title: Jaffelin 2010  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Round and soft, this warm wine from the southern end of the Côte de Beaune feels rich and generous. It has caramel and yellow fruit flavors, and its crisp acidity will ensure that it will remain fresh and fruity.
title: Jaffelin 2010 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: A firmly structured wine, this has a dry character that's underscored by red fruit and balancing acidity. It needs to age for a few years to be at its best.
title: Moillard 2010 Clos du Meix Trouhans  (Fixin)

description: Ripe and round, this has a strawberry flavor that is surrounded by dense tannins. It shows a fine line of fresh acidity, and it is ready to drink, although it will age for several years.
title: Domaine Champy 2010  Volnay

description: This is a fruity wine, with upfront peach and apricot flavors. It has bright acidity and just a hint of wood. Produced for the first time by Ferret, this selection is rich, open and generous, although the acidity is never left behind.
title: Domaine Ferret 2010 Sous Vergisson  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A blend from Puligny-Montrachet and Meursault, this is a soft rounded wine with white fruit acidity, almond flavors and a gentle lemon zest texture. Drink in the next two years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2009 Les Sétilles  (Bourgogne)

description: The crispest Aligoté, all grapefruit and bright green fruits. The wine is fresh, clean and lively. There is a final light element of wood.
title: Pierre Morey 2007 Bourgogne Aligoté  (Bourgogne)

description: Softly rich, a rounded wine that brings out ripe plums and sweet strawberry jam. The acidity only kicks in towards the end, as the tannins and final rich character offer contrast.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2006 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: A soft, firm wine with a nice touch of citrus. The character is fresh, light, with a fine burst of final acidity to mark an easy, bright wine.
title: Pierre Morey 2007 Bourgogne Chardonnay  (Bourgogne)

description: A very soft, ripe and open wine that lacks structure. The best aspects are the finely judged wood element and the light acidity that floats at the end.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2007  Meursault

description: This is a juicy, fruity wine with intense acidity. It has spice, berry fruit and some smoky tannins. The aftertaste is tangy, hinting at orange as well as red-currant fruits.
title: Domaine Collotte 2014 Combereau  (Marsannay)

description: This wine is structured and tight with minerality and zesty lemon flavors. It has a definite texture and a nervy character that needs to round out.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2014 Le Clos  (Marsannay)

description: This is an attractive fruity wine with citrus fruits and a tangy, zesty texture. The lightest hint of wood gives the wine extra richness. It is already drinkable.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Montagny

description: Fine and fresh, brightened by grapefruit, lemon zest and bright acidity, this is a delicious wine, ready for seafood, finishing so clean and crisp.
title: Gilles Morat 2008 La Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A concentrated and ripe wine, dominated by spicy wood and pineapple with creamed peach flavors. The texture is full, dense, very rich.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2008 Terra Incognita  (Saint-Véran)

description: Full in the mouth, well–structured, ripe wine, showing great bright white fruits, a vibrant acidity, layered with wood. Delicious.
title: Jean-Claude du Roure 2008  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Rich, smooth, ripe flavors of wood with some pear and peach juice. Soft, but with good depth of flavor.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2008 Epinet  (Viré-Clessé)

description: A smoothly textured wine, full and ripe, with great pear flavors, giving rich acidity as well as a texture that shows apricot skins and green plums.
title: Manuel Seguin 2008  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Rich wine, full in the mouth, bringing wood and ripe apple flavors well together. Delicious.
title: Manuel Seguin 2008  Viré-Clessé

description: Very textured wine, with apple skin tautness, followed by acidity, a touch of wood, and final spice. Attractive wine that could age for 1–2 years.
title: Marcel Couturier 2008 Aux Scelles  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A broad, spicy wine, ripe with plenty of sweet mango and peach fruits to go with the green fruit acidity. It is already delicious but will develop further over the next 2–3 years.
title: Château de Chamirey 2008 La Mission Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Light, creamy and fruity, this fresh, lightly mineral wine has plenty of fresh apple and citrus flavors. There is no suggestion of wood, and the wine is all about fresh fruit. Drink now.
title: Jacques Bourguigon 2013  Chablis

description: On the mineral side of Meursault, the has a very textured feel, with acidity to go with the honey note. Finely balanced, warm and ripe, this has a crisp, tight finish.
title: Henri de Villamont 2009 Les Clous  (Meursault)

description: Already a delicious wine, this has ripe yellow fruits, with notes of wood and spice adding complexity. The minerally acidity brings out the flavors of this ripe, structured effort.
title: Domaine Jean Monnier et Fils 2010  Puligny-Montrachet

description: Light colored and fruity, this is all about red fruit—its structure and firm tannins coming out slowly. This village wine demonstrates the richness of the appellation, showing a fine balance between its ripe fruit and its smoky, dry, tannic core.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2010  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Firm red currant and raspberry fruits dominate this smooth wine. The tannins, which lie underneath, give this round Pinot Noir essential firmness. This needs to age for 2–3 years.
title: Vincent Sauvestre 2010 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Tannins and severe fruit flavors are the initial impressions of this wine. Behind the mineral, austere exterior, there is a richer, fatter core—its ripe red fruits waiting to surface. Keep for at least three years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Pommard

description: Smooth and rounded, this exhibits the opulent side of Chablis while retaining an elegant structure. It has flavors of yellow and white fruits that combine with a nutty character, a mineral texture and a refreshing, crisp finish. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2010 Beauroy Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Attractive ripe fruits go with lime and toast flavors. The wine is soft and green, with flavors of apricot and intense final acidity. A delicious, ready-to-drink wine.
title: Maurice Ecard 2009  Bourgogne

description: This is big, muscular and very opulent, with its density lying over its minerality. Flavors of black stone fruits and red berries have the intensity of a powerful, age-worthy wine.
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2010  Charmes-Chambertin

description: Rich, yet always elegant, this has a raspberry flavor and terrific acidity that creates tension, contrasting with the opulent fruit. While it's structured, it will soften and round out over the next five years.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010  Mazis-Chambertin

description: Powerful and concentrated, this has an intense expression of ripe tropical fruits. The wood shows strongly at this stage, although with this amount of richness, it has the weight and the power to develop well over many years.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010  Corton-Charlemagne

description: This is taut and mineral, with hidden power. It's very closed at this stage. It's a wine with acidity and notes of green fruits and crisp apples, with just a touch of wood. This will age for many years.
title: Domaine Jean-Paul et Benoît Droin 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: This is a deeply rich, very impressive wine from a great white-wine vintage. It's concentrated with the essence of pure Chardonnay. It has tension along with a full texture. Age it for at least 10 years.
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010  Chevalier-Montrachet

description: Big and showy, with an ripe, opulent feel, this is all about dark fruits and firm tannins. Flavors of black cherries and plums are balanced by the acidity, all rolled together into a structure that's powerful and seriously age-worthy.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: This is a ripe Pinot Noir, with a firm and solid structure and a very dense character. It has concentration and a great depth of flavor; the blacks fruits and tannins cut into the heart of the wine. Age for at least seven years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2009  Clos de Vougeot

description: Structured and minerally, this has citrus fruits that sit prominently over the tight acidity. A vanilla note is there to round the wine out. The crisp fruits and steely acids are intense and impressively balanced. Age for at least 5 years. Screwcap.
title: Domaine Laroche 2010 Les Blanchots Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Christophe Perrot-Minot makes this wine from a parcel of the vineyard that is declassified grand cru. It's opulent and generous, yet it's also minerally and fresh. The sumptuous Chambolle feel is still to come as the wine rounds out and loses its youthful tannins. Age for at least seven years.
designation: La Combe d'Orveau Cuvée Ultra Premier Cru
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2010 La Combe d'Orveau Cuvée Ultra Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Made from grapes sourced from vines planted in 1902, this is a huge, powerful, minerally wine. It's currently tight as a drum, with solid tannins and great density that pair with ripe plum and wood flavors. The acidity that appears on the finish promises long-term aging.
designation: La Richemonne Cuvée Ultra Premier Cru
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2010 La Richemonne Cuvée Ultra Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Big, rich and powerful, this uses grapes sourced from a small section of the Corton hill that's close to Charlemagne. It has the ripe pineapple and apricot flavors to go with the acidity. With its enormous concentration, this is ready to age over at least 10 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2010  Corton Vergennes

description: Richly structured, this wine is all texture at this stage—although the rich fruit lingers underneath. Apple, pear and citrus fruits give this opulent, powerful wine its freshness. This has a great future ahead.
title: Louis Latour 2010  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Using grapes sourced from the greatest white-wine vineyard in Burgundy, this is huge, dense, very rich and complex. The balance already shows in the wine's acidity, ripe yellow fruit and round texture. Wood aging brings notes of spice and toast. This will age for many years.
title: Louis Latour 2010  Montrachet

description: The epitome of Grand Cru Chablis, this is mineral and fruit driven—impressive both from its richness and its tense structure. The power comes from the depth of flavor that brings the texture right through the wine. Age for 5–7 years.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Powerful while still fruity, this shows acidity and notes of ripe black cherry and spice. Very structured and solid, this complete, tannin-packed wine is definitely for long-term aging.
title: Domaine Drouhin-Laroze 2010  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: Pascal Bouchard's entry-level Chablis is a wine that is tank fermented, preserving its great fruitiness. The wine is certainly full of lemon, pear and orange-zest flavors. With its forward fruitiness it can be drunk now, but should hold well through 2019.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2012 Le Classique  (Chablis)

description: This is made in a fruity style, with attractive red-fruit flavors. It is dry and laced with acidity. It has richness, a full body and refreshing final acidity.
title: Jaffelin NV Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a ripe, fruity, creamy Chardonnay-based sparkler. It has a tropical fruit flavor, with some sweetness from both the fruit and the high dosage. It's in a full-bodied, attractive apéritif style.
title: Domaine Luquet NV Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Simple, attractive, light Chardonnay. Green fruits and pear juice layer with acidity and a soft texture. With its lively, crisp finish, the wine is ready to drink.
designation: Château de la Tour de l'Ange
title: Maison Jean-Baptiste Béjot 2008 Château de la Tour de l'Ange  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: Chitry lies just outside the Chablis appellation area, giving a wine that has some of the classic steely character but is more rounded and less focused. Pleasing Chardonnay, finishes with an attractive vanilla touch.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2008 Bourgogne Chitry  (Bourgogne)

description: Crisp acidity and citrus fruitiness combine with a riper, textured character. The wine shows the strong minerality inherent in whites from Pernand-Vergelesses, as well as a richer streak. Because of its structure, it should age. Drink from 2016.
designation: Creux de la Net Premier Cru
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012 Creux de la Net Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Fruity and ripe, it also presents a fresh feel that cuts through the jammy red fruits and gives an edge to the weight and velvet texture. It's almost ready to drink but will be better from 2015.
title: Louis Latour 2011 Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This was the first vineyard bought by the Bouchard family, purchased in 1791. More than 220 years later, this 2011 has a delicate touch of wood nestled in the heart of creamy fruit flavors. Crisp lemon and tight acidity give a bright, fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2016.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2011 Clos Saint-Landry Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From granite soil, this rounded wine has a firm core of structure. Pineapple and peach fruit flavors surround this center, making it full in the mouth, rich and charming. Acidity at the end and the firm texture promise some aging. Drink from 2015.
title: Château des Rontets 2011 Pierrefolle  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The chalky soil conveys a cool feeling to this wine. Tight and mineral, it has yellow fruits that show good acidity. Toasty wood gives a juicy aftertaste. It's already delicious, but the wine's cool character will develop further, so drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Chanson 2011 Les Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: The big tannins indicate a wine with powerful potential. It has weight, richness, generous red fruits and a strong sense of structure. The freshness of the vintage comes through in the acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011  Fixin

description: This well-proportioned wine has ripe fruits along with generous texture and acidity. A touch of wood gives extra weight. It's ready to drink, but will be even better by the end of 2014.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2012 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: While this wine does not age in wood, it does age on its lees, giving it a rich, creamy texture. It's smooth, full and soft, its apricot and peach flavors showing ripeness and openness. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2015 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: While ripe, this also has a firm structure, with a mix of rich yellow-fruit flavors and austere minerality. With the acidity just beginning to soften, it will turn into a full and more rounded wine.
title: Domaine de la Garenne 2009  Mâcon-Azé

description: Fresh, soft and fruity, this is brightened by a jammy red-fruit flavor and light acidity. It has a juicy character, with underlying attractive, gentle tannins.
title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: Very pure, this has a clean strawberry flavor, with exhilarating acidity. The wine has some structure and firm tannins, although its fruitiness is the dominant factor.
title: Domaines Devillard 2010 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne)

description: A solid, dense wine, its rich tannins dominating dark black fruits. The wine is ponderous, brooding, with shafts of acidity giving it a lift. But it does need a couple of years to soften that core of serious tannins.
designation: Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Murots
title: Albert Bichot 2006 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Murots  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A rounded, mouthfilling wine. At the beginning, it seems very soft, but then it is possible to discern rich tannins through the concentrated red fruits and black plums. The acidity is there all the time, a fine counterpoint to the seductive, rich fruits and dry tannins.
title: Domaine Jayer-Gilles 2006  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: An intriguing wine, that offers ripe sweetness followed by an edgy rustic acidity. Is this a stage in its evolution? Probably, because the tannins promise aging and the intensely aromatic nature of the fruit points to a potentially fine wine. Just don't drink it yet.
designation: Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Clos de la Mousse Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: With a touch of spice from the wood, this wine is full of yellow and apple fruits yet with a cool thread of acidity. It is a lively, bright wine, filled out with fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2014 En Caradeux Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Opulent and ripe, this wine has fine tannins that support the rich red fruit and smoky acidity. The weight and concentration of the wine make it so attractive and indicate it will develop well. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Max 2014 Aux Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Although the domaine is mainly centered on Chassagne-Montrachet, neighboring Saint-Aubin is hardly far. This ripe, yellow and citrus-fruit-flavored wine is already delicious. Touches of toast from wood aging along with balanced acidity give it both crispness and richness. Drink now.
title: Philippe Colin 2014 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: There is a lightly toasty aroma here. On the palate, this wine is ripe, rich and full in the mouth.It has a smooth, creamy texture that is round while keeping plenty of room for acidity. This attractive wine should be drunk now.
title: Collin-Bourisset 2013 Les Burdines  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This fresh wine also offers plenty of ripe fruit and exotic flavors. Crisp, juicy and rich, it's just lightly touched by honey and is a refreshing wine to drink now.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2013  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Full of the fresh acidity of the 2014 vintage, this light, bright wine has refreshing lemon and crisp apple flavors that are given richness by the lively acidity. Bursting with fruit, it is ready to drink now.
title: Domaine des Gandines 2014 Terroir de Clessé  (Viré-Clessé)

description: The delicious, fresh character of the 2014 vintage shows to great advantage in this fruity wine. Apples and peaches dominate the fruit character, while a more mineral edge shows strongly, giving the wine structure and the chance to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2014  Saint-Véran

description: A soft, ripe and smooth wine, this conveys sweet caramel as well as brighter green fruits and citrus. A smoky character gives complexity and a ripe aftertaste to go with the juicy acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Rijckaert 2013 Verchères  (Viré-Clessé)

description: The fruit in this soft wine is ripe and creamy. Green and white fruits give a balanced blend of fresh acidity and smooth texture. It is rich, generous and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Bourgogne

description: Full, fat, ripe, perfumed wine that is full of rich red fruits, plums and strawberries. It also has a stylish structured with refined tannins as well as a dense texture. It's a wine for aging over at least 5–7 years.
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Mercey Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Château de Rully is managed by Rodet. It has produced a firm, dark and smoky wine in 2010. It's firm, solid, with an earthy, undergrowth edge. At the same time, its weight and density promise some good aging over at least five years.
designation: Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay
title: Antonin Rodet 2010 Château de Rully Cuvée R. de Ternay  (Rully)

description: This soft, light wine has hints of citrus and acidity. It is fruity, crisp and bright with orange zest at the end. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2016 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This soft wine is open, rounded with a balance between fruit and crisp acidity. Simple and gentle, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2016 Tradition  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This soft, gentle wine has some attractive citrus and apple fruits. Easy to drink, it offers a crisp tangy aftertaste. It is not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Collection  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This wine is soft and very rich. That takes away from the fruit and leaves a broad wine, smooth and with a touch of pepper from alcohol. It is too big.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Garenne  (Macon-Bussières)

description: Still quite youthful, this wine is closed and tight, but full of potential. Flavors of citrus fruits, mango and pear are layered elegantly with wood. It's a ripe, while crisp wine that's tightly structured and powerful. Drink from 2016.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2011 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Full bodied and opulent in classic Meursault style, this ripe, yellow-fruited wine is full of ripe fruits layered in wood notes. There's a sense of power and generosity throughout. It's a wine that will develop over the medium term, so drink from 2015.
title: Patrick Javillier 2011 Clos du Cromin  (Meursault)

description: This is a youthful, fruity wine with crisp yellow-fruit and citrus flavors, with a toastiness from wood aging. Sourced from Saint-Aubin, it has a cool, fresh feel that complements its pristine fruitiness. It's for drinking soon, but will also improve with age through 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 En Remilly Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This perfumed, smoky wine is gently wood aged and offers layers of tannin and black cherry fruits. It is still young and dense, dark and dry, with piercing acidity. It is concentrated, firm and needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012  Clos de Vougeot

description: This impressively structured and rich wine is full of yellow fruits, apricot skins and yellow plum skins. It's rounded and full in the mouth with juicy while textured fruits. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2017.
title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2012 Vau de Vey Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With its tight acidity and crisp texture, this young wine needs a little time to develop. Citrus and spice are coming together with the richer pear and apricot fruits. A refreshing wine, it will be good to drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Paul Paquet 2014 Domaine des Granges  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: The fruit and juicy acidity are the focus here, supported by smoky tannins. The wine will develop relatively quickly, full of fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Maison Champy 2014 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a spicy wine, with balanced wood, yellow-fruit flavors and acidity that cuts through the spice and ripeness. A zing of citrus finishes this attractive wine in style.
title: Marcel Couturier 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: Ripe with tropical-fruit flavors, this wine has good acidity layered with spice and toastiness. A crisper structure behind this generous fruit will allow the wine to age, although it is drinkable now.
title: Loron et Fils 2014 Château de Mirande  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This perfumed wine features ripe tannins and strawberry flavors. It is structured, with good concentration and acidity. The wine is developing well with the richness as well as line of fresher acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: An intensely perfumed wine that smells of a candy shop. It has tight acidity, but that is lost in the welter of white fruit flavors, allied with sweet wood. It seems at first too sweet, but then toast and acidity come in to give the wine an edgy finale.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a fruity, juicy and soft wine. It has plenty of red-currants that give the wine a crisper side. It comes from a vineyard just north of the Burgundian capital of Dijon, which produces the wine's cool fruity character. Drink from 2017.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers  (Bourgogne)

description: This is a ripe and soft wine with pure apple and citrus fruit. It is crisp, juicy and bright with acidity and tangy orange zest flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2014 Les Sétilles  (Bourgogne)

description: The aroma says wood, and that's what the taste confirms. To go with the wood, there is rounded apricot and peach-flavored fruit, open and rich. The wine has a youthful taut edge, finishing with the greatest acidity.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2007  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Weight and richness here, with attractive acidity, but also a ripe, creamy texture. The wine has some tight tannins, but is much more to do with opulent peaches and cream.
title: Henri de Villamont 2007 Les Caillerets Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A soft, rounded wine, with spice and toast and a cushion of plump yellow fruit. Almonds and mandarin oranges fit well together with the fine acidity.
title: Labouré-Roi 2006 Les Chevaliers  (Meursault)

description: With its softness and medium-dry character, this is a great food wine for pâtés or blue cheese. It is finely in balance, its acidity giving a lift to the tangerine, peach and dried fruit flavors. The aftertaste is perfectly clean, creamy, lifted by acidity.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Exception Exquise Demi-Sec  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is deliciously crisp and steely, with an apple flavor and the weight of citrus and grapefruit. It has a minerally, chalky feel, and then the wine rounds out, with crisp fruit on the finish.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2010 Drouhin-Vaudun Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: The small Côte de Léchet Premier Cru offers a steely vision of Chablis—crisp and driven by apple and grapefruit flavors. It is bright and taut; like any wine from this vineyard, it needs to age for at least three years.
title: La Chablisienne 2010 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Finely structured and aromatic, this is initially dense before opening up with ripe yellow fruit, becoming balanced by orange- and tangerine-like acidity. It has a young, zesty texture that pairs with the rich concentration, promising to age over 3–4 years.
title: La Chablisienne 2010 Monte de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Ripe and fruity, this is a round, soft wine that shows the jammy character of Pinot Noir. It has a straight line of acidity that cuts through the fruit, which makes for an attractive, light finish.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2010 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: While this shows the concentration of the vines that were planted in the 1940s, it also has a tight, lean quality and considerable acidity. Its fruit is still subdued by the structure, and it needs 3–4 years to become round.
title: Domaine Champy 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaune)

description: Light and fruity, this has flavors of creamed apple and ripe Williams pear. The wine is crisp and tangy, and it's shot through with lemon zest and acidity. Ready to drink in one year.
title: Domaine Charly Nicolle 2011 Cuvée Ancestrum  (Chablis)

description: Light, creamed apple fruits with a bright line of fresh acidity. The wine is exuberant in its citrus character, just broadened by an underlay of green apples.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2008 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne)

description: Simple Chablis, but one that is full of ripe and creamy fruit. In the background, a more tangy, zesty and mineral texture brings out the northern cool vineyards. Otherwise it is about yellow fruits and sliced red apple. Drink now.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 La Pierrelée  (Chablis)

description: This soft wine shows some of the Aligoté crispness that has become creamy and smooth. There are touches of yellow fruits as well as lively acidity and a gentle aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Manuel Olivier 2012  Bourgogne Aligoté

description: The wine has density and a good structure. It also has the acidity that marks the vintage. Red-cherry fruits and a crisp texture are balanced by the firmer tannins and solid character at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: This wine is ripe, generous with the opulence of the vintage. It has tropical fruits, rich acidity and a light touch of spice. Rounded and smooth, it has aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is structured and concentrated with solid tannins. It has great ripe red fruits and plenty of berry flavors. It is going to be a fine wine, full of both fruit and structure as it develops. Drink from 2022.
title: Jaffelin 2015 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The juiciness of this wine, made by a producer based in Savigny, is what makes it so good. It is so fruity, with the tannins really only in a supporting role. That means it will develop quickly with the typical Savigny generosity. There is an attractive sprinkling of spice at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2015 Les Goudelettes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This east-facing vineyard is in the village of Fuissé. With the wood-aging giving spice and toast flavors, it is a ripe wine. The wood marches well with the apple and green-plum fruits. Still young, this rich wine has a mineral texture that comes from chalky soil. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015 Aux Insarts  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This rich wine is dense and concentrated, with beautiful apple and spice flavors lifted by acidity. The fruit and the minerality typical of the appellation give this wine both its fine texture and its tangy fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2016 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: With ripe fruits and solid tannins, this is going to be a rich wine. It has plenty of acidity to balance this richness. At the same time, the tannins are going to allow it to age well. Drink from 2023.
designation: Carelle sous la Chapelle Premier Cru
title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2015 Carelle sous la Chapelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: The wine comes from a single vineyard in the large 90-acre Château de Chamirey estate. It is beautifully balanced, rich and generous. Great red-plum fruits are there along with acidity and finely textured tannins. This is going to be a warm wine with a fine future. Drink from 2022.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Round and full-bodied, the wine is dominated by wood-aging flavors. That masks the fruit at this stage, leaving the impression of a wine that is still to focus and bring out the impressive ripe fruits and mineral structure. Give it until 2017 to pull itself together.
title: Château de Fuissé 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This finely made wine has weight and firm tannins, along with intense acidity. Faiveley owns 12 acres of this premier cru which produces structured wines with fruit tannins and smoky fruit. At the end, the wood aging gives a burnt edge that needs to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2011 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Made from 80-year-old vines from several parcels, this is a concentrated and dense wine. Red berry fruits give freshness, but it is the structure that counts. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2011 Racines du Temps  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Ripe and bold, it balances acidity and texture. Very mineral in character, it is textured and tight at this young stage. Green fruits, citrus and red apples show the fruity side. Age until 2016.
title: Dominique Cornin 2012 Les Chevrières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rich and crisply fruity. It has the bright, tight texture of the vintage, giving a tense character while retaining the lush, poised fruit of the vintage. It's delicious now and ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2014 Les Plantés  (Saint-Véran)

description: Produced from old, low-yielding vines, this delicious wine balances crisp acidity with intense white fruit. It's poised and stylish, with a cool character expressed in its acidity and lemon zest-like aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2014 Les Sentinelles  (Saint-Véran)

description: A blend from different Premier Cru vineyards across Chablis, this wine is the product of the wide choice of grapes available to this cooperative. It's soft and ripe yet shows the crisper edge typical of the vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Grande Cuvée Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Straightforward and fruity, this is fresh and light in character. It has plenty of acidity along with red cherry fruit flavors and a slight amount of tannin. It's drinkable now.
title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2013  Bourgogne

description: From organically grown fruit, this is a soft, lemon- and pear-flavored wine. It has plenty of fresh acidity as well as a warm, full-in-the-mouth character. The aftertaste brings out touches of vanilla as well as the acidity.
title: Domaine Philippe Goulley 2012  Petit Chablis

description: All tangy fruit, this wine was fermented in stainless steel to keep the freshness of the fruit. It is crisp and lively, full of apple and pink-grapefruit flavors with a clean, bright aftertaste. Drink from mid-2016.
title: Henry Fessy 2014 Sous la Roche  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This is soft, rounded and light. Baked apples and a creamy texture come with a refreshing burst of acidity tempered by a lightly toasty character. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Louis Chevallier 2013  Bourgogne

description: This smooth, soft wine is light and fruity. It has some tannins although fresh berry fruit and perfumed acidity are what characterize this wine. Immediately attractive, it's a light wine from a light year, and is ready to drink now.
title: Maurice Ecard 2013  Bourgogne

description: This ripe, fruity wine has attractive acidity that's balanced with yellow fruit and apple notes. It shows a bright character, with some good intensity of flavor and a crisp, refreshing finish.
title: Moingeon NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This is a soft, gently fruity wine that has pure peach and apple flavors cut with crisp, fresh acidity. Intended to be consumed while young, it is bright and fresh with a caramel and spice element that lingers on the finish.
title: Nicolas Potel 2012  Mâcon-Villages

description: This soft wine features attractive citrus and creamed-apple flavors. It is round, full, lightly spicy and presents an easy, immediately drinkable character.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: This tangy wine with spice and acidity has kiwi and lime flavors that give a fresh character. The aftertaste is lightly perfumed. Drink now.
title: Jean-Christophe Perraud 2014  Mâcon La Roche Vineuse

description: Fresh, fruity and with a tight texture, this attractive wine has crisp acidity, lemon and lime flavors, and a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Nadine et Maurice Guerrin 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Produced from organic grapes from the plateau above the prestigious slopes of Chablis, this is a cool and fresh wine with plenty of citrus as well as acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Philippe Goulley 2014  Petit Chablis

description: This wine is structured with red fruits. It has a thin texture, a metallic character that is less pleasant. It needs more weight and richness.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2014 Aux Gravains Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is dry and smoky, with tannins that will allow it to age. The fruit, though, only hints at red berry fruits and should be more developed for a simple appellation wine such as this. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Santenay 2012 Vieille Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This fruity, light wine is full of red berries. The tannins are there, playing a supporting role to the intense fruitiness and acidity that's typical of the vintage. This wine will develop quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Belland 2013 Charmes  (Santenay)

description: Chorey vineyards, on the plain close to Beaune, often produce good-value wines. This attractive wine is a good example from an uneven vintage. It has structure and fruit, maybe not enough, along with a fresh, tangy character. It is developing fast, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Maillard 2013  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Attractive and fruity, this warm wine is crisp and fresh at the same time. Yellow fruits and tangy orange zest are complemented by minerality and a refreshing aftertaste. It is ready to drink.
title: Louis Chevallier 2014  Saint-Véran

description: This is a rounded and rich wine, packed with citrus fruits and delicious acidity. Lemon and orange-zest flavors balance well with the mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Cave de Lugny 2016 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Lugny)

description: This is a crisp, lightly wooded wine. Tangy texture and mineral acidity are part of the lively character of this still young, zesty bottling. Drink from 2018.
title: Clos des Rocs 2016 En Près Forêt  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: Crisp apple aromas lead to a spicy, yellow and melon-flavored wine. With its touches of vanilla and warm, ripe character, the wine is full and generous. Drink now.
title: Domaine Bernard Moreau 2016  Bourgogne

description: A crisp, tangy and mineral-driven wine, this is also ripe with generous citrus and apple flavors. The texture is still tight. which will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2016 La Belouse  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: Wood aromas and spice show strongly in this wine. On the palate, there is a toasty character that gives a bitter edge to the ripe red fruits. That needs to go, so wait to drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté  (Givry)

description: Showcasing the rich vintage, this is a generous fruit-driven wine. With red-berry flavors and plenty of acidity to balance, the wine is soft and juicy. Drink it from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: This large appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise can produce fruity wines like this. With red-berry fruits and light tannins, the wine has spice and crisp edge of acidity that comes from fruit that was just ripe, surprising in the rich 2015 vintage. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur Château Mi-Pont  (Mercurey)

description: This tangy, ripe and fruity wine is crisp with acidity. It's attractively brimming with fruit and ready to drink.
title: Louis Max 2016  Mâcon-Villages

description: This is a tight, textured wine, with plenty of acidity to balance the ripe fruit. It has the generous texture typical of the vintage and ripe yellow fruits, with an attractive crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Le Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is smooth, mature and rich with yellow fruits and a rounded texture. A hint of wood and spice has plenty of crisp acidity to balance. Drink now.
title: Marcel Couturier 2015 Les Longues Terres  (Mâcon-Loché)

description: The fruit here is pure, fresh with the merest hints of its future richness. The green fruits, citrus and acidity are prominent, with a hint of toast and a finishing line of minerality. It needs to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Vrignaud 2013 Les Vaupulans Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Made from 60-year-old vines from a property next door to Vosne-Romanée, this wine is both structured and rich. It has dark tannins, with juicy and jammy plum fruits that are layered with acidity. It is still firm, dense and needs time. Drink from 2020.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Aux Boudots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The Marconnets vineyard on the slopes above Savigny-lès-Beaune produces some of the most perfumed wines in the appellation. This is typical, a wonderful medley of juicy, fruity aromas. It is still young, although temptingly attractive now. Drink ideally from 2018.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This beautifully perfumed wine has rounded tannins finely integrated into the opulent red cherry fruit. It's already a delicious wine, juicy and fragrant, although still with a long future. If you can wait, drink it from 2018.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Pitures Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Closed up and just hinting at its great potential, this wine is showing tannins and a dry, solid core. Slowly it reveals delicious, opulent red berry fruits and concentrated texture. It needs a lot of time before drinking; wait until 2019.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: With its wonderful poise between dark structure and intensely fragrant fruit, this is firm, dry and packed with ripe blackberry fruits. It has great potential, as befits a concentrated wine from Vosne-Romanée, and is certainly not ready to drink before 2020.
title: Roche de Bellene 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Big, bold and cuddly, this wine's tannins are cushioned by the red berry fruit and attractive acidity. It has weight and a rich feeling, and the dry edge offers the possibility of aging. This small clos is exclusive to Jaffelin.
designation: Sur les Grèves Clos Saint-Anne Premier Cru
title: Jaffelin 2009 Sur les Grèves Clos Saint-Anne Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a closed, smoke-filled wine, and its tannins and toasty wood character currently dominate, which gives it a bitter edge. It has richness, with hints of juicy fruit that sit under the structure. Give it at least six years.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2009 Collection  (Corton)

description: Round, opulent and generous, this wine has yellow-fruit flavors that are paired with lime-like acidity, creating a balanced feel. The toast note is still showing strongly, and it needs a few years to settle.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Referts Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: Currently dominated by tannins, this wine is rich and structured, and it demonstrates the potential of its huge fruit and weight. The final note of this age-worthy wine is smokiness from wood aging.
title: Domaine Champy 2010  Corton-Rognet

description: This wine shows the structured side of Gevrey-Chambertin. The vineyard is situated at the opening of a small side valley, a location that allows the grapes to ripen slowly. This is elegant and structured, and it's full of solid tannins as well as cherry and red berry flavors. Age this for 7–8 years.
title: Albert Bichot 2010 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This is a rich, rounded wine, yet it also expresses a tight texture and nervy acidity. The toast influence is still dominating, although the fruitiness of this ripe selection is also showing. With its weight and structure, this is a prime candidate to age for several years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Crisp and elegant in feel, this has apricot and peach flavors that are balanced by the tight structure and the green-fruit-like acidity. The layers of toast have integrated with the ebullient fruit character and the taut, minerally finish. For aging 3–4 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Dents du Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: With plenty of tannins balanced by ripe fruits, this is a concentrated, dark wine. It is rich with density and weight. The red-berry flavors are developing. Drink this wine, with its good potential, from 2019.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2014 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Attractively perfumed, this rich wine offers some dark tannins as well as forward black-currant fruits. The wood aging is still showing in the burnt toastiness of the wine, although this will diminish, leaving a broad wine packed with fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 La Bondue Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Packed with red fruits, this wine has great potential, with attractive wild-strawberry fruits that are fresh and perfumed. Behind this fruitiness, the wine is tight and structured. It will be round, rich and ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Coucherias Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A normal five-barrel production was cut to two because of hail. This wine is firm, with hints of the generosity of the appellation waiting behind the dry texture. It's structured, with acidity and plum skins that will take some time. Drink from 2019.
title: Alex Gambal 2014  Volnay

description: This is a juicy wine, packed with red fruits. It has acidity along with an edge of tannins. The attractive fruitiness suggests the wine will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2014 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Old vines planted in a small parcel at the base of the Corton hill give this ripe and rich wine. Full of jammy fruit, it has structure as well as strawberry and red-cherry flavors, packed with juiciness that comes from the acidity. This wine has a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Les Brunettes et Planchots  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This tangy, perfumed single-vineyard wine also has some ripe fruit. A zesty character dominates at this early stage, leaving room for richer yellow fruits to come through in time. The wine has good potential, so wait until 2017 to drink.
title: Jean Rijckaert 2014 Les Bouthières  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has both structure and ripe red-plum fruits. It is dark and dense, solid and with good acidity. A clear line of freshness promises a good future. This needs time, so don't drink before 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This ripe and full wine has hints of toast and baked bread along with rich apricot and peach flavors. The texture is warm while the aromatic aftertaste is immediately attractive.
title: Marcel Couturier 2014 Le Clos Reyssie  (Pouilly-Fuissé)
