description: Smooth and round, this wine is made from grapes that were sourced from the southernmost vineyards of the Côte d'Or. It has a soft, rich and fruity character that shows citrus and white peach flavors, plus a pineapple hint. As it opens, it becomes opulent and full bodied.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2010 Les Charmes Dessus  (Santenay)

description: An elegant yet ripe wine, this comes laced with citrus acidity, and the yellow fruit and melon flavors give it a sense of richness. It's lively and crisp, and it has a toasty base. Age it for 3–4 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Clos Saint-Marc Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: While this wine has the crispness of Chablis, it also has weight and concentration. The bright green-apple flavor is underpinned by a sense of minerality. Nervy, tense yet fruity, this can age for 2–3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Firm and powerful, this tannic wine has dense black-fruit flavors, with enough fruitiness to balance the structure. The finish shows a smoky character, a bitter cherry flavor and bright acidity.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2010 Collection Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a structured wine, firmly tannic and with considerable wood flavors at this stage. Plenty of rich fruit lies in the background, giving promise for the future. With those red berry flavors and fine acidity in place, this will be a solid, dense wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2012 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This full-bodied wine has swathes of ripe yellow fruits and juicy wood and acidity. Under this opulent surface, a more steely character gives the wine structure that will allow it to age. It will be ready to drink by 2016.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012  Meursault

description: This is a gloriously juicy wine, full of melon, apricot and the brightest citrus flavors. This fruit salad is given structure by the wood and the tangy, zesty edge. It drinks well now, still young and fresh, but will be better aged. Drink from 2016.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2012 Rabourcé Premier Cru  (Rully)

description: This is a smoky, obviously wood-aged wine. The fruit is dominated by the high toast flavors needing time to integrate into the blueberry fruit flavor. That will happen, allowing this crisp, balanced wine to shine. Drink from 2020.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Clos Jus Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: A selection from a single plot of 40- to 70-year-old vines, this full-bodied wine is juicy with a tight texture that comes from the terroir. It offers a crisp edge as well as bright acidity, the apple fruits lifted further by a lemon streak. Drink from 2019.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wood-aged wine comes from a single vineyard in Mercurey. It is lightly toasty with touches of apricot, a crisper edge of citrus and a mineral aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Le Closeau  (Mercurey)

description: Citrus aromas reveal this wine's essentially crisp character. Plenty of acidity balances the rich white fruits while the mineral texture adds bite to this well-made wine. It will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Garenne  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine comes from a new appellation at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune. It is a blend of different premier cru vineyards to give a juicy raspberry flavored. Tannins show a solid dry background to the attractive perfumed fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2016 Premier Cru  (Maranges)

description: Firmly tannic and structured this is a young wine that will need time to soften. It has the foursquare character that is often found in Nuits Saint-Georges. The fruit weight is there, promising a ripe red-fruit future. The wine should be ready from 2020.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a delicious, crisp wine full of minerality, acidity and a zesty texture. Tight and lively, it offers citrus and green-plum fruitiness with a hint of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers  (Mâcon-Milly Lamartine)

description: From a mix of purchased grapes and the Laroche domaine, here is a ripe wine with swathes of yellow fruit, very approachable and warm. Rich and full in the mouth, it has a dense texture that supports the generous fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Mont de Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From this premier cru that is furthest down the slope of Puligny and close to the village, this ripe and generous wine sums up 2013 whites in Burgundy. With just a touch of honey, it has a rich character with yellow fruit flavors, cut with lemon and lime freshness. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 Les Enseignères Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: La Chablisienne owns the major part of the Grenouilles Grand Cru, centered on a winery called Château Grenouilles. This wine is powerful and still very young. It has weight and structure along with ripe, generous fruits that are typical of this vineyard. Touched by vanilla from wood aging, it is balancing out now. Drink from 2018.
title: La Chablisienne 2012 Grenouilles Grand Cru Château Grenouilles  (Chablis)

description: Round and ripe, this is a wine with generous, opulent fruits and touches of spice from wood aging. Plenty of yellow fruit and sliced apple flavors mingle with the mineral texture and fragrant acidity. With its power and richness still to develop, it's a wine to age, needing at least until 2018.
title: Henri de Villamont 2013  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Ripe and rounded, this has rich acidity balanced by a touch of yellow fruit. Still young, it has a flinty character that will soften and fill out. Intense, pure and with great fruitiness, it will be best from 2017.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2013 Drouhin-Vaudon Mont-de-Milieu Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: From 80-year-old vines, this wine is named after current winemaker Fabien Moreau's grandfather. It's a concentrated, dense wine that is very well structured. Tight, almost shocking acidity is supported by the strong fruit character as well as the fragrant, perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
designation: Vaillons Premier Cru Cuvée Guy Moreau
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2013 Vaillons Premier Cru Cuvée Guy Moreau  (Chablis)
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: This is a round, rich and soft style of Chardonnay. It feels generous, and its yellow fruit flavor pushes through the acidity. It slowly opens to reveal complex tropical-fruit notes, and it will develop further, so give it another four years.
designation: Le Clos Blanc Grèves Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2010 Le Clos Blanc Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a rich, rounded wine, yet it also expresses a tight texture and nervy acidity. The toast influence is still dominating, although the fruitiness of this ripe selection is also showing. With its weight and structure, this is a prime candidate to age for several years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Charmes Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: Crisp and elegant in feel, this has apricot and peach flavors that are balanced by the tight structure and the green-fruit-like acidity. The layers of toast have integrated with the ebullient fruit character and the taut, minerally finish. For aging 3–4 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Dents du Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: A rich, spicy wine, this shows flavors of new wood and ripe yellow fruit. The concentrated palate reveals juicy pear and peach juice flavors and a tight, minerally structure. Dense vineyard planting and 35-year-old vines bring out extra intensity and complexity.
title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Les Chenevottes Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The grapes to make this rich, ripe wine were sourced from vines that were planted in the 1980s. The vineyard, which is located next to Bonnes Mares, yields wines that have an open, generous style, plus elements of structure that lend aging potential. Ready to drink in two years, but it should age well for many more.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2010 Les Véroilles  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: With its firm tannins and structure, this is a wine that's made in the traditional Nuits-St.-Georges style. But it's also packed with ripe red fruit, and it has a jammy character and an open feel. There is no doubt that this is a wine to age for at least five years.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a wood-aged style of Chablis, but the toast has been applied discreetly. Rich, full bodied and structured, this wine is full of ripe yellow-fruit, spice and red apple flavors. Its acidity makes this a juicy expression.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Vaudésir Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: A sweet cherry aroma sets the scene for this fruity, firmly structured wine. The juicy red-berry fruit is balanced by a smoky tannic character. This will be a pleasure to drink in a year, and it can also age longer.
title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Volnay)

description: With grapes from long contracted growers, this wine represents the structure as well as the ripe fruit of the appellation. It imparts a smoky character from wood aging as well as a tense layer of tannins that give it a dry edge. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: From the village just west of Puligny-Montrachet, this is ripe, round and creamy. A good value for white Burgundy, it shows a touch of wood and a generous character. Its acidity and fruit are already well in balance. Drink from late 2017.
designation: Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Maison Champy 2015 Les Murgers des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Dusty aromas and spice notes introduce this robustly tannic wine with red-berry and currant flavors. A touch of acidity adds freshness to the fruitiness on the finish. It's a wine with potential, so drink from 2016.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2011 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Spicy and aromatic, this is a wine with great acidity and structure to complement delicious red fruits. The palate has weight, richness and a firm texture, with hints of the wood aging that will need to integrate before drinking. Drink from 2016.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Clos de Verger  (Pommard)

description: There is an animal, undergrowth character to this wine, along with a foursquare, solid structure. The wine has power and is developing slowly, with the dry outer skin concealing the fruit potential underneath. Drink from 2017.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Les Murgers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A racy wine, juicy, fresh and fruity. The lively red fruits are totally dominant. There is structure, but it is the delicious fruit that speaks.
designation: Beaune Grèves Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Beaune Grèves Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The first mouthful reveals a wine that is just plain opulent and rich. Only on the second taste do dense tannins push their way in, a structure that is concentrated, dry and tight. The fruit flavors are also forward, strawberry juice touched with cranberry juice dryness. This could age well, give it 4–5 years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Solid and concentrated, this wine initially is tight, showing minerality as well as rich fruit. The dark tannins then open to reveal sweetness, ripe strawberry jelly as well as soft acidity and licorice. A big wine that will evolve over the next several years.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a wine that gives acidity and ripeness at the same time. The color is light, but there is good concentration, great aromatic character and lively red berry fruits.
title: Domaine François Lamarche 2006  La Grande Rue

description: With smoky aromas, this starts out as an enticing wine. On the palate, the fruit is surprisingly soft for a Nuits-St-Georges, with the wine's evident structure showing an open character, edged with wood and red plum and currant flavors. The dry tannins give shape, but do not dominate this big wine.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2006 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Big, tannic and foursquare, this is archetypal Pommard. The dark plum and black fig flavors and the rich tannins all contribute to a wine that is solid, concentrated, dense and needs at least four years' aging.
title: Maison Champy 2006 Grands Epenots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Raspberries with hints of cranberry dominate this juicy but structured wine. This is a wine that shows a very elegant style, certainly not forceful, but deliciously direct.
designation: Clos de la Barre Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2006 Clos de la Barre Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: An intensely perfumed, almost exotic wine. The fruit is ripe, rich, packed with black cherries, spice and concentration. It is big on structure, a powerhouse of a wine, surprisingly dense for 2006.
title: Domaine d'Eugenie 2006  Echézeaux

description: Power from black fruits and dense tannins, create very intense wine. The fruits are sweet, the color big and dark. But in the end, it works, with an elegance showing through the richness.
title: Domaine d'Eugenie 2006  Grands-Echezeaux

description: The Dumont family's wine from multiple parcels is ripe, full of spice and rich yellow fruits. Peach and pineapple flavors are lifted by zesty lime that cuts through the richness. Drink from 2017. The family also rents the 16th-century Massey château.
title: Demessey 2014 Clos des Avoueries  (Mâcon-Cruzille)

description: High-toast aromas from the wood aging are followed on the palate by more layers of toast and spice. Behind this wood and tannin there is plenty of the ripe, soft fruit that is more typical of this appellation. The wine will fill out and give some generous fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Aux Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Attractive spice and green-fruit aromas lead to this fresh, ripe wine. Touches of wood give a spicy buttery taste that contrasts easily with the flavors. Fruity with a light mineral character, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine A. Machard de Gramont 2014 Les Houillères  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, lifted by a shot of acidity. Fragrant yellow fruits and crisper lime are attractively in balance. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Deux Roches 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: A rich, ripe while still mineral wine, this is concentrated and dense with fruit. It has a good texture as well as a layer of toast that gives extra depth. The wine has spice and a stylish, crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine has structure, typical of this appellation, as well as dark black fruits and rich tannins. Acidity cuts through this ripeness, bringing in freshness. Spice and an attractive perfume come along at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Tense and structured, this is a firm, concentrated wine from the top vineyard in the appellation. It has tight acidity as well as red-currant flavors. The structure is still firm and condensed, and the wine will need time. It has potential; drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Attractive spice and toast aromas add richness to this wine. They lie over the ripe white-stone-fruit flavors that are freshened by citrus. It is still too young to be fully integrated, so wait until 2017 to drink this wine.
title: Marcel Couturier 2014 Le Bourg  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: From grapes close to Volnay, this is a ripe, strawberry jam and red-plum-flavored wine. It has soft tannins, juicy acidity and an attractive, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Alex Gambal 2014 Cuvée des Deux Papis  (Bourgogne)

description: This bio wine comes from just over one acre of vines in the appellation's best iron-red terroir. It is ripe and creamy, full of smooth apple-purée fruitiness. A good squeeze of lemon juice gives the wine its crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bret Brothers 2014 Climat Les Mûres  (Pouilly-Loché)

description: This wine is spicy, fruity and immediately attractiv with ripe yellow fruits as well as acidity and zesty lime. Balanced and refreshing, this lively wine is ready to drink.
title: Christophe Cordier 2014  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: From three plots holding 75-year-old vines, this wine offers yellow fruits, apples and crisp pears. Plenty of fresh acidity gives it a crisp character, while the ripe fruit makes it refreshing and very ready to drink.
title: Nicolas Maillet 2014 Le Chenin Blanc  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: The purity of fruit is the most striking aspect of this wine. While it is relatively light in texture, it revels in its fresh red-fruited character that gives an impressive intensity. With balanced touches of tannin and acidity, the wine should age well.
title: Domaine Emmanuel Giboulot 2009 Lulune  (Beaune)

description: Based in Nuits Saint-Georges, Aegerter has its own domaine around the town. This wine, with its new wood and spice flavors, is balanced with red-berry fruits and soft tannins. It will develop well and should be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Full and round, this wine is fruity while smooth and rich. A layer of crisp acidity is surrounded by the generous white and yellow fruits, accented by a touch of toast and spice. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014  Meursault

description: Ripe and juicy, this dense wine offers red-fruit flavors shot through with acidity. The old vines give depth to the rich wine that finishes with layers of bright fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: Vines situated in the heart of the village give this wine its ripe, generous berry flavor. The tannins, while firm, are integrated into the bold fruitiness. This round while structured wine has good acidity to balance the richness. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Chambolle-Musigny

description: This wine is structured and firm, with some bitterness. Acidity and red-currant fruits bring out the freshness of the year while still needing time to develop. The wine is concentrated and tight at the end. It will take time to be ready, so don't drink before 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A soft wood- and almond-flavored wine. It misses fresh fruit, instead offering a rounded, ripe character that suggests it is not for aging.
title: Domaine Corine Perchaud 2009 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: With old vines from a single vineyard, this wine has some good weight and concentration. Ripe peach and pineapple flavors are supported by a touch of spice as well as a warm finish. Screwcap.
title: Cave de Lugny 2009 Les Charmes  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A simple, white fruited wine. Its texture is light, bright, the acidity coming from a touch of wood and apple and cream fruits. Easy drinking, ready to go.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2010 Au Brûlé  (Saint-Véran)

description: Vinified in the soft, opulent style of Chambolle, this is ripe and round. With its dry edge and rich fruit, the structure of the apparent is apparent. The acidity cuts through to give a juicy element. Already delicious to drink, but it's worth aging over 2–3 years.
title: Domaine Heresztyn 2010  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Full of very ripe fruit, this is soft and smooth at the beginning, before showing a firmer structure. It has a plum flavor and ripe acidity. With its superrichness and roundness, this is likely to be ready to drink soon.
title: Domaine Perrot-Minot 2010 La Rue de Vergy  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This demonstrates a good balance between minerality and ripe pineapple and apricot fruits. With a twist of lemon and an herb accent, it has both crispness and richness.
title: Henri de Villamont 2009 Les Hautés  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: Underneath the austere exterior, there's a fruity character, with layers of citrus, kiwi and white peach flavors, along with the richness from having been aged in wood. Cellar this taut, minerally and structured wine for 2–3 years.
title: Château Vitallis 2010  Mâcon-Fuissé

description: Very minerally in character, this wine has only a touch of wood, showing attractive acidity, citrus fruits and a tight, nervy texture.
designation: Murger des Dents de Chien Premier Cru
title: Domaine Vincent Girardin 2010 Murger des Dents de Chien Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Soft and rounded, this has a raspberry flavor and a fine, full feel. It has the tannic structure of the vintage, which fits into the sumptuous, cushioned texture.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2010  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: This intensely young wine holds considerable potential. Weight and rich fruits are still developing alongside the firm, mineral and steel structure. It's impressively rich, packed with green fruits and laced with citrus. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Louis Moreau 2010 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: The most serious of the Chablis Grand Crus has produced here a wine that combines that firmer nature with generous yellow fruits, toast and tender acidity. A strong sense of structure partners with a steely core and mineral texture that firms up the fruit and promises aging. Drink from 2017.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Impressively rich, this is smooth, dense and opulent in its concentration. It's full both of fresh acidity and toasty rich flavors that fill the mouth. The background is the steely texture that gives the wine a fine bite at this young stage. Drink from 2019.
title: La Chablisienne 2011 Les Preuses Grand Cru  (Chablis)

description: Already beautiful, this comes from an estate that's managed by Louis Jadot in Puligny-Montrachet, always producing fine wines. It's smooth and toasty, although it is already showing ripe yellow fruits and fragrant acidity. Although drinkable now, it really needs to age, so keep until 2018.
designation: Domaine Duc de Magenta Clos de la Garenne Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2012 Domaine Duc de Magenta Clos de la Garenne Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This wine is ripe, full of yellow fruits and soft acidity. It's creamy and ripe, but cut with orange zest and a mineral texture. It will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Meursault

description: This tangy young wine is shot through with a steely, mineral texture that will soften to give a more rounded and ripe wine. It likely always will retain that attractive, tangy edge. Drink from 2017 for it to be at its best.
title: Nicolas Maillet 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: From vines averaging 60 years of age in Jurassic chalky clay, this ripe, buttery wine has plenty of ripe apples, pears and a generous texture. An attractive touch of toast adds to the complexity. Drink now.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Clos de la Maison  (Saint-Véran)

description: Crisp and tangy, this is a tightly knit wine. Apples and crisp citrus flavors are part of a package that also includes spice, a strong minerality and a perfumed aftertaste. The wine should age a few more months, so drink from 2017. This is a “village” wine in the northern Maçon area.
title: Pierre Merguey 2014  Mâcon-Uchizy

description: Biodynamically grown grapes give pure red fruits, with fresh berry flavors that are shot through with acidity. It has a generous feel, with a crisp texture that gives the necessary lift. Drink from 2017.
title: Alex Gambal 2014 Picotins  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Tight and crisp, it has a mineral character. Nervy acidity combines with lemon and apple skin flavors, giving a fresh, textured wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Ferraud et Fils 2012 Le Chai des Platanes  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: This attractive wine has good acidity as well as attractive red berry fruits. It's ready to drink with its soft fruitiness and light tannins.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2011  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: Crisp, very light and fruity, this is an attractive, ready-to-drink wine. A touch of acidity at the end gives freshness.
title: Les Héritiers du Comte Lafon 2012  Mâcon-Milly Lamartine

description: Strong wood aromas follow through to the wood-dominated palate. The juiciness comes from wood as much as from the ripe apricot fruits. It's a wine that needs to integrate better, hopefully from 2015.
title: Maison Champy 2012  Saint-Véran

description: A perfumed wine, it has a smooth texture contrasting with tight acidity. It's light, fruity and still needs a little time to develop. The soft tannins don't suggest long aging. Drink from 2016.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2011 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: Once the sulfur aromas from recent bottling blow over, the wine shows ripe fruit with a soft texture. Pear and yellow fruits are going to come through in a few months. Drink from 2015.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2012  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The wine is closed, but has potential. At the moment, the wood and texture dominate, but there are signs of ripe apple and pear fruits that will come through in a few months. Wait until the end of 2014.
title: Collovray et Terrier 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Véran)

description: The wine is structured and still firm, showing tight tannins and acidity over the red fruits. A cool edge elicits the fresher character of the fruits. Drink from 2016.
title: Domaine Jean Petitot et Fils 2011 Les Vignottes  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: This Premier Cru vineyard lies north of the Grand Crus, with a west-facing exposure. It has yielded a wine with soft, generous floral character, ripe yellow fruit and a crisp, mineral edge. Finely sculpted and ageworthy, it will be best from 2019.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This refreshing wine comes from one of the Premier Cru sites on the north-facing bank of the Serein river. It's structured, tight and full of fine acidity and grapefruit and crisp apple flavors. Its texture and mineral character will allow it to age. Drink from 2019.
title: La Chablisienne 2014 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: Barrel fermentation and aging have given this wine its ripe character. They have filled it out with spiciness, adding complexity to the yellow fruit and maturing acidity. It's not going to age much further but is very fine to drink now.
title: Nicolas Potel 2012  Corton-Charlemagne

description: Very rich for any Burgundy, this is plump with ginger and pepper as well as yellow fruits. The acidity has been diminished by the ripe fruit, although the wine still has a crisp aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Cave des Grands Crus Blancs 2015  Pouilly-Loché

description: This is a gentle and attractively fruity wine. Ripe and full, it also has a sense of tangy structure and citrus juice. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from summer 2017.
title: Domaine de la Denante 2015  Mâcon-Davayé

description: This wine is from the home vineyard of the Larochette family. It has produced a ripe, still young wine that is full of yellow fruits. Hints of butter and vanilla add a rich dimension to this full-bodied wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine Fabrice Larochette 2015 Le Château de Chaintré  (Mâcon Chaintré)

description: There is an attractive, smoky touch of wood in this perfumed wine. It has spice, balanced tannins with fine acidity. The wine is still young, showing the wood more strongly than it will in a year's time. Drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 La Créole  (Côte de Nuits-Villages)

description: Old vines in the Côte de Beaune and the Côte Chalonnaise to the south give this wine concentration. It has juicy apricot and green-plum flavors that are spiced lightly with the wood aging. It is a crisp wine that is ready to drink.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: The wine is ripe with lime and lemon flavors. It is textured, full of fruit and with a good touch of minerality and concentration from the old vines. There is a good cut of acidity to give the wine its proper freshness. Drink from 2017.
title: Pascal Bouchard 2015 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis)

description: Produced from vines in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this is an attractively cool wine. It has lively acidity and a crisp mineral texture. With its white-fruit flavors, it is a wine with weight as well as crispness. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This dense wine has a strong sense of dry tannins as well as red-berry acidity. It is balanced, in keeping with the cherry and strawberry fruits. The acidity, cutting through, keeps the wine bright and fruity. The end is strawberry jam with attractive acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Latour 2012 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This ripe wine comes from organic vineyards in the village of Brochon, next to Gevrey-Chambertin. It shows plenty of structure, a tantalizing smoky character from wood aging and juicy red fruit character. This will be a delicious wine to drink from 2018.
title: David Duband 2014  Côte de Nuits-Villages

description: This wine is fat, fruity and creamy, with just a touch of minerality. Its ripe fullness lends plenty of depth and concentration, within a lightly structured frame. Drink from 2018.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2015 Vaillons Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This Chardonnay's acidity and minerally structure are finely balanced, and its palate already shows richness. Full, fruity and textured, the wine's touch of toast creeps into notice. This is worth aging for 2–3 years.
title: Joseph Faiveley 2010  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A dense, firm selection, this has layers of red fruits and acids that help to give the wine's skeleton some flesh. This is likely to develop into a rich, but always firm, wine.
title: Louis Jadot 2010  Pommard

description: This wine has a crisp, steely texture. The apple and citrus flavors and the wood underlay make this a food-friendly selection.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010  Saint-Romain

description: Smooth and rich, this wine is made from fruit that's sourced from 65-year-old vines. It has fresh acidity that gives a bright quality to the ripe fruit. For an entry-level Bourgogne, this has complexity and weight.
title: Roche de Bellene 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Big and tannic, while at the same time potentially rich and smooth, this is, as always, an impressive wine. It has weight and dense texture. A solid wine that shows great potential; for now, revel in the plum juice and final acidity that provide a bright counterpoint to the solid, brooding structure.
title: Clos de Tart 2007  Clos de Tart

description: Tannic and structured, chunky in style and texture. There are smoky flavors, acidity, berry fruits and black cherries as well as richness. There is a certain severity here, the wine passing through a firm stage before developing further complexity. Age for another six years.
title: Domaine Michel Lafarge 2006 Clos des Chênes Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: A big, rounded wine, its acidity a foil to the ripe fruit and dusty texture. The structure is chunky and corpulent, the fruit strawberry and red plum fruit packed tightly. It is still integrating, definitely promising some long-term aging.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2007  Charmes-Chambertin

description: Dark colored, highly perfumed wine, packing rich fruit with its ripe, chunky structure. Black berries give a juicy character, taming the acidity, and allowing the wood smoke to wreath around the wine. Age for at leasy six years, but this can withstand more.
title: Maison Champy 2008  Mazis-Chambertin

description: The Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus is a 10-acre parcel in the heart of the Grèves vineyard that once belonged to Carmelite nuns. This vintage, while marked by acidity and soft fruit, does have a firm edge of dark tannins, filled out with plum and red cherry flavors.
designation: Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2008 Vigne de l'Enfant Jésus Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Initially, the red fruits dominate, exploding in the mouth. Then the tannins take over, giving a wine that is hugely structured and powerful. The fruits, though, are as impressive as the tannins, the combination giving a wine that is both juicy and smoky, finished with new wood.
title: Domaine Parent 2006 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: The tannins set the scene with their firm character and solid structure. Licorice and bitter coffee flavors follow, and only then do the fruits come in. Black cherries are firm and ripe, with black plum skin texture. The wine is very concentrated and powerful. Give it four years or more.
title: Louis Jadot 2006 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This dark wine is still full of young tannins from a cool, east-facing vineyard. The red-berry fruit is beginning to show through, crisp and tight with considerable acidity. The wine will take time to develop and will not be ready before 2019.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This comes from the northern end of the line-up of Premier Crus, which shows in the lively, crisp and tightly fruity character of the wine. It is developing slowly, still controlled and with light hints of toast. It will be a beautiful, bright wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Philippe Colin 2014 Les Chaumées Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: This stony, mineral wine is still way behind in its development. It is crisp and tight in texture, with refreshing acidity that lifts the white fruits with lime highlights. It's a full wine that will develop well. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Cailleret Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: The vineyard is high up the slope, giving this wine that has good acidity and crispness. The acidity is light and bright, while the texture is concentrated and mineral. It is going to develop as a fine, ripe wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Sous le Puits Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is full and fruity with great swathes of smoky tannins. Structured and concentrated, it promises a good future. Strawberry and red-plum flavors are there, along with the darker tannic element. Drink from 2019.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Peuilletes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is one of a trio of single-vineyards bottlings from this producer. It comes from the village of Fuissé and is situated in a small valley. Elegant and perfumed, the touch of wood aging enhances the white-fruit flavor. The aftertaste is juicy while also ripe. Drink from 2017.
title: Château de Fuissé 2014 Les Combettes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine comes from a one-acre parcel on the Corton hill. It is dense and dark both in color and in black-fruit flavors. Concentrated from the 50-year-old vines, it is firm with tannins and solid with rich fruitiness. The wine needs time; drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2014 Le Rognet  (Corton)

description: This is a big, ripe and bold wine full of red fruits and fine tannins. Crisp red currant outlines the ripe wild-strawberry flavors. It shows good balance between young tannins and the generous texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Echézeaux

description: This is a smooth and rounded wine that has a fine kick of acidity to keep it crisp. With toast and lemon juice blending well together, the wine is rich while also showing a mineral texture. This is a refreshing delicious wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2014  Meursault

description: This wine comes from a steeply sloping vineyard just above the town of Nuits Saint-Georges. It is richly structured and dense with plenty of ripe fruits and acidity. The wood aging has softened the young fruitiness to give a balanced and layered wine that will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Les Crots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a newly created estate of 27 acres based in the twin villages of Viré and Clessé. It is attractive—full of apple and pear fruits and with a balanced touch of acidity. The fruitiness and crisp acidity make the wine drinkable young. With its tangy tangerine aftertaste, the wine is ready.
title: Domaine le Virolys 2015  Viré-Clessé

description: This is a ripe impressive style of Pouilly. It has all the right minerality along with a rich texture plus melon and yellow fruits. With concentration and acidity in equal measure, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Trouillet 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: The texture and structure of this wine may be light but the fruitiness is so appealing. Soft and ripe with red-berry fruit flavors and refreshing acidity, it will develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Maurice Ecard 2013 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Fresh, light, creamy Chardonnay, just a touch of vanilla with crisp, clean green fruits. There is an attractive touch of spice to round the wine off.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2006  Petit Chablis

description: Tight green apple and citrus acidity dominates this wine. It is very crisp, at this stage too crisp, and the structure is on the lean side. It certainly reflects the cool growing conditions of 2007.
title: Domaine Pommier 2007 Côte de Léchet Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: This was a good year in Chablis, a breath of freshness after the impressive, powerful 2005, but a vintage that still has weight and intensity. This Chablis shows all that, with an extra dimension of spice, nuts and a tight apple-skin structure leading to a fresh finish.
title: Domaine Pommier 2006  Chablis

description: Smooth and round, this wine has bright acidity, tempered by the toast and sweet apricot flavors. It has a structured core, and it finishes with the acidity. Age this for 2–3 years.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: This is an attractive, fruity wine, produced in Meursault. It is fresh with lemon and tangy orange-zest flavors. A light tannic texture adds an edge to the fresh fruit.
title: Charles Duret NV Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: This sparkling wine has a smooth, creamy mousse and perfumed apple and pink-grapefruit fruitiness. Light minerality gives texture, enhanced by the bright, crisp acidity and aftertaste.
title: Charles Duret NV  Crémant de Bourgogne

description: Produced from old vines grown on the property, this fruity wine is packed full of red berries. It is well balanced between fruitiness and acidity, with just a light touch of tannin to give this ready-to-drink wine its shape.
title: Château de Santenay 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: The small village of Chânes lies in the south of the appellation, well exposed to the sun. That shows in this warm wine with its ripe apple and pear flavor. Wood aging adds richness, filling out the rich fruits with toast. This generous wine will age another year. Drink from 2017.
title: Rijckaert 2014 Vers Chânes Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This concentrated, full-bodied wine has fine, ripe tannins and rich fruit. Red plums, juicy red currants and an generous, rich texture are all there. The structure at the end is firm while still integrated into the fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Baudes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This vineyard is at the heart of the fine run of premier crus that lie midway up the slope above the village. This wine is packed with fruit and also with intense acidity and minerality. It is already refreshing and crisp, although as the toastiness develops, it will become even more impressive. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Champgains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: This is a solid wine with its dark tannins and structure from a vineyard close to some of the greatest Grands Crus. It is concentrated, showing the density of the appellation. There is a basic richness to this wine with its ripe black fruits. It is developing slowly and has a fine future. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This wine has smoky wood and rich fruit already well in balance. It offers ripe acidity from its strawberry and red-currant fruits along with a rich texture. The wine is already delicious although it will develop much further. Drink from 2019.
title: Yves Giradin 2014 Les Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Supposedly set on an ancient burial ground, this vineyard is well placed halfway up the slope of Chassagne. It has almond and spice flavors as well as a tighter, steely texture. The wine, with its wood-aging flavors, is still developing. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 La Maltroie Premier Cru  (Chassagne-Montrachet)

description: From vineyards on the cooler south bank of the Serein, this wine is crisp and tightly coiled despite the warmth of the 2015 vintage. It's built on a backbone of sturdy minerality, fleshed out with crisp, citrus fruit, and will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils 2015  Chablis
winery: Domaine Christian Moreau Père et Fils

description: Vines from a number of growers on the lower slopes of Gevrey-Chambertin contribute to this wine. It has the plentiful tannins typical of the village yet also exudes attractive juicy red fruit. It will need another year or two to show its best, so drink from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This wine from the most northerly of the Côte d'Or appellations is a blend from multiple growers. It has red cherry and plum fruit with a fresh streak, typical of the vintage. Underlying firm tannins will sustain it as it ages. Drink from 2018.
title: Louis Jadot 2014  Marsannay

description: A blend of different parcels in Puligny-Montrachet, this creamy wine shows a medley of ripe fruit flavors, both yellow and tropical, and subtle toast from wood aging. Juicy acidity cuts through its richness, leading into a full aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Maison Champy 2015  Puligny-Montrachet

description: A firm wine from a cool vineyard. It is structured, dry and solid, the fruit dominated by tannins. There is an austere character here that obviously needs time to fill out. Give it five years.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2008 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A velvet-textured wine, relatively light because of the vintage, but oh-so tender, the tannins whispering behind the sweet fruits. This is regarded as the second wine of Clos de Tart Grand Cru and shows the same generous, plush character.
designation: La Forge de Tart Premier Cru
title: Clos de Tart 2007 La Forge de Tart Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: A solid wine, finely constructed, its chunky tannins blending well with the red-plum-juice flavors. The acidity is important, along with the tasty cherry texture. Age for 3–4 years.
title: Domaine des Perdrix 2008 Aux Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A firmly structured wine, perfumed with delicious fresh fruit, supported by densely solid tannins. Fresh cherry acidity cuts right through the texture. It has weight certainly, while the freshness suggests this could be drinkable within 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Henri Gouges 2008 Les Pruliers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: There is a rich texture, with black and red cherry fruits. The wine is dominated more by the dark and complex tannins that give a solid and firm base, and also show potential lusciousness.
title: Henri de Villamont 2008 Les Roncerets Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: For a Grand Cru from Vosne-Romanée, this is a wine on the light side, its tannins soft and dominated by new-wood flavors. That said, it is still a fine wine, packed with ripe fruit and fresh acidity. The structure floats over the fruit; a few months and it may fatten out.
title: Louis Latour 2008  Romanée-St.-Vivant

description: Bailly Lapierre regards this full-bodied rich Pinot Noir as its signature wine. It has a cool, northern feel to it, but it also has powerful red-berry fruits, a firm structure, a final layer of acidity and a sense this is a wine as well as a Crémant.
title: Bailly-Lapierre NV Pinot Noir Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Full and round, this wine is fruity while smooth and rich. A layer of crisp acidity is surrounded by the generous white and yellow fruits, accented by a touch of toast and spice. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014  Meursault

description: Ripe and juicy, this dense wine offers red-fruit flavors shot through with acidity. The old vines give depth to the rich wine that finishes with layers of bright fruit. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: This lively, crisp wine comes from a less than an acre of organically grown vines. It has big lemon and green-apple flavors as well as intense acidity that gives a juicy character. With its youthful freshness, it could do with a few more months to soften. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine de la Croix Senaillet 2014 Sur la Carrière  (Saint-Véran)

description: Attractive apple and pear aromas give this wine a fine start in this domaine's first vintage by François Lequin (Lequin-Colin) and Matthieu Ponson. That fruitiness follows through into the wine with its rich pear flavors. The acidity that flows naturally is balanced, hinting at a more textured core. This wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine des Crets 2014 L'Echenault de Serre  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: While it is not a premier cru, this wine conveys many of the precise red-fruit flavors of the Les Marconnets vineyard just below on the slope. It is finely perfumed, with the softness typical of the northern Beaune vineyards. Vivid strawberry and red-cherry fruits are already delicious and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Clos du Dessus des Marconnets  (Beaune)

description: This is no basic white Burgundy. With balanced wood aging and ripe fruit, it is rich and full in the mouth. It has tense acidity as well as an almost honeyed character. The wood fits well into this wine along with final acidity. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: There is as much fruit as structure in this wine. Ripe red fruits are supported by solid tannins while pushing out fragrant acidity. It has structure while also allowing room for final fruitiness.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: With rich tropical fruits and a ripe, opulent feel, this is a full-bodied wine. It has weight, layers of toast and apricot and peach flavors. Soft and round, it could be drunk now, although it would be best to wait until 2015.
title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2012 Ancestral  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: The wine has good acidity, crisp green and white fruits, and a bright citrus element. Fresh and fruity, it's ready to drink, with a light mineral texture already well integrated.
title: La Soufrandière 2012 Climat Les Quarts  (Pouilly-Vinzelles)

description: Smooth and fruity, it's full of citrus and ripe pear fruit. Structured and quite tangy, it has potential to improve through late 2014.
title: Les Héritiers du Comte Lafon 2012 Clos de la Crochette  (Mâcon-Chardonnay)

description: Toasty aromas go through to the palate, highlighting the wood aging. It is tense, mineral, packed with apple and lemon acidity. The aftertaste is equally crisp and bright.
title: Louis Latour 2012 Les Deux Moulins  (Saint-Véran)

description: Attractive red fruits and freshness combine to produce a lively, elegant wine with a light structure and complete fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Maison Champy 2011  Marsannay

description: Mango and peach aromas offer immediate attraction. With ripe fruits, light minerality and crisp acidity, it's almost ready to enjoy. Drink from the end of 2014.
title: Manoir du Capucin 2012 Clos de la Maison  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: This wine is structured, firm and has a mineral, tight texture. It also offers plenty of red apples, green plums and a touch of apricot. However, with its nervy edge the wine needs to age; drink from 2017.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2012 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: A textured and minerally wine, this is wine has plenty of citrus flavor. It is fruity and crisp, and it offers a touch of vanilla and lively acidity on the finish.
title: Maison Champy 2010  Saint-Romain

description: This is made using a selection of fruit that's sourced from both banks of the Serein River. It's a properly crisp Chardonnay, and it offers a white fruit flavor and a bright, lively finish.
title: Olivier Leflaive 2010 Les Deux Rives  (Chablis)

description: A soft, buttery wine, full and fat, that shows rich fruit flavors. Warm spice and toast wrap around apricot and pear fruits, light acidity well integrated. To drink now.
title: Maison Champy 2009  Rully

description: Full and soft, this is a ripe and creamy wine, with generous melon and rich apple fruits. It is already delicious, though simple.
title: Domaine du Chalet Pouilly 2009  Saint-Véran

description: Crisp, fresh sparkling wine, lightly creamy but more going towards green fruits, tight acidity. It doesn't need any bottle aging and really should be drunk in the next year to keep its essential freshness.
title: Manuel Olivier NV Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne)

description: Open, generous wine, the fruits showing round, white peach flavors dominant, with a crispening of lemon zest.
title: Vignerons des Terres Secrètes 2008 Les Grands Cheneaux  (Mâcon-Verze)

description: Bitter black cherries are the hallmark of this rather hard-edged wine. It shows dark tannins and fruit that misses full richness. Maybe it is restrained power, maybe it will age, but the balance is not there now.
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2005 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: While certainly ripe and fruity, this wine is also structured—its generosity tempered by intense acidity, crisp apple-skin notes and a mineral texture. The result is a full wine that needs a little time to soften. Drink from 2014.
title: Henri de Villamont 2010 Premier Cru  (Montagny)

description: The picturesque name of the wine, the vineyard where God sits, comes from a monopole—a walled property in the hills behind Beaune, wholly owned by the Château de Santenay. Ripe and smooth with an attractive, crisp texture, the wine is ready to drink. A touch of toast gives extra interest.
title: Château de Santenay 2012 Clos de la Chaise Dieu  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: Crisp and firmly structured, this wine is textured with acidity and minerality. The apple, pear and lime flavors are shot through with this steely character that is still integrating in this concentrated wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Ellevin 2014 Vaucoupin Premier Cru  (Chablis)

description: A generous wine, this is packed with red fruits as well as firmly structured. It conveys the fresh acidity of the year, with fine smoky tannins. It will be an impressive wine. Drink from 2020.
designation: Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)

description: A perfumed wine with red fruits, this offers dry tannins and a dense texture. With all these elements in place, the wine will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2021.
title: Tollot Beaut et Fils 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This will be a delicious, ripe and full wine. Already the red fruits and acidity are filling out the generous space left by the spicy wood. It has dark, smoky tannins and a rich character. Drink from 2019.
title: Jaffelin 2014 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Classically powerful and rich, this is a concentrated wine. With spice from the wood aging prominent, it is still young. That spice is balanced by the ripe yellow and baked-apple fruits. The aftertaste has delicious flavors of honey and lemon. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Corton-Charlemagne

description: With spice and layers of wood aging over the black-cherry fruit, this is a wine in progress. It has the bright character of the vintage, full of acidity and with the potential of great fruitiness. From the Vergennes sub-section of the Corton Grand Cru, it has a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Corton Vergennes

description: A level portion of this premier cru, called Les Plateaux, is the origin of this wine. As befits a wine from Nuits Saint-Georges, it is dark with tannins as well as fruit. It has a good structure, with dense blackberry and plum flavors that are developing. Give this wine until 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Damodes Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This concentrated, full-bodied wine has fine, ripe tannins and rich fruit. Red plums, juicy red currants and an generous, rich texture are all there. The structure at the end is firm while still integrated into the fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Baudes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This vineyard is at the heart of the fine run of premier crus that lie midway up the slope above the village. This wine is packed with fruit and also with intense acidity and minerality. It is already refreshing and crisp, although as the toastiness develops, it will become even more impressive. Drink from 2017.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Champgains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)

description: A rounded wine, benefiting from the fruitiness of the year to give soft tannins, ripe strawberry fruits and an attractive acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although could age a few months.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2011 Réserve  (Bourgogne)

description: This is wood laden, with sweet fruit that compensates for the toastiness. The oak element should integrate well in the next 2–3 years, making for a wine that's soft and sweetly fruity, with smoky acidity.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2010 Hauts Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This has a firm edge of tannins along with dense red fruits. It's structured and balanced, with the texture and acidity that suggest its aging potential. Give this 3–4 years.
title: Château Philippe-le-Hardi 2010 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Intense, rich and creamy, this effortlessly balances the wood influence with the apricot and white peach flavors. It demonstrates the opulence of the year while remaining structured. Developing well, this is almost ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2010  Montagny

description: Soft, round and perfumed, this has rich red fruits that are laced with youthful acids and tannins. With its texture, it has good aging potential; give it 4–5 years.
title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2010  Volnay

description: With its white fruit, lively acidity and delicious ripeness, this is very ready to drink. It's an opulent, rounded wine, with hints of spice to go with its fruit character.
designation: Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru
title: Bouchard Aîné & Fils 2009 Cuvée Signature Le Porusot Premier Cru  (Meursault)

description: A tight, tannic wine, showing considerable acidity as well as fresh red fruits. The wine is densely packed with dry tannins, then a fruity character develops, sparked by acidity.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2008 Les Borniques  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Crisp sparkling Burgundy, laced with taut acidity and hints of nuts and toast. This is a wine under tension, with a strong mineral element, cool and fresh, best with food.
title: Simonnet-Febvre 2007  Crémant de Bourgogne

description: Pure, ripe strawberry flavors are pierced with acidity. The texture is soft, with a dry side. The raspberry acidity cuts right to the end.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2008  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Soft, ripe and rich, this is very easy on the palate. The wine does have good depth of flavor from the rounded black cherry flavors, the fruit almost sweet in its openness. It is already delicious.
title: Louis Latour 2009 En Chevret  (Volnay)

description: Concentrated, with dark tannins to go with the ripe fruit. There is a tough edge to the wine, although it is more accessible than some Nuits-Saint-Georges at this stage.
title: Louis Latour 2009 Les Damodes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Aromas of ripe yellow fruits announce a wine that has rich fruit flavors of apricots touched by pineapple. It does have the attractive, nervy texture of 2008, along with an important layer of toast.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2008  Chassagne-Montrachet

description: A fresh, juicy wine, with attractive acidity, red berry flavors and a layer of well balanced tannins. Very perfumed, with hints of mineral and final acidity.
title: Camille Giroud 2008  Côte de Beaune-Villages

description: A powerful, chunky wine, packed with solid tannins that promise good aging. It has a sense of drama in its spice, dark tannins and spacious fruit. This is going to develop well over 5–10 years.
title: Henri de Villamont 2005  Grands-Echezeaux

description: A blend from several premier cru vineyards in Pommard, here is a wine that exhibits just the right firm but dusty tannins of the appellation. But because it is 2005, the natural exuberance of the fruit is also there, lively red berries under the dry structure. It needs some aging, but already the richness is there, along with a smoky aftertaste.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2005 Premier Cru  (Pommard)
